job_title_2: Director of Product and Test Engineering
job_description:
Job Description

Come join a creative team of engineers dedicated to designing the hardware technologies that network the leading cloud-service datacenters. We are looking for a motivated and astute individual to join our team as Director of Product and Test Engineering. You will be joining a close-knit team responsible for building the world's leading programmable Ethernet switches. Our organization works on all levels of ASIC development, starting from high-level architecture to low-level circuit design and high-volume manufacturing.

As the Director of Product and Test engineering, you will be responsible for leading a team to ensure the testability and manufacturability of integrated circuits from the component feasibility stage through production ramp. Your team will also oversee post-silicon characterization and electrical validation of the device to conformal to industry specifications and the product datasheet.

The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to clarify ambiguity
Clear, concise communication and a collaborative personality

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements
BSEE, BS Physics, or BS Solid State Engineering or Similar
10+ years of experience in Product, Test, Reliability, and/or DFT engineering
5+ years of experience in engineering management
Preferred Requirements
12 years of engineering management experience
Understanding of networking protocols and test methods
Knowledge of networking industry expectations with respect to quality and performance
Knowledge of specialized tests used in networking industry
Experience in background in DFT engineering, semiconductor processing, and product engineering
Understanding of Fault coverage engineering processes
Understanding of DFT methods including scan methodology and RAM test
Experience with and understanding of yield modeling, yield analysis, and yield improvement methodologies
Experience designing and/or managing high volume manufacturing semiconductor test methods
Defining Flows
Defining Hardware types and capabilities
Probe test methodologies
Package test methodologies
System Level Test methodologies
Hardware maintenance
Personnel - Training, managing and hiring
Understanding of current industry best practices
Experience with automation of semiconductor test Handlers
Software linkages and controls
Knowledge of documentation and controls necessary to run a stable test floor
Test program release protocols, yield triggers, software control,
Experience with Semiconductor Characterization methodologies
Experience with and understanding of Reliability models and methods
HTOL, FIT, Acceleration Factors, HW
Knowledge of Networking Industry Reliability expectations and requirements
Experience building and maintaining highly motivated teams
Inside this Business Group

The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance....

Position of Trust

This role is a Position of Trust. Should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended Background Investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, SEC sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. For internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. For additional questions, please contact your Recruiter....

job_description:
Are you passionate about AI and Machine Learning? Does the idea of building the AI/ML that will transform how trading, investments, and customer service is done, across the firm excite you? Then come and join us.
We are the AI Accelerator team at JP Morgan, a startup group with the goal of revolutionizing how Machine Learning and AI is done across the entire JP Morgan Chase. You will join the Product Management team and work alongside other leaders who have built and shipped AI and Machine Learning products at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, and Salesforce.
We are the AI Accelerator team at JP Morgan, a startup group with the goal of revolutionizing how Machine Learning and AI is done across the entire JP Morgan Chase. You will join the Product Management team and work alongside other leaders who have built and shipped AI and Machine Learning products at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, and Salesforce.

JPMorgan Chase (JPMC) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. JPMC has made a strategic decision to fundamentally transform its operations through the adoption of artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale. The AI Acceleration (AIX) team, headquartered in Palo Alto, is a new group tasked with achieving this vision. We’re hiring the best of the best from Silicon Valley to come join us.
To learn more about the AIX team and JPMC, please see this recent interview with our team leader and Global Head of AI, Apoorv Saxena.
Your Responsibilities:
Drive the infrastructure vision for AI Services and Solutions for AI Accelerator team
Partner with engineering team and TPM team to define product priorities
Identify the critical customer journeys for AI Services and Solutions
Construct and maintain a stack ranked product backlog
Attend customer meetings and conferences on a regular basis
Evangelize AI and Machine Learning across the firm


Requirements:
Minimum five years of experience in Product Management role
Minimum three years of experience shipping AI/ML or Analytics products
Ability to communicate the logic, reason, and priority of each CUJ
A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies
Ability to iterate on user stories and solutions efficiently and intelligently
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
A willingness to help and share knowledge with other team members.
An insatiable appetite for feedback and constructive criticism
The ability to anticipate needs and take required actions
Familiarity with Analytics, Big Data, and public Cloud technologies.
Strong project management capabilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong work ethic and the utmost attention to detail.
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Financial Engineering, Statistics, Data Science or related field



Preferred:

Previous product management experience in Public Cloud area
PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science
MBA from a top tier business school
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

job_description:
Position Summary
Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, atopic dermatitis and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, pain, cancer and infectious diseases.

Summary: Responsible to gather intelligence that will help identify strategic roadmap for technology megatrends, related partners and feasibility in the biopharma industry for a related area or discipline within IOPS (Industrial Operations & Product Supply). Will manage relationships with strategic partners and an IT Digital Products Team that will deliver innovative solutions at the incubator stage through operationalization of technology. This role is aimed at driving an autonomous business, reducing friction, increasing speed and mobility, and delivering insights that support IOPS teams.

Level to be determined based on qualifications relevant to the role

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Manages, coaches and develops members of the IT Digital Products Team.

Works with the site IT BRMs and the wider IT team to deliver a high-quality IT service and solution design to the business.

Serves as an innovation product leader and technology broker to the organization.

Leads team through breakthrough challenges, demonstrates a can-do and outcome-driven mindset.

Creates an incubator or proof of concept to test and learn technology in assigned spaces.

Works with Corporate IT, industry experts, consultants, strategic partners, and others to deliver the highest value innovative technology solutions to the business.

Provides high quality support to the System Owners and end-users to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction.

Maintains responsibility for system documentation developed by the team, including converting User Requirement Specifications to Detail Design Specification, writing Configuration Test Plans and summary reports, and configures reports as required.

Works with the Validation department to ensure new innovative solutions and technologies are evolved in a compliant and usable manner by Regeneron.

Drives a team with a DevOps, AGILE, or waterfall methodology depending on best fit for each innovation story.

Communicates status updates to upper management and customers.

Contributes to strategic vision and direction of the IT Digital Products Team.

Ensures employee training requirements are met and on time.

Drives continuous improvement mindset within direct report team and identifies areas within IT where he/she can leverage or share best practices.

Handles administrative duties related to managing a product team.

Up to 10% domestic and international travel expected
Knowledge and Skills:

Knowledge of IoT (Internet of Things, RPA (Robotic Process Automation), Cloud Services, Predictive Data Modeling, Sensors, ML (Machine Learning), AR (Augmented Reality), AI (Artificial Intelligence), Process Automation

Can comfortably facilitate discussions at all levels of the organization.

Excellent oral and written communication skills are required

Excellent interpersonal skills

Must exhibit strong judgment and time management skills

Strong customer service focus

Education and Experience:

Manager: Requires Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Engineering or Computer Sciences and 7 + years’ industry experience in Information Systems and Technology. Experience in a GMP manufacturing environment and experience in a biotech/pharma environment strongly preferred.

Senior Manager: Requires Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Engineering or Computer Sciences and 8+ years’ industry experience in Information Systems and Technology.

Experience with innovative and forward leading technologies and partners

Experience with IT Compliance guidelines as per GAMP 5

All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at Regeneron via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of Regeneron, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by Regeneron for this position and a valid agreement with Regeneron is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the Regeneron agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.
Regeneron is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
An important note about privacy: Regeneron is committed to your privacy and will not ask for sensitive personal information such as social security number, date of birth or bank account details via email or social media. We do not interview candidates on Google Hangouts. Any questions about job listings can be directed to candidatesupport@regeneron.com. We also do not hire for "at-home data entry" positions.

job_title_2: Sr Director Product Management - Data and Analytics - Remote working option
정리된 job_title: Sr Director Product Management - Data and Analytics
job_description:
Job Details
Description
About Us:

At Sunquest Information Systems Inc., we use industry knowledge and focus to develop solutions and services that meet the changing needs of our customers and the marketplace. We combine this vision with the dream to make our company a phenomenal place to work. From our smart casual dress policy to our flexible work schedules, Sunquest promotes a balance of life for all our employees. We place emphasis on training plans for new and current staff, encourage promotion from within, and promote work on special projects and involvement with multi-functional teams. These activities foster a culture of professional growth and development for our employees to achieve their professional goals and reach their full potential.


PURPOSE:

Sunquest is seeking a talented product leader with expertise in healthcare analytics and entrepreneurial ambitions to grow its portfolio of data & analytics offerings targeted at delivering operational and clinical insights to the customers of its products. These products leverage data from our laboratory information solution platforms and span our support of the clinical, anatomic, molecular and genetic laboratory workflows from the time a test is ordered to the delivery of results to the clinician.


The Sr. Director of Product Management at Sunquest leads and manages a family of product lines through their product lifecycles to ensure growth and profitability in a matrixed organization. Owns accountability for profit and loss performance of products in the product family of up to 10 million annually. Ensures market analysis and trends are translated into product management vision, strategy, goals, and initiate plans to achieve those goals. Feeds the innovation pipeline and sets new product strategy. Excellent business acumen is needed to collaborate with all functions in the organization to deliver new products, ongoing software releases and execute end of life plans as needed. Negotiates with highest levels of management, both internally and with third parties and partners to ensure achievement of product performance goals. They are recognized as an author of the organization’s important product strategies. A visionary strategic thinker relied upon by top management to serve as a proxy for the market and an executive presence for presentation to senior leaders. May direct one or more product managers accountable for product vision, strategy, roadmaps, development, launch and ongoing management of their products. Ensures training and development for product managers. The individual in this role is accountable for growing the product family over the next 18-24 months and will be working collaboratively within the product management organization and other functional teams.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTONS:


Reassess and revise the current product family goals, strategy and initiatives.
Lead a product family containing multiple product lines and being responsible for reporting, analytics, data access API/webservices.
Ensure we provide solution options that are compatible with other Sunquest products and align with our client’s analytics and business intelligence needs
Develop and execute a plan to optimize and standardize our complimentary data and analytics offerings across the product portfolio. This plan includes launching new offerings in the next 18 months that consider client change management to achieve high levels of client adoption and conversion
Partner with our Product Development teams and architects to ensure the assessment, selection and use of industry leading technology, platforms and partners for our offerings that align with our customers IT strategies
Establish and maintain a process for ongoing alignment with all product managers to ensure the data and analytics needs of the product lines and clients are met through your product lines and roadmaps
Develop a content sourcing, definition and development approach that increases the speed and volume of reporting and analytics content we publish out to our clients to satisfy their needs


Analyze past and present trends and forecast future outcomes in the healthcare industry that affect the patient, provider, payer, consumer, and healthcare technology vendor

Identify new market opportunities and trends, understand customer requirements, and research competition.
Create and update a three-year strategic plan for each product line and present the strategic plan to executive management and internal stakeholders on a periodic basis
Develop new product business plans taking into consideration market conditions, customer expectations, competitor market placements, distribution channels, financial and administrative implications, implementation costs, available technologies in the industry and overall corporate strategy, in order to achieve corporate profit objectives
Ensure the timely development and introduction of viable, marketable, supportable, and profitable products and services to the healthcare industry
Develop and guide execution of product positioning, pricing, forecasting, promotion strategies and development opportunities
Maintain the product roadmap, drive release planning preparation, define the product features and work collaboratively with enable requirements engineers as they create user stories for development from the features
Engage the product management organization in managing the reporting and analytics offering content across the Sunquest product portfolio. This includes ensuring each product has up to date data dictionaries, roadmap items aligned with overall reporting and analytics offering, sufficient content breadth and depth to ensure our reporting and analytics offerings are competitive in the market
Work closely with sales and marketing organizations to execute product launch plans, provide up to date marketing content and ensure appropriate product feedback is incorporated into the strategic product plan in a timely manner.
May lead and manage a team of one or more product managers
Performs other related duties as required


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES


Strong analysis and strategic thinking skills that can translate market needs and competitive analysis into product vision, strategy and execution
Entrepreneurial mindset and drive to identify innovative new product opportunities and bring them to market successfully inside an established company
Effective leadership through ownership, actions, decision making, influencing others and collaboration
Embodies a confident and determined approach; resilience and ability to cope with a challenging and dynamic business environment
Sound judgment, decision making and follow through skills
Business acumen in the areas of pricing, marketing, forecasting, business case development and budgeting
Knowledge of lean startup preferred
Consistently applies project management practices to plan, execute and track projects through to on time completion
Be adept at customer relationships
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills


REQUIRED EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE


7-10 years of product management experience, with 4 years healthcare data analytics or similar fields – healthcare and software combined ideal
4-7 years’ experience directly managing others.
Bachelor’s degree in business, sciences or engineering
2-4 years of hands on experience with BI tools, analytics and visualization technologies and solution, such as Tableau, Looker, Qlik, or Power BI


PREFERRED EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Experience with predictive analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence
2 years of experience with big data architectures, data lakes and analytics using cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure and/or Google Cloud
Master of Business Administration (MBA) or job-related master’s degree
Pathology or Clinical Laboratory experience a plus.
Knowledge of health information management (HIM) principles, HL7, FHIR, CDA, DICOM, HIPAA, IHE, and LOINC desired.
MS Office, AHA! Product management (would be preferred)


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS (any specific physical attributes or limiting factors to be accounted for):


Work is performed in a normal office setting with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards; substantial time is spent working on a computer. Position could be remote or in Tucson, AZ. Significant travel is required with this position (15 – 30% travel is required).

Additional Information


Sunquest’s policy is to provide equal opportunity to all people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other legally protected category. Applicants for U.S. based positions with Sunquest Information Systems must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills.  7-10 years of product management experience, with 4 years healthcare data analytics or similar fields – healthcare and software combined ideal.  4-7 years experience directly managing others. job_description:
Duties
Summary

To serve as the Deputy Chief Information Officer for the U.S Air Force. This position is located within the Office of the Under Secretary of the Air Force, Pentagon, and is responsible to the Under Secretary of the Air Force, for overall formulation and execution of policies and enterprise integration of resources related to Information Technology (IT) and IT-related enterprise operations, Cybersecurity, and related workforce development.

Responsibilities
Leads the organization's strategic planning and provides direction for the formulation and execution of long-range strategic plans and policies for the following Air Force functions: (1) Cybersecurity; (2) Weapon System Support through IT and cybersecurity integration and support; (3) Mission Area Integration of Enterprise IT Service delivery; ( 4) Joint Information Environment to include cloud, end points, Enterprise Information Services; (5) DoD Enterprise IT Reform; (6) Enterprise Architecture and Portfolio Management; (7) Digital transformation initiatives across the AF business and weapon systems functions through defense innovation teams; (8) Production and oversight of the annual multi-billion dollar Air Force Information Technology budget; (9) Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning formulation, strategy, and direction; (10) Compliance with Chief Information Officer statutory authorities to include the Clinger Cohen Act; (11) Enterprise Governance and related Architecture; (12) Communications and Information systems management and integration; (13) Leading the development of 1 OK Communications & lnformation/Cyber career civilians;(14) Records Management Policy Compliance; (15) Privacy Act Policy and Compliance; (16) Freedom of Information Act Policy and Compliance; (17) Engagement with the Air Force Chief Data Officer to develop enterprise approaches to data sharing and analysis; and (18) Publishing enterprise technical standard baselines in concert with Service and Federal agencies.


Builds and leads cohesive, high-performing organizational, joint and interagency teams in the development and promulgation of policies and enterprise integration of resources to implement and achieve long-range strategic plans. Establishes short and mid-term objectives to achieve administration goals, congressional intent, and to implement digital transformation guidance from the Secretary of the Air Force (SECAF), Chief of Staff (CSAF), and Chief Information Officer. Directs the development of quantitative and qualitative means of assessing compliance with policy and effectiveness of programs in achieving integrated capabilities.

Represents the Air Force with a wide range of key internal and external officials. Establishes, develops, and maintains contact with executive -level officials of OSD, USCYBERCOM, DISA and other COCOMS, DoD components and Federal Agencies, other executive and legislative agencies, other HQ USAF and SAF organizations, and professional entities. Lead communicator for the Air Force. Represents the Air Force with a wide range of key internal and external officials. Establishes, develops, and maintains contact with executive -level officials of OSD, USCYBERCOM, DISA and other COCOMS, DoD components and Federal Agencies, other executive and legislative agencies, other HQ USAF and SAF organizations, and
professional entities. Lead communicator for the Air Force.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
Yes
Promotion Potential
00
Job family (Series)
0301 Miscellaneous Administration And Program
Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
U.S. Citizenship is required
PCS expenses if authorized will be paid IAW JTR and Air Force Regulations
Males must be registered for Selective Service, see www.sss.gov.
A Top Secret security clearance is required.
Position may be subject to random drug testing
Employee may be required to work other than normal duty hours, to include evenings, weekends and/or holidays
Employee must maintain current certifications
Disclosure of Political Appointments
Mobility is a condition of employment and appointment for SES members will be required to sign a Reassignment Rights and Obligations Agreement
An initial SES career appointment becomes final only after the individual successfully completes a 2-year probationary period.
Attendance to the Air Force's Senior Leader Orientation Course (SLOC) is generally required within 12 months of appointment, subject to course availability.
TDY will be required. Incumbent may be required to travel by military and/or commercial aircraft in the performance of assigned tasks
Probationary Period: An individual's initial SES career appointment becomes final only after the individual successfully completes a 2-year probationary period.
Direct Deposit: All federal employees are required to have direct deposit.
Qualifications
Eligibility will be based upon a clear showing the applicant has training, education and experience of the scope and quality sufficient to effectively carry-out the duties of the position. Candidates must exemplify the corporate perspective, leadership vision, broad experience and character needed in the SES corps not only to satisfy the immediate vacancy, but future vacancies which will occur in a variety of organizations, functions and locations.

In addition, DoD requires an Enterprise Perspective. The individual must possess a broad point of view and an awareness and understanding of individual or organizational responsibilities in relation to DoD or government-wide strategic priorities. Executives should demonstrate ability to work with internal and external partners to support national security objectives. This perspective is typically gained through a variety of diverse work experiences. A separate narrative statement is not required-this information should be embedded within the application package (Resume (not to exceed (5) pages) and Technical Qualifications (not to exceed a combined total of (2) pages).

QUALIFICATIONS:

MANDATORY TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS (TQs): A supplemental statement must be submitted separately addressing each TQ. TQs must provide specific examples that address relevant experience and accomplishments. Applicants should focus on recent experience, education, and training, as some Recruitment Panel and Executive Resources Board members may consider experience that's over 10 years old to be outdated. Applicants must reflect superior technical qualifications demonstrated through leadership and management in the following:

1. Demonstrated professional and executive level knowledge and experience in Enterprise IT Operations/Cyberspace/Cybersecurity strategy, policy, telecommunications, joint and integrated information operations and information assurance.
DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Demonstrated professional and executive level knowledge and experience in Enterprise IT and Cybersecurity strategy, policy,telecommunications, joint and integrated information operations and information assurance across a wide and diverse enterprise level. Noted accomplishments and experiences shall include efforts in cloud computing, wired/wireless networking transformation, and mobile computing.
2. Demonstrated technical and functional expertise in Cybersecurity policy, Information Technology policy and communications and computers. Accomplishments should provide executive examples of leading implementations around modern, secure software design and enterprise infrastructure to drive cyber security strategies from concept to operations.
3. Experience building strategic workforce concepts, designs, and implementations to recruit,train, educate, and develop a technical cyber workforce.
4. Experience providing enterprise security and IT infrastructure integration for DEVSECOPS (Development, Security and Operations) of software, data analytics/platforms, and artificial intelligence.
Education
There is no professional education requirement for this series and grade.
Additional information
Section 1109 of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2019 permits a qualified individual to be given an initial appointment into the Senior Executive Service (SES) within the Department of Defense (DoD) without being subject to the certification of Executive Core Qualifications (ECQ) by the Office of Personnel Management (OPM), Qualifications Review Board (QRB).

A career SES appointment made under this authority does not guarantee that you will be eligible to transfer to another career SES appointment outside of the DoD without the need for you to compete. Other Federal agencies may require you to submit ECQs to OPM's QRB prior to your appointment in that agency.

Veteran preference not applicable to SES positions.

Tax Law Impact for PCS: On 22-Dec-2017, Public Law 115-97 - the "Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 suspended qualified moving expense deductions along with the exclusion for employer reimbursements and payments of moving expenses effective 01-Jan-2018 for tax years 2018 through 2025. The law made taxable certain reimbursements and other payments, including driving mileage, airfare and lodging expenses, en-route travel to the new duty station, and temporary storage of those items. The Federal Travel Regulation Bulletin (FTR) 18-05 issued by General Services Administration (GSA) has authorized agencies to use the Withholding Tax Allowance (WTA) and Relocation Income Tax Allowance (RITA) to pay for "substantially all" of the increased tax liability resulting from the "2018 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act" for certain eligible individuals. For additional information on WTA/RITA allowances and eligibilities, please visit: https://www.gsa.gov/cdnstatic/FTR%20Bulletin%2018_05%20Relocation%20Allowances_0.pdf.

A career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Learn more about federal benefits.


Review our benefits: Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.

For specific benefit guidance for Senior Executives, please visit the following link to OPM's Guide to SES. https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/senior-executive-service/reference-materials/guidesesservices.pdf.


If you have questions regarding this announcement and have hearing or speech difficulties click here.

How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
A Resume-based Senior Executive Service (SES) Hiring Method will be used for this recruitment. This method provides an alternative to the traditional submission that requires applicants to submit a resume and a 10-page written ECQ narrative statement. Please note: Applicants must demonstrate their mastery of ECQs and technical competencies through their resumes. Only candidates that demonstrate mastery of ECQs and technical competencies will be invited for an interview. In Lieu of an ECQ narrative, the Air Force will submit to OPM information on the selected candidate's demonstrated ECQs. Once the Air Force Executive Resources Board and the Under Secretary of the Air Force approves the selected candidate, the Air Force Senior Executive Management Office will submit a QRB Template to OPM for certification of the candidate's ECQs. This template will include the candidate's demonstrated executive and leadership experience obtained from interviews and other materials acquired during the merit staffing process.


PLEASE NOTE: This position may also be filled under Section 1109 of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2019. This permits a qualified individual to be given an initial appointment into the Senior Executive Service (SES) within the Department of Defense (DoD) without being subject to the certification of Executive Core Qualifications (ECQ) by the Office of Personnel Management (OPM), Qualifications Review Board (QRB).


A career SES appointment made under this authority does not guarantee that you will be eligible to transfer to another career SES appointment outside of the DoD without the need for you to compete. Other Federal agencies may require you to submit ECQs to OPM's QRB prior to your appointment in that agency.

Applications will be evaluated against the qualifications requirements. Failure to meet any one of the Mandatory, Technical or Executive Core Qualifications standards will eliminate a candidate from further consideration.

Candidates will be evaluated for this position by a screening panel composed of a diverse mix of senior executives and/or general officers selected for organizational and/or functional backgrounds relevant to this position. The panel discusses each application and reaches consensus on the resume packages demonstrating a high degree of the executive core qualifications and technical competencies. Normally, only those applicants whose packages demonstrate a mastery of ECQs and technical competencies are selected for interviews. Post interview, the panel will then make a recommendation of those Best Qualified candidates who should be referred to the selecting official, in priority order. Final selection is contingent upon the Air Force Executive Resources Board and the Under SecAF.

Background checks and security clearance
Security clearance
Top Secret
Drug test required
Yes
Position sensitivity and risk
Critical-Sensitive (CS)/High Risk
Trust determination process
National security
Required Documents

Required Documents
To receive full consideration, each applicant must submit the documents in the format as designated. Packages that do not include all of the required documents or meet format requirements will not be forwarded for consideration.

The Qualifications Documents must be formatted using Times New Roman, size 12 font, with 1-inch margins. Do not use borders, provide photos, or list a Social Security Number on any of the Qualifications Documents.

A. Resume in the preferred format (Limit 5 pages total) .
B. Mandatory Technical Qualifications Statement addressing the TQ (Limit 2 pages total) .
C. Desirable Qualifications (narrative statement)
C. Most recent completed Performance Appraisal or Performance Report.
D. Most recent Notification of Personnel Action, SF-50, noting your current position, grade level and salary level (applies only to current or former civilian government employee).
E. (Optional): Race and National Origin Identification, SF-181 - Form available at www.opm.gov
F. (Optional): Self-Identification of Handicap, SF-256 - Form available at www.opm.gov

DO NOT SUBMIT ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: Extraneous materials such as copies of position descriptions, award certificates and transmittal letters will not be forwarded for review.
Benefits

Benefits
Review our benefits
Help
This job is open to
Senior executives
Those who meet the five Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs).
The public

job_description:
PROJECT MANAGER
Systems and Technology Research (STR) is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us.

STR is seeking a Project Manager (PM) who is passionate about collaborative problem solving. The PM will manage a portfolio of research and development programs, including all program phases, from ideation, marketing, and proposal development through execution and program close-out.
We believe that each employee has a unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives that are essential to providing our customers with innovative solutions. The skills listed below are intended to give you a sense for the position. If you see an overlap with your skills, go ahead and apply!
The Role:
Manage research project staffing, finances and schedule
Working with the principal investigator, technical staff, subcontractors, and support personnel, identify and address risks and issues
Manage program performance through review of metrics and program execution milestones
Gather, evaluate, and synthesize data from multiple sources, such as project reports, project staff, and customer feedback to understand and communicate status and to identify trends
Interact with external program customers and company leadership

Who You Are:
A US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Security Clearance
A mid-level technical manager with a minimum of a BS in a scientific, engineering or mathematical discipline, and some experience managing R&D projects
Experience in R&D or advanced development project management within the DoD or IC, and/or functional experience directly supporting program objectives such as managing cost, schedule, and technical performance
Able to manage scientists and engineers across broad areas of expertise
Able to achieve cost, schedule, and customer objectives on advanced technology programs
Able to work in a fast-paced environment to enable successful contract execution
Able to build strong customer relationships and establish open lines of communication
Motivated collaborator and effective communicator to both technical and non-technical audiences

Some Other Relevant Skills You May Have:
Experience writing technical proposals, developing statements of work, estimating project costs, and/or leading proposal efforts
Experience spanning all project phases, from ideation to technology research and product development
Working knowledge of DOD acquisition policy and processes
Technical breadth and a demonstrated ability to simultaneously manage multiple, technically diverse programs and teams.
Experience marketing and capturing new projects

STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. Our work is challenging, but you go home at night knowing that you pushed the forefront of technology and made the world a little safer. We recognize that the world is changing, that it is becoming more connected than ever before, making things change faster than before, and reshaping society in the process. We all want to understand this changing world and leave it better for our work.
We're not just any company. Our people, culture, and attitude along with their unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives put us on a trajectory to change the world. We can't do it alone, though - we need fellow trailblazers. If you are one, join our team and help to keep our society safe!

We provide an excellent benefits package in addition to our competitive compensation. We have all of the usual suspects as well as some additional perks that set us apart such as:
Tuition Reimbursement - $15,000 per year
Get a B or better in an approved course and your tuition will Be gone!
Cell Phone Reimbursement
Hello? Can you hear me? You’re breaking up…with your cell phone bill!
PrivacyArmor – Free Identity Protection
Does identity theft keep you up at night? Go to sleep! STR has you covered with free PrivacyArmor.
Wellness
Fruit & Healthy Snacks (all office kitchens) - $0.00
Virtual Workout Series - $0.00
Gym Membership - $0.00
Working Out at STR – Priceless
STR is fully dedicated to hiring the most qualified candidate regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
If you need a reasonable accommodation for any portion of the employment process, email us at appassist@stresearch.com and provide your name, phone number and email address.
US Citizenship is required for all positions.

job_title_2: C2ISR Supply Chain Manager - US Citizenship Required
job_description:
At PLEXSYS, our teams design, build and deliver Live, Virtual, and Constructive (LVC) innovation and training solutions to customers around the world. With over 180 employees in nine states and four foreign countries, we contribute our success to enabling better training…everyday…across the globe.

 As an employee of PLEXSYS, you’ll find a culture that empowers you to achieve your professional objectives, give your personal best, and work with other highly passionate individuals. Our core values of integrity, excellence, teamwork and agility drive our daily decisions, identify our focus areas, and inspire our organizational culture.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The Command and Control, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C2ISR) Supply Chain Manager supports the E-3G AWACS Mission Crew Training Set (MCTS) enterprise and will report directly to the C2ISR Project Manager. The C2ISR Supply Chain Manager has oversight of all supply chain and logistics operations in relation to projects/contracts in assigned area of responsibility. The C2ISR Supply Chain Manager shall ensure overall project/contract goals and deliverables are accomplished on-time and within budget to maximize efficiency and minimize costs of the PLEXSYS/Government supply chain. He/she is required to collaborate with multiple-functional managers to plan and execute the development of the distribution center operational processes, maintenance and readiness of spares, and enable seamless transfers. He/she will manage and monitor vendor's qualifications and performance to ensure they meet or exceed all government and company compliance requirements. He/she will actively seek out information from Project Managers/partner contractors/Site Managers to improve customer support, reduce system downtime, and ensure continued systems performance.

The C2ISR Supply Chain Manager is responsible for managing MCTS contract supply and logistics execution which includes assisting in coordination/negotiation with the E-3G Contracting Office, E-3G Program Office, ACC/A3 & A4, the 558th Software Engineering Squadron, 552 ACW, 3rd Wing, 18th Wing, 57th Wing, and oversight of daily MCTS supply chain and logistics operations. Lastly, he/she will manage and oversee additional potential contracts’ supply chain requirements, as tasked.

 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for managing complex projects and contracts’ supply chain and logistics requirements.
Manages scope, cost, schedule, internal staffing and outside vendors, and contractual deliverable in relations to spares programs.
Perform/manage daily warehouse operations activities.
Liaison w/ Project Manager(s) for procurements and maintenance of required supply items to support concurrency/modification upgrades to fielded system.
Develops different risk management strategies for projects and program supply chains.
Assists Vice-President of Operations & Support and C2ISR Program Manager in planning and setting logistics goals and milestones.
May perform team/individual assessment and evaluations.
May supervise subordinate supply chain/inventory specialists in the conduct of daily activities.
Develops procedures to support proper conduct of logistics and supply chain activities.
Manages/assigns spares and other resources to ensure the projects/programs are successful.
Recognizes areas for internal improvement and develop plans for implementing.
Ensures all program and project supply timelines/processes comply with company & government standards and procedures.
Exercises full authority on behalf of PLEXSYS Interface Products, Inc., for all matters related to daily execution of the supply chain program.
Defines and establishes relations with external shipping/receiving companies and customers/clients regarding supply chain contract requirements.
Prepares reports for upper management and customer regarding status of spares, supplies, and the overall logistics/supply chain IAW contractual or company direction.
Establishes and maintains positive working relationship with executive level logistics customers.
Develops and manages operating budget for assigned logistics projects.
Coordinates with C2ISR Program Manager and C2ISR Project Managers on contractual issues to represent corporate positions to the customer.
Extensive knowledge, experience and management of supply chain software and inventory systems.
Performs other duties, as assigned.

 REQUIREMENTS

Seven to ten years of experience in government/government contractor logistics & supply chain field.
Demonstrated understanding of supply chain and logistics management processes required to support government contracts globally.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills (written and oral) and highly effective interpersonal skills as well as an ability to inspire confidence and motivate the logistics team.
Know how to construct and understand complex spreadsheets and supply software systems.
Demonstrated excellent leadership skills aligning with corporate culture.
Minimum five years of management of medium to large inventory systems.
Bachelors' Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management or related field (specific experience may waive education requirement).

 DESIRABLE

Joint logistics experience preferred (USAF, Navy, Army, Marines, as well as foreign military exposure).
Master’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management or related field.
15+ years of military/government experience with DLA/AFMC/Air Combat Command (ACC) or other assignments focused on logistics and supply chain management supporting aircraft, simulator, and/or other weapons systems.
Experience working with DLA Logistics Information Service (DLIS) Cataloging Directorate (DLIS-K), D043A / D143C system, Federal Cataloging Program (FCP), and Integrated Logistics Support and Services (ILS-S).
Experience submitting Provisioning Parts Data (PPD) via AFMC’s Automated Provisioning System (D220).
Hosting/coordinating Provisioning Guidance Conferences and Spares Provisioning Conferences with a Government customer.
Experience with Predictive Analysis and Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) analysis and planning.
Experience and/or interest in creating supply chain efficiencies utilizing innovative technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML).

AUTHORITY

Must have or be able to obtain/maintain a Secret clearance.
Maintain and adjust resources and budget of their assigned projects.

PERKS

As a PLEXSYS employee, you can expect certain advantages; such as advancement based on performance, competitive wages, valuable benefits and a great working environment. Our team is committed to ensuring an environment that empowers individuals to realize their full potential by providing opportunities and necessary support to achieve personal and professional goals.

Medical/Vision/Prescription/Dental Benefits
Life, AD&D and Long Term Disability Coverage
Paid Holidays, Military Leave, and Paid Time Off
401k Plan with eligibility from first day of employment
Education reimbursement for job-related courses for full-time employees
PriceClub/COSTCO/Sam's Club annual membership


PLEXSYS Interface Products, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

job_description:
Autonomous Systems Developer, Lead - (00055652)
Description

MITRE’s Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Systems (AIAS) Department has a new opportunity for a strong technical candidate to join an innovative team of engineers focused on development of autonomous systems and AI solutions for sponsor needs and developing robotics capabilities for a safer world. The right candidate will enjoy a fast-paced team environment and working with cutting-edge technology. The candidate for this position will work a wide variety of challenging activities in direct support of sponsor programs and will support MITRE’s AI and autonomy efforts.
Responsibilities include:
Maintain knowledge of advances of autonomy and robotics capabilities in industry and academia
Collect and analyze sensor and algorithm data to evaluate and improve AI/Autonomy system performance
Work and/or lead teams to implement and evaluate autonomy/AI algorithms on robotics hardware and cloud-based computing environments
Develop, propose and execute research in the field of autonomy and AI
Evaluate autonomy or AI solutions and compare to sponsor requirements.


Qualifications

Basic Qualification:
Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, Systems Engineering, Computer Science, or Software Engineering, or similar fieldAt least 8 years of professional experience or advanced degreeUnderstand the breadth of autonomous systems across different domains (DoD, Services, Intelligence Community, DHS, Industry and Academia)Experience in robotics-relevant fields, such as computer vision, deep learning, machine learning, planning, human machine teaming, and multi-robot systemsAbility to articulate autonomy-specific challenges (in perception, reasoning, behaviors, collaborations), discuss critical issues, and identify gapsFamiliarity with the state of the art in the field.Knowledge of the challenges of developing autonomous and AI systems that are robust in real world scenarios

Requirements / must have for consideration:
Must be a US citizen able to obtain and maintain a US government clearance **Proficiency in use of Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel, and WordMust have demonstrated proficiency and strength in verbal, written, PC, presentation, and communications skillsProven ability to work independently to learn new technologies, techniques, processes, languages, platforms, systemsExcellent written and verbal communication skills along with the ability to foster relationship development with sponsors

Preferred:
Advanced degree in technical field of studyU.S. Citizen with active/current DoD Secret Clearance
Experience developing machine learning solutions with modern toolchains, e.g. TensorFlow, MXNet, Scikit-LearnExperience with robotics software and frameworks, e.g. ROSExperience with object-oriented programming languages such as C++ and python

job_title_2: Data Science Team Lead - Wells Fargo Internal Audit - Quantitative Analytics Specialist 4
job_description:
Important Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume prior to submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.
At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Data Management and Insights (DMI) is transforming the way that Wells Fargo uses and manages data. Our work enables Wells Fargo to empower and inform our team members, deliver exceptional experiences for our customers, and meet the elevated expectations of our regulators. The team is responsible for designing the future data environment, defining data governance and oversight, and partnering with technology to operate the data infrastructure for the company. This team also provides next generation analytic insights to drive business strategies and help meet our commitment to satisfy our customers’ financial needs.
The Artificial Intelligence Model Development Center of Excellence (AI MD CoE) team is a data science team, responsible for developing and deploying machine learning and AI solutions for a number of domain areas such as fraud prevention, credit risk, experience personalization, customer listening, anomaly detection and operational cost improvement. The CoE partners closely with the AI Enterprise Solutions and the AI Technology teams at the bank, and brings a cross-functional approach to identifying, developing and deploying AI solutions.

The CoE requires high-skill/ high-motivation individuals who enjoy working collaboratively in a team setting, used to taking decisions autonomously and comfortable with a dynamic work environment. The COE is looking for an experienced analytics leader to support Internal Audit.
This role is responsible for performing highly complex activities related to creation, implementation, documentation, validation, articulation and defense, on-going maintenance of complex models grounded in highly statistical theory used to quantify, analyze and manage market, credit, counterparty and operational risks or to forecasts losses and compute capital requirements or enable decision making in business, product, marketing or other functional areas. Duties typically include developing and documenting analytical models and strategies for short and long term objectives, performing analytical support and/or modeling, and providing well-articulated insights regarding a wide array of business initiatives. This job may utilize stochastic, structured securities, option adjusted spread analyses, etc. and has expertise in the theory and mathematics behind the analyses. May interface with regulators and auditors. This job requires extensive knowledge of the financial products and/or portfolios assigned and the ability to schedule and run the analyses, inclusive of technical, audit, accounting, and market perspectives, identifying structure and scope of review.
Key Responsibilities include:
Functions as a team lead for a group of data scientists responsible for AI/ML model development in support of compliance initiatives
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models using state of the art techniques available in the open stack (primarily Python) and/or vendor solutions
Partner with LOB business executives to frame the problem, manage the model development process, and business relationship
Manage a portfolio of the data science projects including the following responsibilities:
Help finalize project scope working with business partners
On-going touch-base with business partners and governance stakeholders
Define priorities in partnership with the business partners during on-going development
Partner with corporate risk teams to understand model risk policy and its implications to model development, review, and monitoring
Adhere to corporate model risk policy and ensure compliance with model risk management
Working with other data science teams to identify, gather, retain, and publicize modeling artifacts required for approved and repeatable processes
Work with AI technology and production teams to operationalize models
May be called upon to review vendor models and solutions and/or models developed outside of EADS
Have the ability to create sophisticated, value-added analytic systems for fraud, collections, deposits, risk & compliance, and others using big-data machinery and advanced machine learning techniques
Have strong interpersonal skills to work effectively in an agile and collaborative environment
Provide technical advice to other members of the team and across the organization on topics including machine learning code, machine learning algorithms and traversing across multiple big data platforms
Identify and lead the evaluation of new software techniques and technologies, including delivery of results
Identify new applications for machine learning across the company and work with business partners to pilot

Required Qualifications

4+ years of experience in an advanced scientific or mathematical field
A master's degree or higher in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, engineering, physics, economics, or computer science
4+ years of statistical modeling experience
4+ years of Python experience
4+ years of SQL experience
4 + years of experience using quantitative machine learning techniques

Desired Qualifications

1+ years of Natural Language Processing (NLP) experience
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
A BS/BA degree or higher in a quantitative discipline
Ability to work and influence successfully within a matrix environment and build effective business partnerships with all levels of team members
Meeting facilitation experience in leading discussions that result in consensus and commitment
Experience with Tensorflow, Theano or Keras

Other Desired Qualifications

Solid understanding of and 4+ years of experience applying machine learning techniques such as neural networks, random forest, GBM and SVM, Probabilistic Graphical Models, Deep Learning architectures, etc..
Experience with signal processing or optimization techniques
Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques (e.g. sampling, probability, multivariate data analysis, regression, PCA, time-series analysis)
Strong ability to retrieve, combine and transform data from numerous information systems
Strong acumen in diagnosing and resolving data issues
Experience working with big data infrastructure with tools such as Hive, Spark and h2o
Exceptional analytical, critical thinking, quantitative reasoning skills, and problem-solving skills. Ability to relate complex analysis and insights to effective business strategy.
Oher advanced statistical tools such as SAS, ProgR, and Weka
4+ years managing or directing data scientist/ statistician/ data engineer teams
Technical skills: Familiarity and comfort with data pipelining and movement tools and tools for predictive analytics/ NLP/ machine learning
Strong analytical and problem solving experience to aid decision making, in areas such as compliance, customer experience improvement, and analytics, operations optimization
Experience with agile project management methodologies for data science

Street Address

NC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NC
MN-Minneapolis: 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MN
NC-Charlotte: 11625 N Community House Road - Charlotte, NC
AZ-Tempe: 1150 W Washington St - Tempe, AZ
IA-Des Moines: 6200 Park Ave - Des Moines, IA

Disclaimer

All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.

Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!

Solution Consulting - Lead Consultant
==================================
Fair Isaac Corporation is seeking a full-time Solution Consulting - Lead Consultant at our offices in Austin, TX. Primary duty is to participate in all phases of implementation and deployment of large-scale financial based software solutions. Serve as a part of the implementation team effort, participating in contact between the customer and all sales, configuration, data migration, development, professional services, support and project team members during the implementation process. Specific duties include: 1) participate in on-site analysis of business needs and requirements gathering, analysis and design workshops with customer; 2) assist with business and software configuration by providing consultation, design and configuring items defined during analysis phase including each of the following: configuration designing, solution deployment, business rule configuration, and data modeling for rules-based solutions; 3) follow-up and escalate gaps, issues and enhancements identified throughout the project; maintains detailed issue tracking and action items list; 4) assist in creating test plans for workflow and assists in workflow testing; 5) work with customer and project team to ensure deliverables are on-time and successful; including ensure software is ready for customer use and appropriate documentation is provided; 6) implement Collections and/or Recoveries software and solutions including Oracle Banking Platform - Collections and Indus Collections; 7) lead internal training efforts; creates internal documentation and FAQs; and supports internal initiatives for a COTS collection and recovery enterprise application; 8) provide training to customer and end users as needed; 9) submit Product Modification Request cases for application bugs and enhancements to development and product support teams; and 10) develop SQL scripts for working with the data during implementations and work with RedHat JBOSS Application Server to assist with deployment of the application. Domestic travel required up to 25% of the time.
This position requires a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, plus five (5) years of progressive post-baccalaureate experience in computer engineering or related occupation. Experience must include three (3) years of experience, which may be concurrent, in all of the following: 1) software implementation of large-scale software solutions; 2) business needs requirements gathering and analysis; 3) providing technical guidance and/or mentoring on functional consulting activities including each of the following: configuration designing, solution deployment, business rule configuration, and data modeling for rules-based solutions; 4) working with clients in the pre-sales or post-sales processes, including the development of presentations, conducting demonstrations and conducting proof of concept exercises; 5) implementing Collections and/or Recoveries software and solutions including Indus Collections; 6) developing SQL scripts for data reporting and analysis; and 7) RedHat JBOSS Application Server for use with deployment of C&R software solutions. All experience may have been gained concurrently. Experience must have been acquired after completion of the Bachelor’s Degree program. Domestic travel required up to 25% of the time. Please apply online at www.fico.com. Must reference job code #23184 for consideration. Unrestricted right to work in US required.
Our Offer to You
A culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.
Highly competitive compensation and rewards.
Flexible work options, opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues and a comprehensive benefits program inclusive of progressive parental leave.
Why Make a Move to FICO?
At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.
FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.
Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.
Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financing
Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.
Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
FICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. We are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

job_title_2: AI/ML Platform & Engineering - Sr. Technical Program Manager
job_description:
Our Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You’ll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.
JPMC has made a strategic decision to fundamentally transform its operations through the adoption of artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale. We are the AI Acceleration (AIX) team, a new group headquartered in Palo Alto and multiple locations in the US (Delaware, NY) tasked with achieving this vision. You will join the AI Engineering team and work alongside other leaders who have built and shipped AI and Machine Learning products at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, and Salesforce.
Technical Program Manager for the AI Engineering team should be experienced with delivering complex scalable distributed software products and services in the Cloud environment. Must be experienced working with cross functional teams including Engineering, Product Management, UX, partner teams and stakeholders across line of businesses.

Responsibilities:
Lead program management activities in close collaboration with the product , engineering and business teams
Manage program schedules, drive accountability and own program execution in a fast paced innovative environment.
Drive operational excellence required to ensure a streamlined production process of our data science deliveries.
Manage multiple interdependent projects of moderate to high complexity and scope
Demonstrate technical judgment in solving software engineering challenges.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with technical and non-technical global, cross-functional teams.
Expert knowledge of Agile. Hands on experience with any of the following tools: JIRA, Rally. Own existing processes and work continuously to improve them.
Design, develop and own team collaboration sites, periodic content modifications and reporting

Requirements:
Master’s, Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in Engineering, Computer Science, or other technical related field.
10-15 years of experience in program management in software engineering environment
Preferred: Knowledge of AI/ ML, Data Science or related certification would be a plus
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech organizations. In our global technology centers, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.
