job_description:
Overview:
Trend Micro, a global leader in cybersecurity, is passionate about making the world safe for exchanging digital information today and in the future. Artfully applying our XGen™ security strategy, our innovative solutions for consumers, businesses, and governments deliver connected security for data centers, cloud workloads, networks, and endpoints. With over 6,500 employees in 50 countries and the world’s most advanced global threat research and intelligence, Trend Micro enables organizations to secure their connected world. www.trendmicro.com

Principal Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist
Trend Micro is one of the first cybersecurity companies to adopt machine learning and AI. We have more than 15 years of experience applying AI on dealing with malware, malicious URLs, spam emails, botnets and many more. However, the changes brought about by AI show no signs of slowing down. Top-tier AI researchers and conferences announce astonishing breakthroughs almost every day. Numerous AI start-ups have the full attention of venture capitalists as they use their creativity to develop powerful new solutions to real customer pain points. In the world of cybersecurity, both defenders and attackers now use state-of-the-art AI technologies to get ahead of each other. As a leader in this field, Trend Micro must never fall behind.

We are looking for AI experts that make more AI landing in our domain and make a real impact on the company, the industry, and the world.

The new position will focus on connecting state-of-the-art AI technologies into Trend Micro eco-system and CyberSecurity industry. The role will digest, validate, reproduce, evaluate, and communicate latest AI papers, presentations, products, patents, tools, frameworks. Furthermore, the role needs to bring AI ideas into the company’s process, projects, and products. Finally, innovative thinking, data analytics skills, and willingness to communicate and collaborate are critical for a successful candidate.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Exploration to bring in more possibilities:
Search for use cases to demonstrate the advantage of Artificial Intelligence in Cybersecurity.
Summarize, digest, validate, reproduce, evaluate, and communicate latest AI papers, presentations, products, patents, tools, frameworks.
Design and prototype new algorithms, optimization methods, and architectures for cybersecurity machine learning solutions
Exploitation to solve problems and improve current company solutions:
Use data analytics skills to identify the key questions and problems in existing solution from daily operation logs and open available data.
Transform the identified cybersecurity problems into technical solutions and actionable recommendations using the AI technologies.
Communication to internal team members for better collaboration and to external public to bring more visibilities
Develop conference papers, presentations, patent applications, that are broadly appealing and accessible beyond a core scientific audience
Deliver high quality stories leveraging agile process
Share knowledge and contribute to an environment of continuous improvement
Qualifications/Requirements:
The Principal Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist must at least have 3 years end to end AI landing experience and practice from initial idea proposition, proof of concept research, implementation, product integration and operation, industrial impact evaluation and paper/patent submission; plus the minimum requirements for the position of Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist, outlined below:
PhD. in Computer Science or related field, or a Master’s Degree with publications in high-ranked conferences and journals to demonstrate research capability
Thorough understanding of latest deep learning / machine learning algorithms, and experience of application implementation with latest deep learning technologies
Experience in using DL (Deep Learning) frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Python programming skills and its libraries knowledge is a MUST
Analytical ability and problem-solving skills is a MUST
Excellent communication and presentation skills - both written and verbal, and explain complex research problems to non-technical audience
Experience with graph-neural network family, recurrent network family, reinforcement learning is a plus
Broad knowledge on the internet, cloud/edge computing, and distributed computing, and cybersecurity is a plus
Knowledge of AWS or Cloud platform is a plus
Curiosity – out of box thinking is a plus
Trend Micro provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Trend Micro does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

job_description:
Our mission is to protect life.
We’re out to make the world a safer place by solving big problems and taking on the public safety challenges of our time. From our company's inception building the TASER device to a full suite of hardware and software solutions, we are focused on providing police agencies with the state-of-the-art devices and services they need to successfully serve and protect us. In the next few years, we're going to eliminate the burden of paperwork in policing, so officers can increase the time they spend building relationships and serving in their communities. We’ll put video at the heart of the police record so our justice system can get to the truth faster. And we won't stop innovating until the bullet is rendered obsolete.

It’s a big mission, but it’s one we’ll pursue relentlessly every single day.

Your Impact

Fleet 3 is Axon’s next generation in-car platform for law enforcement. Not only will this be the best in-car video system on the market but it will include Axon’s newest artificial intelligence capabilities to incorporate live services and the ability to alert officers of vehicles of interest via smart license plate reading technology. Building this system from the ground up and leveraging the strengths of the Axon Ecosystem is a huge task.

With this mission, we are looking for an experienced product manager who has a track record of defining and executing complex software deliverables across multiple teams and job roles. You’ll be responsible delivering user research-based guidance to the software squads as they build out critical workflows for users of our system. You’ll work collaboratively with product managers, technical program managers, product designers, engineers and our go-to-market teams to own delivery of a high-quality, enterprise-ready system. As our program progresses, you’ll be at the heart of capturing product feedback on the system as we deploy it to beta users across the country. You’ll prioritize that feedback, plan updates, and ready the overall system for launch.
Your day to day
Direct and guide the software product vision, communicate to the cross-functional team, and evolve it based on interactions with customers and as the solution is developed
Work with engineering teams to balance scope, functionality, performance, and time to market
Creatively generate solutions to a wide range of technical, work flow, and business problems
Gather quantitative and qualitative data from market and end users
Make data driven decisions when possible and fall back on well supported intuition when data is not available
Problem solve within constraints that truly exist and break through constraints that don’t actually exist
Lead & mentor more junior product managers
Operate with autonomy while proactively reducing ambiguity for your team and your cross-functional peers
Represent software team in leadership updates, roadmapping, and go-to-market activities
Set performance metrics for the most important functions of the products and manage team to measure and achieve them
Basic Qualifications
You have a bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering or related field
5+ years relevant Software Product Management experience ideally shipping complex, multi product/system solutions with IoT devices and SaaS components
Experience solving complex user interaction problems with creative solutions
You have deep experience working with engineers to balance scope, time to market, and functionality, constantly making trade-offs using qualitative, quantitative, and absent data
Excellent problem solving skills, well-structured written and verbal communication
Flexibility to travel domestically and internationally when necessary (15%)
You have a proven track record of delivering successful products that achieve key business outcomes
Preferred Qualifications
You have real-world experience with each of the expectations listed in section entitled “Your Day to Day”
Compensation and Benefits
Competitive salary and 401K with employer match
Discretionary paid time off
Robust parental leave policy
An award-winning office/working environment
Ride along with real police officers in real life situations, see them use technology, get inspired
And more...
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_description:
Job Description:
Technical Product Manager | Product Development Team
Orange County, CA Preferred - Remote Acceptable | Full Time

Role Description
As the Technical Product Manager, you will lead the product roadmap for our data analytics in the emerging real estate digital transformation space.The ideal candidate will have experience managing end-to-end data processing solutions on mobile and web platforms, a strong product management background in technology, and experience with data rich platforms. Additionally, qualified candidates who have experience building products at scale at previous startups and/or reinvent existing platforms are highly sought after for this position.

As a Techincal Product Manager, you will help to develop and execute on our evolving strategy related to our proprietary data bringing the insights to life through understanding the data value proposition both internally and for our customer facing products.
The successful candidate must be an experienced, creative problem solver with proven ability to be both hands on and strategic across our dynamic, complex organization and deliver tangible, impactful results. We are making big bets on the future of real-estate, trailblazing a 2030 vision for the industry. Watch our CEO, Jeff Meyers share the landscape of untapped opportunities.

You will play a critical role in our business as we work to refine our product, post the merger of our two companies (Hanley Wood & Meyers Research).

Responsibilities
Lead data modeling, data infrastructure and machine learning for our database, including both internal proprietary and third party data layers, and their impact on customer facing product
Provide "out of the box" product and technology inspirations to drive creative user solutions for what is possible and what will be possible
Translate and synthesize requirements between data scientist, research, engineers, designers, product managers and customers
Create a customer onboarding program, working with research, sales and support teams to ensure product launch success
Contribute to the shaping of the roadmap with support from EVP of Product Development
Work closely with the research and engineering teams to ensure the internal user experience is simple, seamless and delightful and to ensure data ingestion and consumption are of the highest integrity
Talk to users, always looking for deeper insights, understanding their needs and uses to solve problems with the best solution possible
Partner effectively with UX Research, as available, helping to define the problems we are seeking to understand and validate decision making
Research industry and non-industry competitors to understand our unique competitive advantage
Identify metrics to track and measure customer and business benefits
Facilitate effective scoping sessions with the team, clearly documenting decisions and consistently integrating the story and scope
Challenge the team to question assumptions about what's needed, sharpening the team's thinking about what's essential, why and when
Monitor and identify future potential product quality risks
Communicate with team, product leadership, key stakeholders frequently and effectively to ensure the teams are aligned and engaged
Act accountable and positive in all conditions, taking ownership of problems and solutions
Be decisive, assertive, and optimize constant progress daily while complying with our core values

 Requirements
Experience: 5-7 years of experience in an agile product development role. A minimum of 3 years of Data or Technical Product Management.
Portfolio: Share past products, where you've influenced technical product development. Showcase how you go about developing a unique customer experience through digital product.
Education: Undergrad/Grad education in statistics, computer science with a machine learning focus, mathematics, physics, etc.
Product Strategy and Vision: Take an ownership position in influencing the digital disruption of our industry through creative solutions, with an eye for modern design, and a compelling technology-driven identity for our products and services
Discovery: As a product owner focused on the delighting the customer, delivering on exceptional product discovery techniques including opportunity assessment, customer journey mapping and interviews.
Prototyping: Within a fast pace, multi-product environment, your ability to translate business objectives and customer needs into a prototype and iterate quickly will be a vital part of your role
Sprint Techniques: To ensure the execution of most valuable product to the customer, you'll manage the sprint ceremonies including bi-weekly sprint planning, the product backlog to meet the needs of the customer and collaborate from end to end with design and engineering team members in an agile environment leveraging tools such as Jira and Confluence.
Product Launch: We'll need you to help us craft our core messaging in collaboration with our internal product marketing team to all stakeholders. To ensure we've delivered on our promise, you will monitor and measure our product success through qualitative and quantitative testing techniques, developing and designing product metrics and working collaboratively with our customer support team.
Leadership: As the leader of communicating our product point of view, you take pride in delivering against our vision, inspiring and challenging team members to continue to push beyond traditional real estate product solutions.
Teaming: As a subject matter expert, your ability to teach and work collaboratively within the organization will be required to ensure our process is consistent across all of our product touch points.
Project Management: Come prepared for weekly stand-ups, bring your best client-facing skills to meetings, be prepared to work and learn, set deadlines, take notes and ownership of the next steps. Execute meticulously in a fast-paced environment with ambiguity. Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Tools: We are a collaborative and tech-driven company. Tools include Box, Slack, Jira, Salesforce, IOS, Microsoft Office Suites. IOS Apple experience preferred. More advance design tool experience a plus. Technical expertise in basic computer languages a plus.
Bonus Points
Knowledge of technological infrastructure and architecture that can support Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technology
Knowledge of GIS, Mapping or Satellite data
Knowledge of image and digital documentation processing and storage
Experience working with a Data Scientist
Knowledge of Real Estate principals
Compensation
401K and competitive benefits
Fieldwork in product discovery
Regular offsite workshops across the country
Annual team retreat
Work from home culture
New tools and hardware
Growth platform: regular 1:1 time and ongoing feedback from leadership
Peace of mind corporate benefit package
Time off: vacation, extra holidays, short days
About Us:
Hanley Wood | Meyers Research is growing. Grow with us. Hanley Wood | Meyers Researchcombines experienced real estate and technology advisors with leading data to provide our clients with a clear perspective and a strategic path forward. We're a smart, diverse, and close-knit group of creative problem solvers. You'll apply breadth and depth of knowledge and vision to shape our industry. Every job comes with fantastic benefits, perks, and tools to make you successful and you'll work in a culture of respect and collaboration. Join us. We'd love your help.

Follow us on Social Media

Facebook: facebook.com/hanleywood/
 facebook.com/meyersresearchllc

Twitter: twitter.com/hanleywood
 twitter.com/meyers_research

Our talented crew comes from all walks of life, cultures and experiences. We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at Hanley Wood | Meyers Research. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Proof of eligibility to work in the United States is required. Candidates must submit a proper portfolio in order to be considered for the position.

job_description:
Apply Here

Share on Social:
Bellevue, Washington, United States

K2 (www.k2.com) is a software company, headquartered in Seattle and with offices around the world.

At K2 we are passionate about putting innovation in the hands of business users making the impossible easy. K2's digital process automation (DPA) platform lays the foundation for intelligent automation, allowing businesses to orchestrate processes that bring in robotic process automation (RPA), artificial intelligence, and machine learning to deliver world-class solutions.

Our cloud platform provides a robust workflow engine and a low code user interface designer that enables non-developers to build enterprise scale apps quickly. Combined with our powerful integration services, you can easily connect applications with virtually any other service, application or system with basic JavaScript or no code at all.

K2 is seeking a technical product manager to take ownership and lead a significant new extension to the K2 product portfolio. You would own shaping a new family of solutions built on the K2 platform. You would have accountability for the strategy, customer and market requirements, and end-to-end delivery of roadmap for these solutions and support their adoption and growth in the market. This position has cross-company influence, requiring end-to-end alignment across product management, engineering, marketing, sales, channel, services, and support functions inside K2.

We are an established technology company with fortune 500 customers around the world that executes with the growth mindset and agile practices of a start-up. This is a new project where you can get in early and have a big impact on our product direction and delivery.

Responsibilities:
Define and own the solution roadmap based on the market landscape, competition, industry trend, telemetry insights, etc. and arrive at an execution plan for prioritized list of investments.
Write detailed functional specifications, that captures technical details, user experience, supportability aspects, scale and performance goals, prioritization, and scoping of any features.
Work with internal and external partners to gather feedback, manage dependencies
Track closely the changes in the market, industry landscape, technology trends and competition.
Effectively facilitate product reviews and meetings with leadership, customers, partners, and analysts
Ensure customer success for all customers, working closely with key customers

Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of industry experience as a Program or Product Manager in one or more of the following areas: Business Applications, Cloud services, Productivity applications/services, Analytics.
Experience driving development of SaaS products using Agile/DevOps engineering practices.
Familiar with cloud architecture, modern web app dev technologies and UX design.
Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements to product specifications and deliver results in an environment of ambiguity
BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field or equivalent experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud Platform
Domain knowledge in integration, dev tools, rules engines, and/or analytics
Experience with building application experiences that delight users

Summary
Posted: May 8, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200168175
Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Create groundbreaking technology for large scale systems, spoken language, big data, and artificial intelligence. And work with the people who built the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking. Join the Siri team at Apple.
The Siri team is looking for an outstanding Engineering Manager to build and lead a team of data scientists and engineers passionate about improving speech recognition and language understanding via insights derived from massive amounts of data.
Key Qualifications
Track record of building high-performance software development teams that have delivered complex data science and engineering projects.
Proven track record of growing and guiding a development organization through learning, solving complex problems, and mentorship.
Proactive communicator, with experience guiding strong results via cross-functional partnerships and leadership skills.
Experience with large scale data processing using MapReduce/Hadoop/Spark and creating dashboards using Tableau.
5+ years of industry experience building and directing a team of high-performing software and data engineers.
Description
As a Manager of ASR Grading and Analytics, you will help hire and oversee a team of data scientists and engineers responsible for validating logging and measuring accuracy, creating dashboards, transcribed offline data sets, and executive reports. This position requires a leader who possesses strong technical skills in machine learning and big data, and a team player who can cross organizational boundaries and thrives in finding insights in ambiguity.

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or related field.

job_description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to build software with some of the largest companies and organizations in the world? Are you interested in the intersection between machine learning and software engineering? Are you the sort of person who can lead a team of other senior engineers and help them to deliver impact across the globe? Do you want to thrive in and contribute to a culture where different areas of passion and skills empower a happy and high-performing team? Are you excited to learn new technologies? If the answer is yes, then we want you to join our fast-growing team of curious and talented software engineers.

Our team, Commercial Software Engineering (CSE), works side by side with engineers from Microsoft’s most strategic global customers on cutting-edge technologies. We help them to tackle their toughest technical problems both in the cloud and on the edge. We meet customers where they are, working with the languages, open source frameworks and operating systems they use. Our work spans across different industries, covers a broad spectrum of technology domains and has global reach and impact.

We’re looking for a Principal Software Engineering Lead who will be based at either our global HQ campus in Redmond, at one of our CSE hub locations in North America (New York, Austin, Boulder, Cambridge, Bay Area), or potentially as a remote role from another North American location. You’ll be leading a global team of technical domain experts that focuses on Microsoft’s Azure platform technologies for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our group within CSE provides a bridge between Microsoft’s product engineering teams and the CSE DevCrews (pods of 5-7 engineers) who engage with our largest global customers. You and your team will ensure that we maintain and leverage strong AI Platforms engineering practices across CSE; you’ll work hands on in customer engagements across the globe and then you’ll use this experience to provide both tactical and strategic feedback to make our products and services better.

We welcome diversity of all kinds. Our team includes many cultures, educational backgrounds, life stages, identities, and technical skills, and we believe this contributes to our success and that of our customers. If you love writing quality code and learning new technologies, enjoy thinking about challenging engineering problems and, above all, if you’re able to lead others to do the same, then we’d love to hear from you.
Responsibilities
This is in no way a complete list of what you will be doing day-to-day, but it should give you a framework that this role operates within:

Lead a team of software engineers- You will be expected to be hands-on as you serve as the technical lead for your team. You will lead a team of engineers who deploy as subject matter experts into our project engagements across the globe. Your team is responsible for unblocking customer scenarios within the AI Platforms solution area. Your input will range from upfront architectural guidance, hands on engineering across one or more sprints and the occasional bit of technical firefighting.
Take pride in high-quality code & engineering practices – A key charter for CSE is to build the capability of our customer’s engineering teams. You and your team will be responsible for setting a good example in terms of code quality and engineering practices.
Sharing learnings – You will share and transfer knowledge (patterns and practices, reference architectures, documentation, reusable assets) within your team and across the global CSE organization. You will be responsible for ensuring that we have strong capabilities within CSE in the use of Microsoft’s AI Platforms.
Help improve Microsoft products – This role provides an opportunity for you and your team to influence Microsoft’s future product roadmap and improve our current offerings through technical feedback and hands on engineering engagement with our products groups in Redmond and around the globe.
Be respectful and inclusive – You will be leading a team of senior engineers and they will appreciate your robust but collegial input to challenging problems. As a group, we ultimately work to build consensus with our teammates and customers. You’ll be the sort of person who enjoys a culture that ensures that all voices and perspectives are heard and considered.
Be a trusted partner to customers – You will work closely with the engineers from the customer team as we engineer solutions alongside them. You’ll build trust, credibility, and a positive working relationship with different customer stakeholders.
Communicate confidently and effectively – You are equally comfortable on the whiteboard for brainstorming/design sessions or a keyboard for written communication and/or verbally communicating your ideas and contributing to a richer discussion. You help others to build their communication abilities as a model of your own.
Be a constant learner and invest in your team’s development– You are excited to keep up with the latest technologies, patterns or paradigms and help grow the teams of software engineers you work with; both your own team and others across the group.
Qualifications

 Required Qualifications:
At least 5+ years’ experience in leading a team of software engineers, data scientists or other similar technical fields. This role is leading a senior team of about 6 engineers.
At least 7+ years’ experience working hands on in a data science and/or software engineering role, coding and building solutions that run at scale.
At least 1+ year's experience working with one of more of the major cloud stacks: Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Alibaba Cloud.
A Bachelor’s degree or above

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with a variety of technologies, software stacks and languages. You should have both the ability and enthusiasm to learn and work in new technology areas.
An understanding of how software engineering practices and data science work together to deliver value in large organizations. You and your team will focus on how we bring software engineering principles and practices to our AI engagements.
Ability to travel, generally 25% but sometimes higher. We co-locate with customers for a working week at the right points during our customer engagements and get together for offsites with peers globally a couple of times each year. Travel for customer engagements will often be global and this role does manage a global team.

We want you to find a role and a company that you love, where you can do your best work. If you’d like to learn more about our company values, we encourage you to read https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/about/values.

CSE-FY20

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

At least 5+ years experience in leading a team of software engineers, data scientists or other similar technical fields.  At least 7+ years experience working hands on in a data science and/or software engineering role, coding and building solutions that run at scale.  At least 1+ year's experience working with one of more of the major cloud stacks: Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Alibaba Cloud.  Experience working with a variety of technologies, software stacks and languages.  Ability to travel, generally 25% but sometimes higher

job_description:
Description:
Job Title: Lead 5G Solution Architect Job Code: L4 Job Location: Camden, NJ

Job Description:
L3Harris Technologies– C5S is a recognized global leader in the design, development and production of secure communication systems and products supporting mission-critical space, ground, air and naval operations. C5S is where employees have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our business and the world around us while thriving in an environment that continually fosters growth and career development. We are committed to providing best-in-class solutions to our customers with the highest level of integrity, excellence and uncompromised quality in everything we do.

The Lead 5G Solutions Architect for Cyber Systems will be a leader in our fast-paced growing environment supporting new business capture by developing innovative 5G solutions. S/he will be responsible for significant customer interactions teamed with a Solution Manager to help uncover and develop best-in-class solutions to meet their needs. Additionally, the Solutions Architect will be responsible for defining and driving the technical direction of prospective business opportunities, developing system architectures, providing leadership for proposals and strategic pursuits, as well as having significant input to shape the investments of the business. The Solutions Architect will also assess market level technology trends as well as capabilities of complementary solutions enabling larger scale solution offerings. The Solutions Architect will have all the necessary support, scope and resources, to have a direct impact on the growth of our business.

Essential Functions:
The Solutions Architect is an ideal position for someone who is a self-starter that will seize and maintain the initiative in ambiguous situations. The successful candidate will possess a fiercely competitive spirit with a relentless desire to impact and win. S/he has an affinity to challenge the status quo and propose new and innovative solutions to the most complex challenges. Additionally, the successful candidate will possess the following skillsets:
IR1006 Rev. 7/19

Exceptional leadership skills including the ability to make strategic and tactical decisions  Experience working closely with customers to identify solutions  Experience in developing and executing strategic technology roadmaps to develop new business opportunities  Experience working with Capture Management and Business Development to be the liaison between new customer program capture and Engineering  Excellent verbal and written communications skills; works with others to coordinate efforts, resolve cross-team issues and effectively communicate changes  Architect and design our next generation 5G platform and ecosystem  Architect and design our security for next generation 5G platform and ecosystem  Experience in link budget analysis, chain analysis, EVM analysis, and throughput analysis.  Understanding of wireless of Radio-Area-Network architectures, antennas and devices.  Knowledge of wireless infrastructure architectures and air interface standards including 5G, LTE and HSPA+.  Familiarity with 3GPP standards.  Familiarity with commercial 5G equipment and service offerings.  Deployment and management of virtualized resources at scale, including virtual machines, containers, and ‘Serverless’ Systems.  Ability to analyze and onboard 5G use cases as part of Proof of Concept demonstrations to inform Architecture decisions.  Ability to act as a leader/mentor in day-to-day operations to provide insights for less experienced colleagues, while continuing to be hands-on.  Participate in knowledge transfer, documentation and information sharing while staying abreast of new technology/technical areas.  A Bachelors Degree in an engineering discipline, Masters degree desired  At least 8+ years of experience in Systems Engineering/Architect position on Cyber and /or Space programs

Qualifications: (refer to Career Framework)

Willingness to travel up to 25% of time  US Government Secret security clearance or ability to obtain clearance required. Active Security Clearance preferred  US Citizenship required

Preferred Additional Skills:

Experience with emerging Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Modeling/Simulation is a plus

job_title_2: Director I, Data Products - BI & Analytics
job_description:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company.
As a Director I, Data Products with Liberty Mutual Insurance, you will be a key strategic leader responsible for creating and executing our BI and Analytics strategy for GRM. The leader will also be responsible for building/augmenting our BI and analytics solutions and toolkit used to drive various business lines and needs in GRM. This role will be responsible for helping define the strategy, vision and advanced processes for a set of Data & Analytics capabilities and tools that advances our platform towards analytics, machine learning and automation in the enterprise and enabling data as a service.
You will partner with internal business owners to understand business objectives, pain points and design product requirements. You will also collaborate with engineering teams to build capabilities that best leverage the right technology to meet business objectives and deliver value. This role will be responsible for simplification of our BI solutions and footprint by matching the right personas with the appropriate tools/solutions. This role will also be responsible for launching new technical solutions and tools to enable the business partners to achieve speed to market for data. This role requires having knowledge of data infrastructure and ability to drive insights through products and solutions.
The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, strategic, solution oriented, tactical and self-driven. This person should also be an articulate communicator, detail oriented, and committed to providing outstanding results every day. If you are passionate about data and the power of analytics to create industry re-defining insights and committed to the mission of enabling data to achieve an advantage, we want you to join our team!
This position will report to the Senior Director of Data Products and can be based in any of our offices in New Hampshire or in Boston, Seattle, and Indianapolis. We are also open to considering a remote/virtual hire.
Responsibilities:
Understand business needs and priorities to collaborate with leaders throughout the GRM organization and create the vision for the right business intelligence and analytics solutions
Own, create and improve the delivery and utilization of business intelligence data products and platform capabilities across the organization (On prem and Cloud)
Develop a strategy to leverage the right business intelligence solutions for cloud and enable data and technology to enable appropriate personas and needs and enable self service.
Product planning, defining detailed requirements, coordinating across teams (front end developers, data engineers, solution engineers, data scientists, data analysts, and executives), mitigating risks and balancing delivery timelines with technical constraints to support business objectives
Enable change and best practices through the BI and Analytics COE (Center of excellence)
Determine business requirements and produce supporting process design documentation that clearly articulates the requirements to the Data Engineering team
Develop and improve KPI’s reflecting appropriate usage of solutions based on persona, need and speed to market
Define project success criteria and business metrics to confirm results meet the business need
Leverage agile project management disciplines for planning and execution of data and analytics projects, including design, development, testing and deployment
Gather feedback and measure the performance of delivered products
Qualifications:
6+ years’ product management experience, ideally with experience in managing a global data product
Familiar with localization and other global requirements
3+ years of people management experience, either a leader of teams or a direct manager
Demonstrated experience with full life-cycle product management: problem definition and solution discovery, stakeholder buy-in, validation, launch, and ongoing operations
Experience working with Power Platform, Tableau, SQL, SAS, MicroStrategy, Looker or other reporting and data visualization tools
Experience tracking down and creating datasets, knowledge of preparation, organization and statistical analysis
Comfortable with quick iteration and experimentation
Creative problem-solving skills, analytical thinker and passion for new technology
Excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills; solid business acumen; well-honed influencing skills are essential.
Familiarity and the ability to combine data science with application of machine learning, computer vision, deep learning and artificial intelligence capabilities emerging in the industry
Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

job_description:
Company Description

ULC Robotics is a dynamic company growing at a fast pace. We are a leader in product development and engineering services for the natural gas, energy, industrial, and electric markets. We are committed to solving operations and maintenance problems while protecting the environment, reducing costs, increasing efficiency, and improving safety.
We re a global company of thinkers, problem solvers, designers and makers. We each play a unique role. Built on a legacy of innovation, ULC robotics is committed to leading the utility robotics revolution and has been since our start in 2001. We foster an environment which encourages the exchange of ideas and inspires change by challenging traditional thought and approaches to problem-solving. Though we are constantly evolving to meet the complex demands of our industry, we remain dedicated to creating an impact, locally and globally, through meaningful work. We are proud of how our technology helps utilities minimize their impact on the environment and the public while lowering operating costs.

We develop new technologies today, so we can change tomorrow.
Join ULC and be at the forefront of change!

If you have a passion to protect our environment, improve safety, and increase operational efficiencies and seek new challenges, this is the job for you.

Ideally, we are looking for someone with an engineering background in electrical and mechanical engineering with experience designing and integrating complex systems You are best suited for this role if you enjoy both technical and managerial roles and are passionate about developing technology to solve problems. You are an engineer with a strong technical background seeking to take your career to the next level or an experienced project manager with a varied set of backgrounds and experiences. Someone who is detail-oriented with a knack for solving problems and not shy to interact with clients is ideal. You can manage a constantly changing, varied task load with minimal supervision. A team-oriented and proactive attitude is essential
What does a day in the life of a Project Manager look like for ULC Robotics?
You will collaborate with engineering teams to solve technical challenges for our clients. Review project performance for completion on time, budget and to the highest level of quality. A prospective candidate will coordinate developing customer requirements, test plans, and procedures and generate project reports, proposals and presentations. You would be integral in reviewing new opportunities and helping the team to plan and acquire new projects.
To be successful, you will have the following:

Bachelor s degree in appropriate Engineering disciple (Electrical, Mechanical, Robotics) required
3+ years of overall engineering experience required
Direct experience working with an engineering group with a strong engineering background in high-tech fields
Experience in more than one area of product development: prototyping, design, fabrication, integration, and testing
Exemplary verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to travel domestically and internationally if required
Authorization to work in the United States- may consider sponsorship


Having any of the following is a plus:

A Master s or Ph.D. degree in engineering
Prior work on U.S. government projects
Innovative and creative mindset and a background depicting excellence in innovation – examples would be patents, publications, and cool personal projects
Entrepreneurial instincts
Knowledge and/or experience in one or more of the following areas: Control Systems, Artificial Intelligence, Sensors, Robotics
Experience writing proposals

Benefits

Our team is motivated, dedicated and thrives on developing industry-leading products and services that can transform the way our clients work. We foster a unique work environment that inspires employees to express their ideas and work collaboratively towards finding innovative solutions to problems. We attract top talent by offering some of the best benefits in the industry. Some of the benefits we offer our team are listed below:

Medical Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
401(k)
4 weeks of PTO on an annual basis (prorated on date of hire)
Aflac Insurance programs including

EOE/disability/veteran

job_description:
NVIDIA is looking for a Lead Software Architect to join the DRIVE OS Automotive Software team. In this role, you will play a key role in the design and evolution of the core automotive stack to support driver assistance and autonomous driving.
You will help the team address new business opportunities in challenging areas – solving unique challenges requiring novel software and hardware designs while being compliant to industry standards like ISO 26262 for safety.
What You'll Be Doing
Lead design and integration plans with software engineers and architects in system software, virtualization, trusted OS, graphics, compute, safety/security and multimedia to architect component level and system level solutions.
Ensure the overall product is safe and secure
Define strategic vision for the chip and HW platform together with adjacent software and hardware architects
What We Need To See
Expert level knowledge and experience in system software design and operating system fundamentals
Deep understanding of computer architecture, microprocessor concepts (caches, buses, memory controllers, DMA, etc.)
Validated leadership skills and strong ownership on past projects in an environment with complex software and hardware designs
Clear verbal and written communication with the proven ability to build consensus within a large organization
Experience with design and development software in compliance with industrial-grade quality standards (DO-178b, ISO 26262, SPICE)
Familiarity with kernel level security concepts; this includes familiarity with threat modeling techniques in addition to tooling for both static and dynamic analysis
BS or MS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related degree or equivalent experience and 12+ years of meaningful software development experience
Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd
Past AI/Autonomous System Software experience
Knowledge of virtualization platforms (XenServer, KVM, Hyper-V)
Previous experience in highly matrixed organizations in a leadership position
Experience with embedded system SW concepts, e.g.: RTOS and overlay programming models
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative, hardworking and proactive, we want to hear from you!
NVIDIA is owning the way in groundbreaking developments in Artificial Intelligence, High-Performance Computing and Visualization. The GPU, our invention, serves as the visual cortex of modern computers and is at the heart of our products and services.
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Principal Big Data Engineer
Duration: 6 Months to Permanent

Location: Charleston, SC. 29406

Must be US Citizen with ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance

SAIC is seeking a Principal Big Data Engineer in Charleston, SC to support SAIC’s health analytics/health informatics technologies team and build/implement breakthrough solutions that help improve healthcare delivery for millions of active, reserve and retired military and their beneficiaries worldwide. We’re seeking individuals who know and understand healthcare delivery, advanced health data analytics, healthcare electronic records end to end. We need experienced healthcare focused professionals who know and understand the importance of improving electronic healthcare records and healthcare records management.

The Principal Big Data Engineer develops parallel data-intensive systems using Big Data technologies. He/she exhibits an exceptional degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness and applies and/or develops highly advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories and concepts. He/she is viewed as an expert in the field.

Extensive experience in managing multiple data sources aligned with healthcare data sets, clinical data cases and experience working with data resident in multiple EHR systems.

Responsibilities can include

Establishes Data Lake in AWS cloud environment with APIs to access various tiers of data.
Works with the full open source Hadoop stack to include cluster management, data repositories, analytics software, and schedulers.
Works in public, private or government cloud environments to build scalable systems.
Determines the appropriate database given the data and analytics needs, whether file structures such as HDFS, relational databases including NewSQL, non-relational NoSQL databases including in-memory databases.
Establishes the extraction of data from legacy data systems into the proposed solution to be able to transfer as required externally with other systems and or organizations (i.e., the VA, Cerner) and understands Data Governance for Normalizing, Cleansing and Standardizing the legacy data for retrieval and viewing purposes.
Optimizes the distribution of data across nodes and the performance of NoSQL repositories and is familiar with installing in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Government Cloud environment.
Identifies performance bottle-necks and evaluates scaling benchmarks.
Participates with senior management to establish strategic plans and objectives.
Acts independently to uncover and resolve issues associated with the development and implementation of operational programs.
Recommends technological application programs to accomplish long-range objectives.

Required

Bachelors and nine (6-7) years or more experience; Masters and seven (4-6) years or more experience; PhD or JD and four (2-3) years or more experience.

Must have experience in at least 5 (five) the following technologies.
AWS Government Cloud
Amazon RedShift
Amazon RDS Aurora
NetApp
Data Warehousing
Data Lakes
QLIK
Tableau
Talend
Informatica
Red Hat OpenShift and Ansible
Python
R GUI
Spark
Carepoint
Extensive experience with full open source Hadoop stack, Cluster Management, Big Data Repositories (Warehouses, Lakes) and Cloud-Based Data Management Tools, Principles and Methodologies. Custom database sources could include SQL, Oracle, AWS Red Shift, PostGreSQL, Mongo DB, etc.)
Experience supporting implementations moving data into Amazon Web Services (AWS) Government Cloud environment.
Able to build business intelligence data mapping between data elements across various legacy health clinical/medical data systems. Understand merging medically coded data across coding types such as SNOMED CT, ICD10, CPT, CCS, etc.
Able to build Data Warehousing with the ability to query the stored data for Business Intelligence, Analytics, and Reporting. Support storage retention and disposition of data.
Expertise in and with Defense health clinical/medical data working in the healthcare industry.
Must be US Citizen with ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance

Desired

Experience in Health Systems Data such as Electronic Health Records (EHR) or Military Health (MHS) systems
Previous experience with any of the following systems is highly preferred:
Composite Health Care System – CHCS
Essentris
Surgical Scheduling System - S3
Anesthesia Reporting Monitoring Device - ARMD
Armed Forces health Longitudinal Technology Application -AHLTA/Clinical Data Repository - CDR
Experience with Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence/Natural Language Processing to help shape the data mapping within the solution.
Support secure encryption of interface transmissions from the Defense Medical Information Exchange (DMIX) Data Exchange Service (DES) system and the relational database.
Experience with other open source data tools like Sqoop, Oozie and Flume
Ability to obtain Secret clearance
Travel up to 10%

job_description:
Program Manager
Who are we?
SDL is the global leader and innovator in language and content management technology and services. We enable companies to create meaningful digital journeys and form important emotional connections with their global customers by powering the creation, translation and delivery of relevant, personalized content to make understanding possible. We are a dynamic, collaborative and globally diverse team, working together to completely transform how the world communicates and connects with one another through content. If you like making an impact, helping others, taking a fresh look at processes and tools, furthering an open an innovative culture and tend to generally look at even the smallest task in the context of how it impacts the overall organization – we should talk!
What is this role?
SDL Research is currently looking to hire a Program Manager to join our organization and help us evolve our proven record of Machine Translation innovation and success in delivering cutting edge Linguistic Artificial Intelligence technology to our valued customers.
In this role you will be responsible for planning, driving, coordinating and monitoring programs and activities throughout the program management lifecycle in order to support our organization's strategic short term objectives. You will also be tasked with managing and measuring progress and performance towards achieving long term company goals.
The perfect candidate is a service-minded self-starter with excellent organization, communication and adaptability skills that is experienced in project and program management, can collaborate with multiple teams and managers simultaneously and has an affinity for process and team productivity improvement.
Responsibilities:
Plan, implement and monitor programs in accordance with the mission, strategy and goals of the organization
Develop program status and success assessment protocols for evaluation and continuous improvement
Oversee multiple research and development team activities, ensuring program objectives are met in alignment with customer satisfaction, high quality standards and high team performance
Manage and analyze program risks and dependencies
Organize and facilitate stakeholder sync-ups to ensure communication regarding program progress and impediments is seamless and transparent
Support research and development teams and activities to guarantee a cadenced delivery schedule for services and new products versions
Manage and monitor program scope changes and interventions to ensure program objectives are not compromised
Manage and monitor customer escalations to guarantee appropriate prioritization and resolution
Produce accurate and timely reporting of program stats throughout its lifecycle to ensure accurate record keeping and optimize decision making processes

Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of experiencing in project and/or program management
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Outlook and SharePoint
Understanding of Agile frameworks and experience with Agile project management software
Bachelor’s degree or master degree in the field of operations, linguistics or strategy

Preferred Qualifications:
Understanding of NLP (Natural Language Processing) principles and hands-on experience with machine translation
Experience with creation and implementation of scaled processes and operations
Proven stakeholder management skills
Ability to analyze data and present metrics in order to facilitate decision making
High attention to detail and excellent ability to accommodate competing priorities in a fast-paced working environment
Ability to thrive and constantly perform while working to facilitate, support and monitor research and development efforts

Benefits:
Amazing benefits. (Seriously!)
Infinite training, professional development and personal growth opportunities.
The rare opportunity to impact how organizations communicate globally. There’s a reason we work with 90 of the top 100 brands.
Smart, engaged co-workers, a culture of diversity, innovation and opportunity.
Relaxed, fun environment with a game room, in house happy hours and many great office events throughout the year.
Great work life balance with 5 weeks of PTO and 40 hours of volunteer time per year!

SDL is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will be evaluated for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran, and disability status. For more information about EEO/AAP legislation please visit http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.
Should you require assistance in completing your application, please contact usrecruitment@sdl.com for accommodation.
Software and Services for Human Understanding

job_description:
INTERVIEWS WILL BE CONDUCTED VIA TELECONFERENCE.
MADEN TECHNOLOGIES seeks a dynamic and eager Manager of Human Resources (HR) to lead our growing business on a global basis! Our business evolution focuses on recruiting the right talent and maintaining our 90-percent-plus employee lifetime retention rate, high job satisfaction, and award-winning performance. This position will report to the CEO and is responsible for: (a) the leadership of the HR Department; (b) using a team-based approach to ensure that human capital initiatives are linked with company’s overall business strategy; and (c) managing all aspects of Human Resources — staffing and development, performance management, affirmative action programs, compensation and benefits, HRIS, organizational development, employee relations, compliance, and HR planning/practices. Experience managing an innovative HR services program for a Federal Government contractor is a must.
Maden Technologies was established in 1986 with headquarters in Arlington, Virginia. Our business serves federal, state and local, and commercial clients in Mainland USA, Puerto Rico and worldwide. Our leading-edge core competencies include space and terrestrial communications, environmental sciences, science and engineering, construction, and health care management and delivery. Our highest priority is the recruitment of technical professionals with expertise in Enterprise Architecture, Cloud Computing, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI), advanced Cybersecurity, and Engineering to support specialized work in Environmental Natural Resource Management (ENRM), Ocean and Fisheries solutions, health care management services, defense, and general contracting in building construction.
Qualified applicants will possess the credentials, proven experience, expert communications, and management proficiency in state-of-the-art recruitment, compensation, and jurisdictional compliance to support a business licensed to operate in multiple states and local jurisdictions.
We offer a competitive fringe benefits package with medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), holidays, and paid time off.
SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL:
Have experience in full-life cycle recruiting in the Federal Government and commercial environments
Enjoy achieving strategic goals in a teamwork environment
Pro-actively anticipate needs, requirements, and risk identification/mitigation
Partner with leadership to initiate, implement, and maintain programs and policies related to talent acquisition, compensation, benefits, performance management, learning and development, employee relations, HRIS, workforce planning, analytics and regulatory requirements
Offer guidance and creative problem-solving on solutions for the organization
Generate a strong and competent presence at all levels with the Human Resources Department and throughout the company


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage the full life cycle recruitment process for current and proposed positions, including technical and cleared personnel
Evaluate key organizational processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness
Manage quality and timely delivery of HR policies, processes, and programs
Execute various HR programs, including fringe benefits, compensation and incentive administration, 401(k), performance appraisals, and other key corporate programs
Educate, consult, and influence management regarding talent acquisition, selection, deployment, development, and retention
Give advice, counsel, and leadership regarding policy, practices, and decision-making for all HR issues and activities, including bonus and performance review, employee relations, diversity initiatives, training and development, compensation and benefits, employment, and organizational development
Ensure company compliance with DOL, EEOC, Veterans, and 401(k) reporting
Contribute to completing RFP and proposal responses, including the development of labor category descriptions and identification of appropriate salaries

REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS
Must be a U.S. citizen
Bachelor Degree in HR or related field
Minimum 5 years of HR-related experience required
Desire to work in a collaborative environment and solicit and give constructive feedback
Ability to multitask, adapt to changing priorities and new technologies, and meet deadlines
Knowledge of all Federal, state, local laws and regulations pertaining to functional areas of responsibility (i.e., Service Contract Act, Fair Labor Standards Act, Title VII, COBRA)
Experience using HR tools and databases
Knowledge of applicant tracking system and DOL compliance/reporting
Excellent written/oral communication and presentation skills
Ability to adapt to changing assignments, priorities, goals/objectives
Ability to anticipate organizational HR issues/needs and generate innovative solutions
Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize workload to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, with the ability to clearly communicate issues and ideas

job_description:
10+ years of experience in one or more of the following: Manufacturing, Supply chain, Industry 4.0, business development, strategic partnerships, program/product management, corporate strategy, technology strategy5-10 years selling or marketing technology, preferably cloud services and solutionsExperience with cloud computing and related conceptsStrong verbal and written communications skillsDemonstrated leadership skillsStrong negotiation skills, business knowledge, and financial acumenStrong analytical skills, including demonstrated ability to conduct detailed data analysis, use it to derive useful business insight, and apply that insight to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to colleagues and customers

Job Description
Amazon.com has been rated one of the most admired companies in the US, the #1 most innovative, and the #1 in Customer Service. Amazon’s technology business (Amazon Web Services) has a history and tradition of leading the world in Web-related technologies and services. With AWS, you have the chance to help individuals and businesses take their computing infrastructures and applications into “the cloud”, transform how they do business, drive new levels of growth, and create bigger and better outcomes for their customers.

Would you like to help our customers innovate like Amazon – and deliver breakthrough experiences for their end customers? Would you like to pioneer the use of cloud services to help drive innovation? Would you like to be part of building a fast-growing program to worldwide scale? Do you have the business savvy, technical knowledge, and leadership skills necessary to help AWS take its transformational messages to business customers, help them envision the possibilities that our services and solutions can create for them, and then help them unlock that potential value for their businesses?

We’re looking for an accomplished lead for the Americas Go To Market team to drive adoption of AWS emerging trends services and solutions in multiple categories with a specific focus and subject matter expertise in Supply Chain and/or Manufacturing (primary AWS services include Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Blockchain and Digital Transformation etc) within the US Southeast and MidAtlantic area. The right candidate for this role would have a combination of skills and experience developing and applying structured thought frameworks to enable technology - enabled business transformation, aligning business requirements with technology capabilities, formulating go-to-market strategies, creating and leading market-facing programs to execute those strategies, engaging with customers in business and technical roles, and collaborating cross-functionally with colleagues and partners to achieve tangible business outcomes for customers.

As an , you will be responsible for defining, building and deploying effective and targeted programs to accelerate broad based sales and business development activities for the AWS Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Blockchain and Digital Transformation platform/solutions. Your responsibilities will include partnering with the US Southeast Sales teams to define key market segments to target, driving the necessary business and technical relationships with customers and partners to establish new business in those markets, and enabling sales teams to drive day-to-day interactions with prospects in order to build and nurture long-term business opportunities. As a BDM, you will have the exciting oportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of AWS within Americas. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration across various customer segments, including large enterprises, mid-market companies, and startups. You will work very closely with Americas sales management, specialized sales and business development teams, AWS professionals in other market-facing functions, partners, sales enablement teams, and technical teams.

The ideal candidate has a background that encompasses strategic selling of technology-related products or services, business development for technology products or services, or management consulting at a leading professional services provider with a focus that includes technology-enabled transformation in multiple industries. This candidate will be competent and confident leading strategic and tactical initiatives that help customers envision new possibilities for their businesses and adopt existing and emerging technologies to achieve those possibilities in the form of tangible business outcomes that drive real value. The ideal candidate is experienced and effective engaging with business and technical customers at senior levels, including within the C-suite, with mid-level management, and at junior levels, at companies of all sizes (large enterprises, mid-market companies, and small companies). Startup experience is also helpful. He/she will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses, and will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, enterprise applications, and the role that technology plays in enabling transformational business change.

The Emerging Trends BDM will be responsible for:

Increasing adoption of AWS services and solutions categories in Supply Chain and/or Manufacturing (focused on Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Blockchain and Digital Transformation) to drive revenue growth for AWS;Proactively creating momentum internally and with customers, driving customer dialogues via AWS Sales and partner teams;Conceptualizing, structuring, and executing market-facing programs in collaboration with AWS teams across various market-facing and support functions;Conducting market analysis, shaping and negotiating deals, and creating scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling;Working closely with colleagues in Sales, Business Development, Marketing, and other market-facing and support roles to ensure alignment of strategic initiatives that drive adoption and growth of AWS market offerings;Partnering with other BDMs to ensure that service teams are aware of and aligned with geographic business segment needs at the Americas and Area levels;Communicating the benefits of cloud computing to customers, including IT architects, engineering teams, business executives in non-technical functions, and C-level executives;Engaging in customer dialogues with senior-level business and technical executives to discuss customer business issues and explore how specific technologies can help address those issues and create new opportunities;Engaging effectively with customers of all sizes (large enterprises, mid-market companies, and startups);Managing the sales cycle of an opportunity and partnering with various internal teams to develop, propose and close new business;Establishing metrics and tracking mechanisms to drive customer adoption, and using these tools to improve go-to-market strategies, programs, and approaches;Preparing and delivering business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress towards objectives;Educating and enabling sales teams and increasing the visibility of sales support across all AWS markets;Handling a high volume of simultaneous engagements amidst the fast pace of the cloud computing market.

Solid negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the businessExperience with, and detailed knowledge of the support market and insights related to cloud computing and ITStrong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skillsDemonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is keyExperience selling to Fortune 1000 and/or Global 2000 organizationsExperience with cloud computing and or related fields (IT, software, etc)MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
This position must be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp. offices with a preference for Atlanta.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation/Age.

** For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com **

job_description:
The Challenge:
Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.
We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to improve strategic innovation for the federal government. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll mentor teammates, develop algorithms, write scripts, build predictive analytics, apply machine learning, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers to help federal health organizations make informed decisions. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good in the federal government.
Empower change with us.
You Have:
5+ years of experience with machine learning, data science, or data engineering
2+ years of experience with natural language processing (NLP) model or deep learning (DL) model building
Experience with scripting languages, including Python and ProgR, and using packages used in machine learning applications or advanced data analytics
Ability to lead teams of data scientists and technical consultants in project based areas
Ability to articulate workflows and explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
TS/SCI clearance
MA or MS degree
Nice If You Have:
Experience with a wide variety of machine learning tools, including Elsticsearch, Keras, TensorFlow, and Caffee
Experience with extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes and tools
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.
Build Your Career:
At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect:
access to online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk
a chance to change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition
participation in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government
You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success.
We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

job_description:
Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Microsoft believes that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. The Microsoft Search, Assistant and Intelligence (MSAI) group is leading this effort. We are working to change the lives and work of hundreds of millions by building deep intelligence into the products that people use every day such as Outlook, Teams, Windows, Office, SharePoint and Cortana. By understanding our user’s preferences, communication and context across applications we can proactively and reactively help users accomplish more with less effort.
We are looking for a thought leader who can bring deep applied science experience and knowledge to help us in building the future of AI systems. As an applied scientist in MSAI you would work in an exciting and fast-paced environment, collaborating closely with teams across the company, including Microsoft Research (MSR). You will work as part of an organization that brings together talent in the areas of machine learning, natural language processing, deep learning, information retrieval, software engineering, and trustworthy computing. We value and encourage diversity in the belief that it leads to both great workplaces and great products.
Responsibilities
Lead innovative applied research programs in the area of Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning
Collaborate closely with Microsoft Research and product teams to create relationships and the next generation of innovation in our products and services
Support and develop a research culture within the MSAI organization that encourages experimentation and scientific process to drive innovation in our products and service
Communicate internally and externally through publication, presentations, and other mediums (e.g., blogs, press interviews) on research progress, major breakthroughs and product innovation
Qualifications
Applied Research experience in at least one of the following:
Machine Learning
Deep Learning
Natural Language Processing
Information Retrieval
AI fairness, transparency and ethics
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or closely related field, Masters or PhD preferred
8+ years of professional experience developing product level algorithms preferred, with a proven track record of successfully shipping applied research to production
Excellent problem solving and data analysis skills, with expertise in developing or applying predictive analytics, statistical modeling, data mining, or machine learning algorithms, especially at scale
Key differentiators: Grounded in a growth mindset, advocate for inclusion and diversity, and strong self-awareness

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
