job_description:
Key Role:
Lead, inform, and build data-fueled technology solutions that improve the mission of federal government clients, specifically the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and produce new and creative solutions that will become part of core deliverables and allow the firm to build new business with clients. Identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas, related to digital infrastructure, analytics and life science, including working with cross-functional team members.
Basic Qualifications:10+ years of experience with working in a fast-paced, test-driven, collaborative, and iterative development or engineering environment8+ years of experience with relational databases, BI, and analytics tools, including SQL, Tableau, or SAS6+ years of experience in delivering solutions that solve complex analytical problems, using quantitative approaches with a blend of analytical, mathematical, and technical expertiseKnowledge of advanced analytic techniquesKnowledge of statistical and predictive modeling concepts or machine-learning approachesKnowledge of government public health approaches to surveillance systems and data architectureAbility to obtain a security clearanceBA or BS degree
Additional Qualifications:Experience in working with the CDC or the public health domainKnowledge of artificial intelligence capabilities and modeling techniques a plusAbility to collaborate in a matrixed environmentPossession of excellent analytical skillsPossession of excellent oral and written communication skillsMA, MS, or PhD degree preferred
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

job_description: Are you passionate about solving world’s data challenges to power Artificial Intelligence? Do you thrive on managing and tackling complex engineering projects? Are you an effective communicator? Can you work across multiple disciplines, think ahead, while focusing on tasks at hand?Pandio is a fast growing startup that provides data logistics for intelligent systems. We solve our enterprise customers’ data challenges so they can build better AI and ML models. We are seeking a Sr. Project Manager who can take on customer facing projects and with attention to details, can successfully complete projects in a timely manner.As a Sr. Project Manager, you will drive Pandio's technical relationships with internal and external teams, answer key partner questions, and translate feature requests to technical, business, and product teams. You will coordinate across Pandio's internal technical business, and product groups to deliver timely solutions for partners. In managing the technical team’s success, along with the customer relationship, the project manager acts as the main point of contact for the project.Candidates must be located or willing to relocate to San Diego, California. The candidate will report directly to the CTO.Our team members are given great amounts of responsibility and trust early in their careers. While they work in teams, they often need to "think on their feet," using common sense and flexibility to make quick decisions on their own. They have demanding responsibilities so it is essential that they be energetic. They must know themselves very well and a sense of humor is a plus.Responsibilities:Provide leadership and direct teams in the delivery of high-quality services within committed time frames to the customer.Organizes cross-functional activities, monitoring team performance, and ensuring completion of the project i.e. product on schedule and within budget constraints.Collaborate with the customer in a consultative role when eliciting their business and technical requirements.Manage multiple projects (internal, external, & for multiple customers) in parallel.Build and execute operational and technical project plans working with our executive team.Operationalize control requirements and apply best practices across products and platform.Develop partner strategies and strategic development plans, including growth opportunities, action planning, and business growth forecasting.Develop and support technical partners and customers across Pandio's platform through the entire partner lifecycle.Provide support as a sales engineer for large media company partner integrations.Manage a variety of technical projects for partners: actively manage scope and change, identify risks and issues, prioritize conflicting needs, handle matters expeditiously and proactively, follow-through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.Establish a deep understanding of partner needs in product as a service (PaaS) verticals and leverage those insights to champion partner integrations with our technologies.Be the technical point of contact with existing and future partners using Pandio's platform.Qualifications:Experience scaling out a project management teams; understanding team limitations & knowing when to scale out, efficiently, as Pandio grows.Experience with cloud technologies, data science, AI, machine learning and natural language processing knowledge a major plus.Masters, SIx Sigma or Project Management certifications a plus.Engineering or strong technical background preferred, but not required.Must be well organized.Second language a plus.Relevant work experience with technology integrations, business requirements documents, and projects managed across Business and Technical teams.4-6 years of technical Project Management, Sales Engineer, Software Development, Customer Success, Partner Management, or Product Management experience in data, internet, or technology company.Competitive Benefits & Compensation:Competitive salary based on experience, plus Stock options & bonusesWe pay 100% insurance (medical, vision, and dental)Unlimited vacation daysFitness Center complete with locker room and shower offering weekly yoga and circuit training coursesThe Cantina (building break room offering coffee & cold brew, fresh gourmet food choices, premium DirecTV channels, wifi, shuffleboard, ping-pong, and more)Outdoor courtyard (wifi, comfortable areas for seating & dining)Fully stocked suite breakroom & Mr. Do! job_description: BeSmartee® disrupts the financial services industry with its award-winning, web-based mortgage lending software for lending institutions. Utilizing more than 165 direct vendor integrations, big data, artificial intelligence and process automation, BeSmartee’s Mortgage POS, TPO Platform and Home Equity POS offer high-touch, end-to-end production experiences that shorten lending cycles and reduce costs, taking today’s originators and borrowers deeper into the mortgage process, faster.What You'll Do:Manage relationship with clients and internal teams through email, video, and phone conferencing to problem solve, explain products and implementation schedules.Train the client's account specialists on how to use out productTravel 15% with clients to ensure services are functioning well and advise them of opportunities for additional services and product solutions.Document technical requirements, schedules and client interactions.Responsible for identifying potential areas of concern for clients before they arise and make recommendations based on recognizing a client’s current and future needs.Test, conduct quality assurance and validate for technical feasibility and product launch.Respond to technical concerns and problems, ensuring smooth new feature implementation and launch.Who You Are:Must have working knowledge of the mortgage industryAbility to manage multiple clients simultaneouslyAbility to work collaboratively with multiple team members across departments (sales, marketing, QA, developers, etc.)Superb attention to detail, good judgement, and listening skillsAbility to handle confidential materialAbility to build rapport with clientsDeadline and detail-orientedAbility to communicate effectively both orally and in writingJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $65,000.00 /yearExperience:mortgage banking: 1 year (Required)Paid Training:YesManagement:Ops ManagerSchedule:Monday to FridayBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Yes

job_description: JOB TITLE: Account Manager REPORTS TO:  Vice President, Customer Success Kount is the leading digital fraud prevention provider, serving more than 6,500 global brands including some of the largest and most recognized names in retail, eCommerce, and banking. Kount’s Identity Trust Global Network uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to analyze billions of trust and fraud signals in real-time in order to help businesses prevent fraud, protect accounts, and deliver personalized user experiences. Kount has an opening for an Account Manager in our Boise, ID office. Job Summary: The   Account Manager will provide support and manage the overall relationships for Kount’s existing customer base. As a key member of the account management team, you will have primary responsibility for customer retention and achieving existing customer revenue targets. You will achieve success through developing and building relationships with existing Kount customers to ensure service retention, managing all aspects of the contract renewal process, creating additional revenue opportunities with the sales of new products to existing customers, and ensuring the overall customer satisfaction for Kount’s existing customer base.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: Responsible for customer satisfaction, customer retention/churn reduction and managing the contract renewal process for Kount’s existing merchant baseResponsible for execution of all strategic and tactical activities assigned in effort to meet company objectives and existing customer revenue targetsParticipate with the Account Executive and Customer Success Manager for the policies, procedures and business ethics codes.Acts as a face of the company at tradeshows and other key industry events.QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field3+ years account management, or sales experience, with technology sales and/or the payment industry experience preferredExperience developing highly productive business relationshipsAbility to learn and job_description:
Bioworld Merchandising is a leading design and distribution company of licensed and private label apparel, headwear & accessories to all retails channels. We collaborate with some of the most widely recognized brand and retail partners in the world. We are seeking skilled candidates who are excited to join this amazing team!

We Believe in Great Brands: Our goal is to translate the brand story into product that is as innovative and distinctive as the brand itself.

Creative Culture: Our team brings to our brand partners a unique mix of creative product design paired with merchandising expertise. We believe innovation comes from a diversity of creative ideas.

We are the Market: Our team believes in full immersion to gain insight into retail markets, contemporary culture and consumer reaction.

We are currently seeking a Data / Analytics Manager to join our team of outstanding employees!

POSITION OVERVIEW

The Data / Analytics Manager will be responsible for managing and coordinating data management and business intelligence activities. This role will be responsible for driving business value with data. Data responsibilities will include the management and coordination of data cleansing, migration, and validation activities. Business Intelligence responsibilities will include the management and coordination of analysis, design, development, and testing activities for business intelligence reporting and dashboarding.

QUALIFICATIONS

Proven experience as a Sr. Data or Business Intelligence Analyst, leading large data initiatives.
In-depth understanding of ETL (Extract/Transform/Load) tools and techniques.
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), and the associated data / reporting.
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and/or a data lake.
Expert level experience with business intelligence reporting (Microsoft Power BI).
Strong familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.
Knowledge and familiarity with SQL database concepts and SQL queries.
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude.
Ability to discuss technical matters with non-technical business users.
Ability to coordinate and manage data activities performed by vendors.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, particularly Microsoft Excel.
Ability to work towards and meet project deadlines and milestones.
Ability to manage both internal and external data / BI team members.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with Azure BYOD or data warehousing.
Experience with Centric PLM is a plus.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO

Manage the data team, including data migration and business intelligence team members.
Manage and coordinate data cleansing, migration, and validation activities.
Provide and implement recommendations to improve data quality.
Coordinate with vendors on data migration and business intelligence activities.
Coordinate with business analysts and data owners on data testing and validation.
Coordinate analysis, design, and testing activities for business intelligence reporting.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Coordinate with BI developers on data modeling and report/dashboard development.
Utilize data visualization techniques in the design of BI reporting and dashboards.
Work with subject matter experts on BI requirements and user testing.
Oversee the design and deployment of the data warehouse/data lake.
Make recommendations on the best value propositions for artificial intelligence.
Advise and assist on best practices for data security and Segregation of Duties.
Make recommendations on database management, i.e. indexing, etc.
Assist with back-up documentation and audit requirements.
Assist with IT data change management procedures and audit for ERP and PLM.
Assist with annual restore and recovery tests.
Assist with data-related compliance requirements, such as PCI and GDPR.
Assist with data-related IT policy development, including data privacy policy.
Develop and update project documentation.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENT

Bachelor s Degree in Data Science, Data Management, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. 5+ years of related work experience.

BUSINESS HOURS

Corporate Office Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:30am-5:30pm Central

job_description:
With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 20,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.

CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL's therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.

We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Responsibilities

Reporting into the Global Head of Engineering Standards, the Director, Industry 4.0 will be responsible for introducing innovation and technology solutions and processes into the engineering, manufacturing and enterprise data environments, with the objective of advancing the CSL network toward Factory of the Future. The individual will be responsible for identifying Industry 4.0 trends that hold potential to achieve superior efficiency by driving solutions throughout the CSL manufacturing ecosystem.

The incumbent must demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of E2E processes for delivering Biotherapies across a global supply chain network.

As part of a global organization, the position requires approximately 50% travel. Peers will be located across CSL Behring US/EU/APAC sites.

The position requires the ability to build and maintain strong relationships and collaborate effectively with all levels and cross functionally within the organization.
Qualifications

Provide Global Engineering Leadership for Industry 4.0 US/EU/APAC network

Strategize with senior leadership to establish vision for Industry 4.0 across the CSL network

Partner with internal peers and stakeholders to identify efficiencies that may be gained across the E2E environment by applying innovative enterprise data management and manufacturing technology and processing solutions

Lead team of internal stakeholders and subject matter experts to evaluate opportunities for applying Industry 4.0 concepts - adopting intelligent solutions (up to artificial intelligence) for facilities, utilities, manufacturing equipment and enterprise systems across the E2E environment

Develop business cases for proposed investments

Represent innovation and technology topics within Engineering Council and facilitate collaboration to achieve consensus on disposition

Partner with internal peers and stakeholders to develop deployment plans

Resource design and realization to successfully deliver solutions which meet business case objectives

Establish metrics to demonstrate and socialize business value

Represent Global Engineering throughout the matrix environment in the communication of Industry 4.0 strategies, evolving trends, practices and delivery plans

Responsible for compliance of capital investments with design standards and standard design platform governance process

Provide Global Engineering Leadership for Engineering Standards

Responsible for Engineering Standards related to Industry 4.0 which will be developed to guide design and implementation of core platforms and processes

Develop standardized approach to Innovation/Technology, Robotics & Automation, Digital Twinning, Connected Services, Data Management, Product Robustness, amongst other evolving Factory of the Future concepts

Collaborate with internal peers to establish requirements and harmonize with supporting/dependent business processes

Translate innovation and technology vision into process requirements and supporting design attributes which form the basis for Engineering Standards

Responsible for ensuring harmonization of Industry 4.0 related Engineering Standards across the global network

Responsible for ensuring alignment of standards with Operations Value Streams

Maintain Engineering Standards throughout Life Cycle

Provide training and ensure institutionalization across engineering community

Provide Global Engineering Leadership in external Industry 4.0 community

Engage with industry peers to identify and collaborate around established and emerging innovation and technology which has potential to achieve superior business value by embedding Industry 4.0 within the CSL E2E environment

Benchmark with external peers to identify opportunities which realize the highest business value

Collaborate with industry peers to evaluate investments against comparable industry benchmarks to ensure target business value is achieved or exceeded

Responsible for socializing achieved value to engineering community and business leaders

Education

Bachelor's degree in engineering or related field required, advanced education preferred and/or an MBA with at least 15 years of engineering in a Life Sciences or related E2E Regulated manufacturing environment

Experience

Minimum of 15 years' experience in a manufacturing environment in roles with increasing responsibility within the engineering space.

Minimum 8 years of managerial experience

Direct experience with planning, design and implementation on innovative manufacturing technology related to highly complex engineering capital investments

Significant experience with automation and related system architecture utilizing Siemens and Rockwell Automation platforms

Substantial experience with Process Controls Systems GAMP Categories Level 0 through Level 3, ISA S88/S95 philosophies and related data acquisition and management

Direct experience with E2E fully integrated manufacturing processes utilizing various OEM unit operations and control platforms, harmonized across common process control and execution systems

Knowledge and application of Overall Equipment Effectiveness modules to maximize E2E manufacturing process efficiency

Experience with utilization of Connected Services technologies and IoT to collect and exchange data for predictive environment value realization

OEE

Knowledge of Digital Twinning and its application to E2E environments

Experience with Product Robustness and related data analytics

Excellent management skills and an ability to prioritize effectively to deliver results within aggressive timelines with the ability to work independently and as part of a team

Substantial prior experience in the development and implementation of engineering standards and life cycle management of tools, processes and methodologies

Demonstrated ability to deliver solutions in a dynamic environment

Direct experience with organizational transformation and related supporting engineering processes

Excellent collaboration skills and ability to align people and resources towards organizational success

Must demonstrate strategic thinking and innovative approach to responsibilities

Nimble and comfortable in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities

Must demonstrate maturity and seasoned judgment in reaching critical decisions

Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication are essential in this collaborative work environment

Competencies

Managerial Courage: Does not hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and 'actionable' positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.

Business Acumen: Knows how businesses work; knowledgeable in current and possible future policies, practice, trends and information affecting his/her business and organization; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace.

Drive for Results/Execution: Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.

Strategic Agility: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.

Decision Quality: Makes good decision based upon a mixture analysis, wisdom experience, and judgment; most his /her solution and suggestions turn out to be correct and accurate when judged over time; sought out by others for advice and solutions.

Innovation Management: Is good at bringing the creative ideas of others to market; has good judgment about which creative ideas and suggestions will work; has a sense about managing the creative process of others; can facilitate effective brainstorming; can project how potential ideas may play out in the marketplace.

Developing Talent: Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments; holds frequent development discussions; is aware of each person's career goals; constructs compelling development plans and executes them; pushes people to accept developmental moves; will take on those who need help and further development; cooperates with the developmental system in the organization; is a people builder.

Interpersonal Savvy: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.

Managing Vision and Purpose: Communicates a compelling and inspired vision or sense of core purpose; talks beyond today; talks about possibilities; is optimistic; creates mileposts and symbols to rally support behind the vision; makes the vision sharable by everyone; can inspire and motivate entire units or organizations.

Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvement in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.

Organizing: Can marshal resources (people, funding, material, support) to get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently.

Priority Setting: Spends his/her time and the time of others on what's important; quickly zeros in on the critical few and puts the trivial aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks; creates focus.

Negotiation Skills : ability to work into a matrix organization and able to influence and persuade, without having a direct authority

Communication: ability to dialogue and convey effective message through the organization at different levels and across cultural differences; unbiased.

Financial Acumen: understand business needs and translates into plans and actions with a clear and measurable value proposition.

Basic understanding of c-GMP's and EHS&S requirements globally.

Mature Understanding of Contracting models and its applicability worldwide.

Ethical conduct: understanding of owning anticorruption practices.

Capabilities

Worker Type:
Employee

Worker Sub Type:
Regular

job_description:
Coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.

At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Our Customer strives to reduce their burden by replacing manual methods with technology enabled automated processes. So, as our customer becomes an even more "source rich" entity, the key to retaining the intelligence and operational advantage for the US and its allies is to leverage Machine/Deep Learning (ML/DL) and Computer Vision (CV) in the analytic environment. The entity who most effectively and quickly converts data into actionable intelligence has the advantage. The SAFFIRE effort enables our customer to define and establish workflows and methodologies which fully leverage investments already made in Activity Based Intelligence (ABI) and Structured Object Management (SOM) to maximize the analytic impact of applying CV for Automation, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Augmentation (AAA).

The position is to provide technical lead of the Computer Vision (CV) product


Position is contingent upon program award expected in Summer 2020

This position requires an active TS/SCI security .


To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking. Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
MedicalDental401kPaid time offWork/life balanceCareer developmentMentorship opportunitiesRewards & recognition
Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Basic Qualifications:
Experience in Computer Vision and AI/ML

Previous technical product lead experience

Application software design/development experience

Ability to communicate effectively and work in a collaborative
environment; Agile process in DevOps Organization

Proficient in 2 or more of the following languages: Python, Java,
JavaScript, Angular
Desired Skills:
Knowledge of the following COTS/FOSS Technologies:
Kubernetes, Elastic Search, GeoServer, Amazon
Cloud Services / Cloud Migration, Big Data Analytics,
IRA, Jenkins, Ansible

Familiarity with AI/ML and deep learning techniques
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Experienced Professional

job_description:
The Ads Delivery Team’s mission is to make every impression meaningful. We help advertisers to achieve business goals balanced with users’ goals of having the most engaging content and ads to view on Facebook. It’s having a big impact on the ecosystem and company revenue with a portfolio of products or platforms such as ads targeting, ads delivery, dynamic ads, prediction, simulation, ads score and optimizations. TPMs can provide technical vision and leadership across teams to bring Ads Delivery Products to the next higher ground.
Technical Program Manager, Ads Delivery Responsibilities
Develop overall strategy, product roadmap and tactical business decisions for Ads Delivery products and platforms.
Define and own metrics as key performance indicators that measure the impact of Ads Delivery Products.
Establish shared goals with product teams across the company to get alignment and to drive optimal results for business, people, partners and Facebook.
Provide hands-on program management during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases.
Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery. Provide day-to-day coordination and quality assurance for projects and tasks.
Proactively identify, mitigate and manage risks to ensure success.
Collaborate with Engineering, Product, Marketing, Design, Contents, Privacy and Data Science teams for product requirements, scope and implementation.
Drive internal process improvements across multiple teams and functions.
Own joint technical roadmap, prioritization and alignment.
Minimum Qualifications
B.S. Computer Sciences or 5+ years of Software Application development experience.
5+ years of experience working across functions (Engineering, Product Management, Legal) in order to deliver a product or features.
5+ years of organizational coordination experience in a technical company.
5 or more years of problem-solving experience with large scale technical systems.
5 or more years of experience understanding product requirements and translating those product needs into plans.
Preferred Qualifications
PMP Certification (PMI).
Technical Industrial experience in large scale Machine learning/Artificial intelligence or scaling out data engineering and infrastructure.
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

job_description:
Project Manager - (SO00069344-1-1-1)


UST Global is a private high growth organization headquartered in Orange County California and is a leading provider of Advanced Computing and Digital Services for Global 1000 companies worldwide. Our next-generation digital consultancy is the ideal place for you to grow your career. Are you up for the challenge? Read on!

Description

Project Manager Safe Agile


Company


UST Global is a leading provider of platforms, digital innovation, artificial Intelligence and end to end IT Business services and solutions for Global 1000 companies. We are transforming corporations through deep domain expertise, knowledge based ML platforms, as well as profound anthropological efforts to understand the end customer and design products and interactions that create delight. We are deeply committed to developing a comprehensive understanding of our clients problems and to develop platforms to address them.

The Project Manager is responsible managing the different work streams of a distributed Scrum team, as well as assisting with facilitating the Agile process and removing roadblocks to get teams working effectively. Additional responsibilities include educating, training, evangelizing, and encouraging a continuous and transparent project management and Agile process, and to drive improvement philosophy at all levels of the development organization.

Project management relative to migration of large applications or development of large IT projects involving multiple teams and work streams preferred. Responsible for delivering IT Services projects to schedule, budget and quality. Experience executing projects using Agile methods. Excellent stakeholder relationship management, including external customer facing experience is required. PM must possess the skills to successfully lead and manage the project team and project stakeholders, and have expertise recognized and requested by customers Understand the big picture, priorities and align the customers and technical staff to meet those objectives. The Project Manager should be able play the role of product owner as well.

Essential Duties

Guiding the team and organization on how to use Agile Scrum practices and values to delight customers.
Guiding the team on how to get the most of out self organization.
Guiding the team on self organizing to fill in the intentional gaps left in the Agile Scrum frameworks SAFe Frameworks.
Assessing the Scrum Maturity of the team and organization and coaching the team to higher levels of maturity, at a pace that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organization.
Removing impediments or guiding the team to remove impediments by finding the right personnel to remove the impediment.
Building a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis on healing and problem solving.
Facilitating getting the work done without coercion, assigning, or dictating the work. Facilitating discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution.
Assisting with internal and external communication, improving transparency, and radiating information.
Supporting and educating the Product Owner, especially on grooming and maintaining the product backlog.
Providing all support to the team using a servant leadership style whenever possible, and leading by example.
Collaborate across package development teams and other functional groups as required to remove impediments and deliver on time for a successful project deliveries.
Under the technical and functional requirements from the business and other stakeholders and convert then in to user stories for the development team.
Required Skills Experience

Experience in playing the Scrum Master role for at least 2 years for a software development team that was diligently applying Scrum principles, practices, and theory. Adjust based on your necessity . Project Manager experience with additional Agile exposure will be considered.Business analysis and Technical analysis skills are required for this project.Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency.
Knowledge of various well documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach example numerous Burndown technologies, various Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc. .
Excellent communication and mentoring skills
Preferred Skills Experience Any of these is a plus

Experience is playing the Scrum Master role for at least two years for a software development team that was diligently applying Scrum principles, practices, and theory. Adjust based on your necessity
Knowledge of other Agile approaches XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD,SAFe etc.
Awareness and experience with widely successful Agile techniques User Stories, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games. Applicable knowledge of the technologies used by the team.
The experience in applying a wide variety of well documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach example various Burndown technologies, many Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc. .

Bachelor

job_description:
Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as :
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.
Logistics and Location
We are hiring for Raleigh, NC.
U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.
Flexibility to travel and/or relocate within the US as per project requirements.

job_description:
COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Military Veteran Modeling & Simulation Leader. Small company style so you'll wear Product Owner, Project Manager and Software System Engineer hats
LOCATION: Work Remote- work from anywhere USA. Ideal cities; Washington, DC area, Orlando FL, Denver, CO. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Military Veteran Modeling & Simulation Leader
We are looking to bring on a dedicated Veteran Leader (aka Product Owner / Software System Engineer) to work closely with our software developers on our primary software applications that include web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts, as well as backend components with custom Artificial Intelligence (AI) engine, military modeling and simulation framework (M&S), and integration capabilities for our own front end and for 3rd party systems. This web-based system encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, COA analytics, wargaming, and integration with other military and simulation systems. As the feature set grows, we need to ensure that user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the military users can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.

In this role, you will become the Subject Matter Expert (SME) of military Courses of Action analysis, wargaming and simulation software systems. Prior military tactical experience and/or understanding of the military operations and capabilities would be a strong asset, although not required.

You will communicate with the clients to assist with gathering feedback and new requirements and decomposing them into actionable, well-defined user stories and tasks. You will work with the development team to design solutions to customer needs, help document the system and feature design, and communicate it with key stakeholders outside of the company. You will take part in design of UI/UX and military modeling for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs, feedback, and your own recommendations for usability improvements. You will work directly with the development team to manage and prioritize backlog, track developer progress and guide them in making decisions to ensure end software closely matches user needs. As a superuser of our software you will use the software, communicate insights for the development team, and demonstrate the functionality to the current or prospective customers. You will support our integration efforts through close communication with the product owners and software engineers of the other companies to make sure that the end product fits customer needs, and to represent and advocate for the technical approach designed by our development team.

Key Skills to Have
Strong Military experience; Officer level, Leader and tactical/combat strongly preferred, some combo required
Modeling and Simulation exp; wargaming preferred, training soldiers, mapping
Technically savvy
Excellent communicator
Dependable, creative, and detail oriented
Great Experience to Have, Some Combination needed
Representing technical team in meetings
Capturing user needs
Managing the development backlog
Planning the work of software developers
Software development experience
Technical writing
UI/UX design
Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

Expert (SME) of military Courses of Action analysis, wargaming and simulation software systems.  Prior military tactical experience and/or understanding of the military operations and capabilities would be a strong asset, although not required.  Key Skills to Have.  Strong Military experience; Officer level, Leader and tactical/combat strongly preferred, some combo required.  Excellent communicator.  Experience to Have, Some Combination needed.  Software development experience

job_description:
Botkeeper is a virtual robotic bookkeeping platform transforming the accounting industry. By the end of 2018 we were named a Cool Vendor in AI by Gartner, one of BostInno's Coolest Companies, and one of Business Insider's Enterprise Startups to Bet Your Career On in 2019. Botkeeper has raised over $22.5M in our seed and A rounds from Google's Gradient Ventures, Greycroft, and Ignition Partners. Botkeeper is truly the future of bookkeeping!
Botkeeper is seeking a Certified Salesforce Administrator. In this fast paced, dynamic opportunity the Certified Salesforce Administrator will not only administrate the platform, but be responsible for gathering requirements from different business units across multiple departments within the organization. Proven experience demonstrating an understanding of Salesforce Lightning and Communities is required. In addition, this Certified Salesforce Administrator will ideally have exposure to Ordway. Candidates with a strong knowledge of SQL, workflows, and API's will be highly considered.
Required Skills:
MUST hold a CURRENT Salesforce Certification
Past experience with gathering requirements
Administrating SFDC for organizations with multiple departments
Proven ability to gather requirements, functional specifications, QA test scripts is ideal
Experience working with Salesforce Lightning and Salesforce Community Cloud
Experience with Salesforce CPQ
Additional Skills Desired:
SQL Experience
Workflows
API's
About Botkeeper:
Botkeeper is a progressive software company with over 1000 clients in its early stages of growth automating financial bookkeeping. We are bringing the next wave in machine learning and artificial intelligence technology to an important and critical aspect of any business. All companies struggle with bookkeeping, prone to error and human inference along with agonizing data entry, reconciliation, and general upkeep in financial bookkeeping. Botkeeper performs all associated tasks not limited to entries, tracking and schedules of revenue, deferred expenses accounts for payroll, reconciliation of bank accounts, and sending invoices to clients. Now scaling, we are seeking the world's best talent to achieve the true future of bookkeeping.
Botkeeper Benefits:
Competitive compensation, healthcare, and unlimited PTO. Additional benefits include annual company retreat, opportunity for growth, and a team of smart colleagues to collaborate with.

job_description:
Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.

We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all.

The Argo AI Software TPM team is a highly dynamic and cross-functional team. The team is responsible for the planning, technical cross-check, and plan execution of everything from lower level tasks to organizational level projects. This role will focus on supporting the different perception teams from Detection to Calibration and Localization. As a TPM, you will be responsible for leading planning and execution across multiple teams and initiatives within the Perception group to support the design, development, and optimization of new machine learning algorithms and AV software.

What you'll do:

Work with team leads, individual contributors, and other TPMs (Software and Hardware) to advance the Argo AI software products and processes
Work with perception teams to develop and optimize timing requirements, objectives, and interdependencies with activities such as, but not limited to: AV feature improvement and development, AV performance enhancements, traditional computer vision techniques and training and management of machine learning models
Develop detailed implementation plans, maintain alignment, and monitor program status across multiple activities to reduce or remove dependencies
Ensure timely delivery of deliverables and system capabilities according to an evolving, and faced-paced, program schedule
Maintain a strong technical understanding of the entirety of the program across the entire lifecycle

What we're looking for:

Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Experience working with Machine Learning or Computer Vision techniques
Hands-on experience and strong background with modern project/software management processes and tools, e.g., agile, scrum, Jira/Rally, SmartSheets, and Google Suite
Hyper-organized mindset - able to be an influencer of projects to lead development, operations, and logistics toward a common goal
Works effectively under extreme pressure - consistently delivers excellent results and high output rates in a fast-paced environment

At Argo AI, we have a strong emphasis on creating a highly effective team environment. Thus, we seek candidates that can work effectively with others across a broad range of disciplines.

Argo AI is an equal opportunity employer that believes in diversity as a strength and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We know it takes competitive benefits to fuel a team that works hard and enjoys the challenge. At Argo AI, you can expect stellar perks to support your best self:

High-quality individual and family health, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan
Paid parental leave
Unlimited vacation
Daily catered lunches and snacks
Free onsite or adjacent parking
Commuter reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Professional development reimbursement

Argo AI is a LinkedIn Top 50 Startup

job_description:
Bottomline is at the forefront of digital transformation. We are a growing global market leader uniquely equipped to address the changing needs of how businesses pay and get paid. Our culture of Working with and for each other enables us to delight our customers. We empower our teams to think like owners driving customer satisfaction, helping them grow their business and win in their markets.

We are looking for Senior Product Manager, Digital Banking IQ Insights to innovate, win, and grow with us.

As a member of the Banking Solutions team you will be responsible for leading a team of product owners to become the product champion for the assigned products. You will be responsible for studying market problems and helping to find innovative ways to solve those problems. You will gather high level problems and requirements from primary constituents including: the sales organization, the client base, product development, support organizations, client services, education and corporate marketing. This senior role is responsible for the product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle, including: gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision and roadmap. You will work closely with your team to help communicate the problems we want to solve for our customers to our engineering teams. You will be responsible in providing Go to Market materials to our marketing team, and assist with training our sales and support teams to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met.

Digital Banking IQ Insights is a critical component of Bottomline's Intelligent Engagement platform, which helps leading banks acquire, deepen and grow their most valuable banking relationships. Digital Banking IQ Insights is a cloud-based solution that provides commercial, retail, wealth, and other bankers with timely, actionable insights into growth opportunities and risks across their customer base. It also provides deep customer knowledge and a collaborative relationship management platform to help cross-functional teams develop and execute growth strategies tailored to the unique needs of each banking client.

How you'll contribute:

Define Product Vision:Vision, customer challenges from product perspective, align to Portfolio Business goals, market perspective for each product and competitive analysis tied to product/features
Define Product Strategy:SWOT tied to product/features, user personas, product initiatives mapped to portfolio goals/initiatives, GTM considerations from product perspective
Partner with Portfolio leads to define and manage the Product P&L including monthly performance
Define and Manage the Roadmaps and Releases to support business goals and initiatives
Define and Manage the Features for each release on the roadmap to support business goals and initiatives
Define, measure, and analyze User / Client Experience Goals and Measures
Build and manage collaborative, cross-functional Bottomline and client program delivery teams
Partner with Sales and Customer Success teams to ensure alignment with overall client relationship goals and activities
Model and forecast business trends based on historical data sets and planned product changes or feature launches.
Act as a visible and vocal champion for the product, helping to resolve issues and remove roadblocks
Collaborate with third party vendors to scope, design, and implement technical integrations to Digital Banking IQ Insights and other Bottomline solutions
Identify, evaluate and deploy new technology that streamlines processes and operations
Work with Marketing to create go to market plan and marketing materials to prepare for product launch
Travel to customers and interview users

What will make you successful:

Required Skills:

Minimum of 8 years' experience as a Product Manager
Experience running product management across the Analytics spectrum ranging from basic operational reports up to predictive analytics, including Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Ability to lead definition of key performance indicators / metrics
Experience working with data models, reporting and visualization tools Data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, etc.
Experience with business intelligence pipelines and data warehousing solutions
Proven mentor skills and demonstrable knowledge of SDLC, Agile development methodologies, and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)
Experience with managing offshore product owners and development teams
Superior written and verbal communication skills with audiences at all levels
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Proven track record of timely, high quality product delivery
The ability to travel up to 50%

Preferred Skills:

Experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools such as Salesforce
Experience in the FinTech or Banking industry
Experience designing and deploying integrations with third party enterprise software systems
Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines consistently
Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
Ability to demonstrate product in front of large customer forums or at sales engagement
Knowledge of JIRA, Aha!, and Microsoft Office

Education and Experience:

A Bachelors degree in finance business, or technology related field
Pragmatic marketing certified


You'll love Bottomline because in everything we do we seek to delight our customers and we are passionate about building a company of which we can all be proud, and this starts with building amazing teams filled with team members that challenge you every day.


Start your #LifeAtBT

Customer Service, SaaS , Banking , Leadership, Process Improvement , SaaS based FinTech, global

job_description:
Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients?
At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you’ll have the chance to create a difference in people’s lives every single day.
AstraZeneca is investing heavily in data management and analysis capabilities, through its long-term Growth Through Innovation Strategy. The DS&AI team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we seek to:
Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targets
Transform R&D processes
Speed the design and delivery of new medicines for patients
The R&D Data Office, within DS&AI, is a key organisation to deliver upon AstraZeneca’s strategy. Data Office operates a central capability, with R&D wide accountability, to ensure that we harness the power of data to drive innovative science. Data Office will govern data, drive data quality and ensure our data is readied for analytics, crafting paved-paths for scientists to perform data-driven research, without compromising our legal restrictions or ethical principles.
Within Data Office, your role is Senior Data Provisioning Lead, a member of a dedicated Data Provisioning Operations team. You will lead end-to-end activities associated to Data Provisioning including: Liaising with both external collaboration partners and key internal partners; taking on leadership of high-priority and multifaceted data provisioning projects, performing risk assessment associated to data-sharing, with emphasis on AstraZeneca’s four sharing principles – business sensitivity, legal rights, ethical and scientific merit; and leading cross-team activities to achieve delivery outcomes. Crucially, your role will drive the maintenance and improvement of the four sharing principles to make data available for re-use within or outside AstraZeneca.
To be successful in this role you must have excellent critical thinking skills, the ability to handle multifaceted, cross-functional projects, and be able to communicate with partners from different experience levels and cultures. Overall, you will drive data provisioning activities to enable data science that will directly support the scientific research required to get new medicines to our patients.
Tasks and responsibilities
Build strong working relationships within AstraZeneca and with external collaborators in-line with AstraZeneca ethical business policy
Successful end-to-end management (planning, execution and closure) of high-priority and complex data provisioning projects
Coordinate data provisioning requests and associated information from cross-functional areas
Responsible for tracking progress of requests and project activities, ensure relevant information is collected at each stage and responsible for keeping each request running smoothly
Acting as a central coordinator for projects requiring cross-functional activities, including arranging, hosting and minuting meetings, coordinating actions to-time and to-task
Monitor request and project progress, to handle and seek mitigation for any issues that might arise
Manage interface between AstraZeneca collaboration partner(s) to clarify data requirements, proactively identify, mitigate and manage risks that may impact any partners
Work with the Data Provisioning team and other partners to identify and eliminate blockers
Ensure data sharing standards and requirements are met
Use tools to monitor and report on progress of requests and projects
Support the Data Provisioning team in considering ways to improve project and data provisioning processes and ultimately value to our customers
Minimum requirements
Proven work experience in a project management role
Must have a high level of attention to detail
Ability to employ professional judgement and analytical skills to manage complexity uncertainty, project risks, stakeholder expectations and project timelines
Must be self-motivated, goal-oriented, and able to demonstrate excellent customer service skills at all times
Flexible with creative thinking skills
Excellent multi-tasking and time-management skills
Strong communication, negotiation and teamwork skills
Strong analytical skills
BSc in Business Administration, related field, or equivalent professional experience
Leadership Core Capabilities: Influencing, innovation, business awareness
Preferred experience and key factors
Industry-recognised Project Management certification highly desirable
Experience from Pharma industry is significant advantage
Experience in a data management role a significant advantage
For the right candidate, there are opportunities to for career progression both within the Data Provisioning team, within the Data Office and more widely within AstraZeneca.
Next Steps – Apply Now

job_description:
Job Details
Job ID: 12092

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a Manager for the AI (Artificial Intelligence) and Analytics Group (174B) in the Artificial Intelligence, Analytics and Innovative Development Division (1740). This individual will be responsible for managing a team of approximately 20 people. In this role you will work closely with customers from various JPL directorates, especially ITSD, Business, ESD, the Communications and Education Directorate and with Flight projects as well as other groups within JPL to meet customer needs.

Responsibilities:
Manage the innovation roadmapping areas for AI and Analytics, working closely with the Enterprise 2.0 analytics efforts, the Data Science Working Group, the Division Manager and the cross functional team including Cyber, IT Business and Chargebacks, Networking and ITSD’s Project Management Office.
Work with the technical divisions in ITSD and ESD to ensure that the group is providing the appropriate functional support for evolution of AI, Analytics and Data Science at the laboratory.
Routinely review new AI and Analytics techniques, innovative tools and streamlining efforts for growing the AI and Analytics discipline while engaging the broader community around the lab through working group meetings.
Be accountable for schedule, resources and technical performance of all assigned group activities.
Monitors day-to-day activities of staff and makes decisions/weighted recommendations on hiring, promotions, salary changes, performance appraisals, etc.
Administers and executes policies and procedures and recommends improvements and/or makes changes to operating policies and procedures.
Assigns tasks and monitors daily organizational operations according to established guidelines, procedures and policies.
Manages and authorizes budget and expenditures.
May provide project/task leadership and/or coordination.
May represent own organization on Laboratory committees.
Frequently interacts with supervisors and functional peers.
Functions as an advisor to other organization regarding tasks, activities, and operations.
Conducts presentations of technical information concerning specific projects or schedules.

Qualifications

Required Skills:
Typically requires a Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related discipline with a minimum of 9 years of related experience; Masters degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 7 years of related experience; or PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 5 years related experience. Minimum of 2 years of lead experience.
Demonstrated experience leading teams charged with developing new and innovative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Analytics applications in support of IT.
Demonstrated experience with the ongoing support and maintenance of AI, Analytics and Data Science applications.
Extensive understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, and concepts in the development of AI, Analytics and Data Science in a cross platform, industry standard fashion.
Expertise with new techniques in math, statistics, visualization, and generalization from these techniques.
Expertise in identification, prototyping, and selection of new AI, and Analytics techniques for study and investigation.
Has complete knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of AI, and Analytics providers.
Knowledge of service centers, budget and schedule experience as well as the chargeback system.
Excellent verbal, presentation, and written communication skills.

Desired Skills:
Has complete knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations across a range of applications.
Demonstrated experience interfacing with missions and projects and program offices in the areas of AI, Analytics, and Data Science applications.
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of business line activities within JPL’s various directorates.
Demonstrated experience of project or sustained application deliveries to JPL’s various directorates.
Considered an expert in engaging ITSD, mission and user community in AI and Analytics, and Data Science innovation.
Ability to build and motivate a technically strong team with the necessary depth and breadth of expertise.
Proven ability to work effectively with people.
Experience leading AI and Analytics evaluations and deployments.

Work Authorization
Ability to Obtain Work Authorization

job_description:
BAE Systems is looking for an experience Database Administrator for their USMC Wargaming Center which will be developed and operated from our McLean VA location. This is a 2 year opportunity which will transition into a 5 year opportunity in the Quantico VA area. The Marines are building a new Wargaming facility on Quantico VA which will run 16 wargames a year and multiple classification levels. Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, will all be used to deliver state of the art wargaming capabilities to the USMC. This is a very exciting opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a large contract with a long future. Candidates do not need clearances at this time but will be submitted for TS/SCI clearance which will be need 2 years in the future when we move the Quantico location.



Required Skills and Education

Bachelors with 12 years of Database Administration experience,
Need a strong foundation of technical expertise, in addition to the ability to communicate technical concepts to both non-technical and technical team members.
Experience in advanced SQL, or Microsoft technologies. Should be well-versed in current events in the database industry in order to maintain a modern, relevant skill set. Beyond the technical side, database administrators have strong organizational ability and are flexible and adaptable. They foster strong relationships with customers and colleagues alike.
Role involves not only setting up and deploying the software for the database server, but also transferring it onto the new platform. Other duties may include extraction of data, transformation, managing, monitoring and updating very large databases (VLDB), backup and recovery operations in the event of server failure as well as managing security, authentication and consulting audit trails to confirm or deny access.
Must also able to quickly troubleshoot and respond to problems and tweak the database to operate as efficiently as possible.

Data modeling and database design. Must possess the ability to create an efficient physical database design from a logical data model and application specifications. If the data resource management discipline has not been created, must be responsible for data modeling, normalization, and conceptual and logical design.

Metadata management and repository usage. Must collect, store, manage, and enable the ability to query the organization's metadata. Without metadata, the data stored in databases lacks true meaning.

Database schema creation and management. Must be able to translate a data model or logical database design into an actual physical database implementation and to manage that database once it has been implemented.

Backup and recovery. Implementing robust backup and recovery procedures is the insurance policy of the DBA. Must implement an appropriate database backup and recovery strategy based on data volatility and application availability requirements.

Ensuring data integrity. Must be able to design databases so that only accurate and appropriate data is entered and maintained.


Performance management and tuning. Must be able to proactively monitor the database environment and to make changes to data structures, SQL, application logic or the DBMS subsystem to optimize performance.

Ensuring availability. Must be able to ensure data availability using non-disruptive administration tactics.

SQL code reviews and walk-thrus. Must possess in-depth SQL knowledge so they can understand and review SQL and host language programs and to recommend changes for optimization.

Procedural skills. Must possess procedural skills to help design, debug, implement, and maintain stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions that are stored in the DBMS.

Data security. Responsible to ensure that only authorized users have access to data. This requires the implementation of a rigorous security infrastructure for production and test databases. And a database auditing capability to document compliance.

Capacity planning. Must be prepared to support more data, more users, and more connections. The ability to predict growth based on application and data usage patterns and to implement the necessary database changes to accommodate the growth is a core capability of the DBA.

General database management. Must understand the basic tenets of relational database technology and be able to accurately communicate them to others.







Preferred Skills and Education

Masters Degree

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security

BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That’s BAE Systems. That’s Inspired Work.
