job_description: Position Summarydata.org is a platform for partnerships to build the field of data science for social impact (DSSI). The Executive Director will oversee strategic growth, organizational operations, partnerships, advisory board engagement and grant making for data.org. The role requires an experienced, entrepreneurial, charismatic, collaborative and thoughtful individual who is capable of engaging on a global stage and mobilizing leaders across industry, civil society and foundations – all in the pursuit of shaping a movement that leverages data science to tackle far-reaching, global challenges.Launched in January 2020 and building on an initial five-year, $50M commitment from the Rockefeller Foundation and Mastercard, data.org envisions a world that uses the power of data science to help solve society’s greatest challenges and improve lives across the globe. Since its launch, additional funders and technology companies have committed to joint projects and investments, and data.org has been established as an independent initiative with secure funding for staff, operations and programs.data.org will operate as a platform for partnerships driving three strategic pillars of work:1) proving the case for DSSI by funding and sharing successful examples of how data science can effectively address complex social problems; 2) strengthening the capacity of people and organizations to leverage data science for social impact; and 3) establishing a public commons to deliver a set of open-sourced goods (products, tools, insights, etc.) that transform the social impact ecosystem.The Ideal CandidateThe Executive Director will be an experienced, and collaborative team-builder, a leader with an entrepreneurial mindset who possesses strong oral and written communications skills and is sensitive to the needs of various stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be excited by new challenges and be ready to help shape data.org into the premier platform for collaboration around data science for social impact. The candidate will be familiar with the global artificial intelligence and data science landscape and be able to successfully work with stakeholders, partners and the advisory board to set clear goals for the organization and implement action plans that systematically achieve them.The ED will be the face of the organization and the ambassador for its field-building mission. S/he will be responsible for promoting thought leadership to a global audience, using data.org as a platform for convening senior leaders from a network of mission-aligned organizations to create powerful partnerships for turning ideas into action. The ED will have an established reputation of competence, thoughtfulness, vision, and leadership across multiple sectors and stakeholders within and outside of the U.S.The ED will lead the data.org team, building a culture of excellence, efficient execution, and meaningful collaboration. S/he will manage a lean, nimble team that can respond to opportunities with agility and adapt as the landscape changes. The ED will be accountable for developing high-value partnerships, setting and resourcing workplans to meet strategic objectives, and enhancing the performance of the organization.Responsibilities and TasksShape and drive the mission, vision and strategy for the organization, working with the advisory board to set clear goals and action plans to systematically achieve them.Elevate the work of data.org and its partners and establish the organization as a leading voice and venue for using data science to achieve social impact.Identify partnership and funding opportunities, frame potential projects, develop proposals, plan and close required resourcing and commitments and manage execution to results.Cultivate excellent relationships with the media and other influential platforms.Position data.org as a convener of thought leaders and key stakeholders to build the field of data science for social impact.Build and effectively manage a high-performing team and play an active role in attracting and retaining talent.Develop productive working relationships with a broad network of collaborators, media and other influential platforms.Work with the advisory board to ensure that communications are streamlined, well-organized, and up-to-date regarding progress on data.org priorities and other relevant organizational matters.Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesA minimum of 10 years of professional leadership experience working at the intersection of technology and social change.Familiarity with the current state of data science and artificial intelligence in academia, industry, government and civil society – in the US and internationally.Advanced degree preferred, ideally in a field requiring multi-disciplinary thinking.Partnership and Relationship Building: Experience building productive partnerships and working with senior leaders in industry, civil society and funding institutions. Experience representing an organization’s brand and value proposition to attract and develop partners, interpersonal relationship abilities, intercultural knowledge and appreciation, strategic partnership building. Empathetic to different partners’ cultures and working styles and able to create bridges between the two.Leadership and Communication: Strong interpersonal and communication abilities; exceptional listening, written and verbal skills. Able to translate between different sectors and disciplines. Equally comfortable advising senior levels of management as well as guiding and collaborating across all levels of an institution.Strategic Ability: Ability to see opportunities, design innovative and creative approaches backed by strong analysis and planning. Strong sense for messaging, themes and techniques that can be clearly articulated to partner with and influence others including government, business, and the media.Execution: Strong project management skills, deadline management, decision making, sense of responsibility and accountability, and the ability to effectively multi-task. Ability to manage staff, vendors and contractors to ensure timely, high-quality work product. Can spot and manage risks appropriately.You may be at a large organization looking to make a switch and have global impact or you may be experienced in entrepreneurship looking to bring your talents to a social good mission. We welcome applicants of all experiences and backgrounds to apply.This full-time position will ideally be based in New York, but we will consider flexible arrangements.The data.org team also knows that great candidates can bring skills we have not thought of, and who will not fit everything we have described above. job_description:
BMA, LLC, is an SDVO small business that attracts the most highly motivated and qualified professionals in the Professional Services and Technology industry. We appreciate the importance of high caliber professionals and offer an attractive salary and benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, life and Disability Insurance; 401K, and holidays to ensure the highest quality of life for our employees. A Career with Team BMA offers excellent opportunities for growth with one of America's finest young SDVO small business organizations.
Summary:
BMA is seeking an experienced Human Factors Analyst II to support the U.S. Army Evaluation Center (AEC) Task Order; Support Services for Readiness and Analytics and Training and Professional Development (RAD.) Human Factors Analyst II will provide Support Services for Readiness and Analytics Evaluation: Integrated Product Support (IPS); logistics supportability; Human Systems Integration (HSI); integrated suitability; evaluation sciences; readiness and suitability; reliability, availability, and maintainability (RAM); Design of Experiments (DoE); Modeling and Simulation (M&S); Strategic Initiatives and Methodology; Data Sciences; and Data Visualization and Support Services for the Training and Professional Development; Test and Evaluation (T&E) Basic Course (TEBC), an initial training program for newly assigned Army Test and Evaluation Command (ATEC) workforce members consisting of an online training course followed by an approximate 40-hour resident seminar (RS); AEC Operations Course (AOC), an approximate 40-hour resident seminar that is a follow-on to the TEBC; and Emerging Leaders Cohort (ELC), a professional development venue to expand leadership through interactive and experiential skill sessions, Government speakers, and team and individual projects.

Position Responsibilities:
Independently performs technical and analytical work by selects methods, planning and coordinating details, and completing work through to its conclusion with minimal guidance.
Completed work is reviewed for soundness of analysis, the suitability of methods used, and for conformance with organizational analytical procedures and practices.
Plans, coordinates and conducts reviews, assessments, studies and projects.
Plans, develops, organizes, coordinates, implements and evaluates projects in support of programs for areas engaged in diverse operations and functions and serves as an advisor on all aspects of the assigned program areas.
Compiles new information, considers data from a variety of sources, and follows standard approaches, methods, and procedures to plan and carry out assignments.
Reviews, conducts and evaluates routine sampling, surveys, inventories, data and findings. Monitors operations to identify and rectify problems.
Evaluates adequacy of controls and corrective measures.
For meetings, proposes agenda topics, tracks resulting action items, assists development of presentations, and ensures complete coordination. Reviews and prepares portions of plans, forms, procedures, reports and related documents.
Coordinates issues pertaining to project compliance, schedule, and corrective actions. Assists in developing and conducting various training.
Performs data collection and assists in compilation of technical and programmatic data from a variety of sources.
Conducts analysis, integration, categorization, and summarization of technical and funding data on programs and develops briefings, information papers, and reports that explain and support routine programs, initiatives, solutions and investments.
Evaluates, selects, adapts and modifies standard techniques and criteria.
Ensure test plans will meet the evaluation needs and address measures of evaluation and performance. Ensures adequate incorporation of safety, fire protection, human factors, and design factors affecting occupational health provisions in accordance with existing standards, regulations, laws, and other sound safety engineering principles and practices.

Specialized Experience: (Required)
R&A:
"Five (5) years of experience gained within the past 10 years (2010 to present) in system readiness evaluation in any of the following:
HSI to include training, manpower, personnel, system safety, health hazards, Soldier survivability and human factors engineering.
IPS elements to include Product Support Management, Design Interface, Sustaining Engineering, Supply Support, Support Equipment; Packaging, Handling, Storage and Transportation, Computer Resources, Manpower and Personnel, Maintenance Planning and Management, Training and Training Support, Facilities and Infrastructure, and Technical Data Management;
Doctrine, Organization, Training, Materiel, Leader Development, Personnel, Facilities, and Policy (DOTMLPF-P); and
Experience with Soldier readiness, unit readiness, and Army readiness; unit employment; mission context; mission tasks; tactics, techniques, and procedures; and platform integration."
"Five (5) years of experience gained within the past 10 years (2010 to present) in evaluation sciences in any of the following:
Analytical techniques such as predictive analytics and risk analytics; natural language processing, machine learning, and artificial intelligence; data requirements analysis, data modeling, data cleaning, and database structures; data mining and visualization; conceptual modeling; and statistical analysis techniques.
Demonstrated experience in use and application of one or more of the following programming languages common in data science: Python, ProgR, Java, SQL, and/or No-SQL); and
Demonstrated experience in use and application of one or more of the following math packages common in data science: MATLAB, JMP, and/or SAS."
Qualifications/Experience:
Master's degree in a relevant field and three years field experience in human factors engineering or testing of major military systems.
Shall include experience in Manpower Personnel Training (MPT) and/or the use of human development or testing military systems which would include experience in the use of human factors instrumentation.
Current Secret security clearance is required.
Benefits and Perks
BMA is a service-disabled veteran-owned small business (SDVOSB) company headquartered in Leavenworth KS has been in business since 2008. A Career with our team at BMA offers excellent opportunities for growth with one of America's finest SDVOSB organizations.
Competitive salary
Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurances
Matched 401(k) retirement savings plan
Profit Sharing
Paid time off (PTO) and federal holidays
Tuition reimbursement

job_description:
Udacity's mission is to power careers through tech education. We're an immersive online learning platform offering practitioner level education in fields such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Autonomous Systems, Cloud Computing and more. We are backed by some of the best known investors - Andreessen Horowitz, Charles River Ventures, Bertelsmann and Drive Capital to name a few. Udacity has the potential to transform the world at large scale by providing the life-long learners an opportunity to re-skill or upskill them in future bleeding edge skills and create a meaningful impact in professional and personal lives. We are similarly, helping the enterprises solve the talent shortage issue by being their partner of choice in transforming their workforce while they embark on digital transformation journey. If you are inspired to be part of something amazing... read on!

As a Lead Product Operations Manager, you will operate as right-hand person or "COO" for the Chief Product Officer and the product leadership group.

The ideal candidate combines product intuition, customer insights obsession, operations execution mindset, communication, data analysis skill, scrappiness, collaboration, and an eye for organizational and process efficiency. Candidates who succeed in Product Operations thrive in the product execution and operations side of the product team activities, as well as customer insights and communication. Ideal candidates work effectively with everyone from engineers and designers to marketers and legal to make things happen smoothly with quick, effective decision making.


You will lead, design, and operate critical cross-functional product projects. These include new go-to-market launches, product experiments, voice of the customer and research insights programs for product decision making, and operations for various product areas. You will get exposure to most parts of Udacity's business, including different channels (Consumer, Enterprise, etc.) and products (Learning Experience, Content Creation, Marketing Products, etc.). Imagine regularly coordinating cross-functional launches and projects involving dozens to 100s of Udacity employees, including engineers, marketers, product managers, ops team members, content team members, and more.


As Lead Product Operations Manager, you will work with autonomy, making the right last mile decisions based on customer empathy, data, research, business needs, and product design intuition.
This role is an experienced lead or senior-level position reporting to the Senior Director of Product Management and you will be working directly with the CPO regularly. You will have a significant influence on product operations, executing product strategy, and product decision making through research and data. You will have the opportunity to have a large scope of impact and ownership.

You will be expected to drive User Research and Voice of the Customer projects, pull insights about our students and customers for decision making or investigations, make last-mile design and policy decisions, execute with a/b testing, and work across product/marketing/operations teams to get products out the door smoothly. You will QA new launches and develop trusted relationships across product, engineering and design teams to get things done.

Responsibilities
Product launch execution & coordination - Oversee major cross-company product launches and help make last-mile product and policy decisions. Develop system to ensuring smooth, consistent launches, quick data and empathy-driven decision making, and cross-functional team execution.
Product experiment execution - Run the product experimentation process, managing experiment schedules, determining audience segments, collaborating with product, ops, marketing, sales, and data teams.
Voice of the student and customer - Be a primary centralized voice of all students and customers, including students, enterprise learners and managers, and more.
Insights & data-driven decisions - Turn data into insights and analyze information from multiple data sources determine what is most impactful and help the product team do the same
Multi-channel data sourcing - Gather data from multiple sources and synthesize it for the product organization, collaborating with data analytics, ops, marketing, and sales teams. This includes usage data, pain points from support tickets, sales & support team insights, competitor behavior, and more. You should have a process for organizing and structuring the data to surface it in the right way to help decision making.
Student & Customer Research - Collect and deliver insights & recommendations from customer feedback in all its forms, then organize processes and tools for product teams to continually make informed decisions.
Training & enablement - Train & prepare marketing, support, success, and sales teams for new product features and launches across consumer, enterprise, and other channels.
Product tools - Manage the product team's tech stack, including product planning, tracking, analytics, user management, and experimentation tools. Manage vendor relationships, help determine the best tools and processes, and train/administer the tools with the product teams.
Launch analysis & Product reporting/monitoring - Help the product team make better decisions with data. Partner with product managers to set up data measurement and reporting for product releases and existing product usage, and then collaborate with Data Analytics teams to make sure that data is validated and fed into the right places.
Data analysis - Partnering with Product Analysts and Data Scientists, conduct hands-on data investigations and analysis, using SQL, excel, and other analytics tools.
Be a product story-teller - Understand the product strategy, priorities and roadmap. Help train & galvanize teams and stakeholders around the vision for the products being built
What we value
7+ years of experience as a product operations manager or equivalent operations or program management role, ideally for end-user, consumer, and enterprise products.
2+ years of experience in product management, ideally for end-user and consumer facing products.
Experience with data analysis, with a good grasp of SQL. You have ideally investigated data both yourself and in collaboration with analysts and data scientists.
Experience executing go-to-market product launches, coordinating cross-functional teams.
Experience working directly with engineering and design teams to work out last-mile product details and decisions during launches. You have ideally been able to talk through technical tradeoffs around launches, including timelines and implementation tradeoffs.
Proven ability to identify, analyze, and solve ambiguous problems with extreme attention to detail on tight deadlines. You understand the 80/20 principle.
Demonstrated ability to successfully influence stakeholders.
Thrives in a high-energy, fast-paced environment where tactical and strategic initiatives are driven in parallel.
Experience deriving and presenting insights to business leaders.
Pluses
Experience executing Voice of the Customer, User Research and Insights, or similar programs. Ideally you have aggregated insights or even talked to customers directly and written surveys.
Preferred experience operating multi-stakeholder and multi-channel products (i.e. products where there are multiple internal and external sources of feedback and needs to balance).
Bonus for knowledge of scripting (e.g. Python) and/or advanced Google suite functions to improve product process efficiency and workflow automation.
Preferred experience having used e-learning or other continuous learning products.

Udacity is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We believe that the unique contributions of all Udacians is the driver of our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Udacity's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy

job_description:
Primary Objective of Position: Responsible for the sales performance and profitability of Smart Manufacturing portfolio of Industrial Network and Automation Software Products and Services.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.

Develop and execute the Smart Manufacturing Products and Services Business Plan

The plan will contain the following essentials:

Promotion and Sales:
Rockwell Automation software products
Rockwell and Cisco Ethernet Enabled products
Continued development and promotion of Industrial Network Services portfolio including, Schaedler Yesco and Rockwell Automation Network services
Focus on current and future technologies such as:
Artificial intelligence
Augmented Reality
Industrial internet of Things (IioT)
Industrial Cyber security
Collaboration with Schaedler Yesco Datacom team for sales of network infrastructure devices and solutions
Collaborate with the SYD Sales to promote and sell Smart Manufacturing products and services
Utilization of Outcome Based Selling skills
Heavy collaboration with the Marketing Team on strategies for product promotion
Understand and support the SYD Sales and Management philosophies
Participate in development and implementation of account strategy for assigned products.
Perform customer sales calls with SYD outside sales, vendors and solo.
Active participation in the monthly Disciplined Sales Process (DSP) sessions.
Provide pre- and post-sales support to our customers as required. Includes product selection, quoting, issue resolution, technical support, etc.
Maintain technical expertise by participating in continual learning and industry specific technical training

SYD Sales and GP$ for the Smart Manufacturing Product categories
Opportunity Management System within the CRM System
Monthly Specialists Dashboards
RA Commercial Business Plan
RA Anaplan Tool update and performance to target accounts
Sales call entry for the team (5/week)

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills via phone, email and in person are required
Self-motivated to effectively analyze workload and manage multiple priorities with defined deadlines
Familiarity with digital marketing and social media methodologies

job_description:
Job Description
Do you like working with HIGH PERFORMING teams? Are you self-motivated and enjoy a challenge? We invite you Invent Your Future with CACI International!
CACI’s Business and Information Technology Solutions (BITS) Sector, is seeking a Lead Solutions Architect interested in forming and leading a team of Solutions Architects in support of DIA’s TALOS mission. TALOS is a DIA initiative to advance the state of the art in Big Data, data analysis, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and advanced analytics to enhance the DoD’s and the IC’s information processes and technical architectures.
What You’ll Get to Do:
The Solutions Architect team will serve as the liaisons between TALOS Mission Pillar Stakeholder Communities and the Product Portfolio teams to ensure the mission is integrated into each step of the development process. You’ll be able to build and lead this team based on your vision in support of DIA, the IC, and the COCOMs.
Collaborate with developers, operations integrators, users and the customer to understand mission needs, build a responsive vision, identify innovative solutions and define and develop requirements.
Demonstrate existing capabilities and prototypes to potential customers
Support the program’s business development needs through white papers, ROMs and proposals that address customer needs.
Engage with product development teams during design, creation, and test phases to ensure that new capabilities satisfy end-user needs.
Identify technical and bureaucratic roadblocks early and eliminate them before encountered by the technical staff.
Monitor and report status on budget, schedule and scope.
Create contract deliverables such as briefings and reports that effectively communicate accomplishments and lessons learned to stakeholders.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Primary POC to address customer and development questions, concerns, and requirements
Create mission engineering stories for release planning, every 3 months
Prioritize backlog
Monitor development progress through sprint planning, sprint reviews, scrums, and engagement with individual developers
Attend monthly program management reviews to provide project status, discuss issues and demonstrate achievements
Collaborate with others to develop customer requests for white papers, ROMs and proposals
Maintain awareness of IC initiatives to support vision-casting and strengthening of the program’s competitive position
You’ll Bring These Qualifications:
Must have an Active DoD TS/SCI security clearance.
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science, or related technical discipline with:
10+ years of relevant professional experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Understanding of software and systems engineering principles
Familiarity with Agile Development Methodologies
A bias toward action on behalf of user needs
Value for honesty and transparency with team members and customers
Nice to Have Qualifications:
Small to medium project management experience
Familiarity with a variety of OSINT and PAI data types, data fusion, and analytic methodologies
Familiarity with REST services, cloud computing (esp. Amazon Web Services), and database storage technologies
Familiarity with Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI)
What We Can Offer You:
BITS, a CACI Company, offers very rewarding and unique benefits, which equates to 50% of compensation on TOP of your base salary! The first part is a tax-qualified profit-sharing retirement plan, to which BITS annually contributes up to 25% of your base salary (not in excess of applicable IRS limits) to your retirement account. The second component consists of BITS' Individual Benefit Account (IBA), which is used for premiums, medical reimbursements, dependent care, education and Paid Time Off (PTO) policy. Both components of the BITS benefit package are paid for by BITS, in addition to your base salary and potential performance bonuses. We believe in a healthy home/work balance and both of our locations offer a wide variety of activities to balance with your work life. Learn more at BITS
We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post and the Denver Post.
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.
For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success
TALOS
Job Location
US-Reston-VA-VIRGINIA SUBURBAN


CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

job_description:
Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.
We're looking for a Product Manager to join Snap Inc! We're looking for someone who has a ML-focused background that can leverage and apply machine learning technology to shape the future of our paid products. Working from our Santa Monica headquarters, you’ll partner closely with Engineering in building out scalable ranking systems and models to improve ads personalization and advertiser performance. You’ll become the internal voice of our revenue-generating products by focusing on synthesizing external research, internal analytics, and cross-functional team feedback into a long-term product vision and near-term execution plan.
What you'll do:
Develop and launch machine learning centric products and services that help our broader business, while being conscientious and cautious of impacts on core user experience
Define the business goals and own the results for your product area
Manage a long-term roadmap for internal tools, data and analytics, and revenue-related products and improvements
Solicit ideas and feedback, gather requirements, write specs, create wireframes and workflows, and coordinate cross-functionally
Drive strategic product decisions via evaluation of market trends and meticulous retrospective and prospective analysis of product and revenue performance
Become the internal voice and representative for revenue-related products
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Exceptional analytical skills
Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS from a leading undergraduate institution in CS/EE/General Engineering or Economics/Physics/Psychology/Math
3+ years of product management or product marketing experience at a consumer or enterprise technology company
Deep knowledge of machine learning/artificial intelligence/computer vision
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building and applying ML technologies to large scale problems
Experience with product design, software development, or interaction design
Experience with brands and agencies in the digital advertising space
Familiarity with SQL, Python, ProgR, Minitab, or SPSS
At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. EOE, including disability/vets. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com .

job_description:
Senior Technical Account Manager
Location: Salt Lake City or Remote
Major Functions:

Work largely during the customers' core business hours, with occasional extended hours as needed
Occasional on-call after-hours work may be required as needed by the customer
As their account management professional, be the assigned accounts' single point of contact to our company, and engage resources across several teams as needed to resolve their issues and requests
Multi-year track record of excellence in customer satisfaction and loyalty, resolving technically and emotionally challenging and high-stakes issues, and navigating enterprise-level challenges through to successful outcomes
Professional judgment and business savvy are respected by co-workers, customers and partners
Exemplify an effective and productive relationship with assigned accounts, hold regular discussions to review open issues, understand their contact center and business, ensure that inContact's solutions meet their needs, share best practices, consistently increase their success, and become their trusted partner and advisor
Excellent triage and advanced troubleshooting skills, teaching peers those same skills to improve their success
Personally resolve as many customer issues as possible, both for your accounts and others, while scheduling time for proactive activities
Partnering with other inContact employees and teams (technical support, professional services, product management, engineering, etc.), ensure that all technical challenges and other issues/cases/requests are being handled properly, are within SLA targets, and are progressing toward resolution. This includes assisting with issues for other TAMs
Demonstrate superior in depth knowledge of inContact products and associated technologies, especially those employed by assigned accounts E
Exemplify subject matter expertise in two or more technical areas
Exemplify expertise and maintain currency in telecommunications, contact center, and related technologies
Utilize a deep understanding of each customer's environment to identify customer needs and implement solutions that will accelerate their success
Exemplify deep knowledge of competitive product lines, differentiators and industry trends through self-education and inContact's resources, and teach others
Develop and present compelling customized presentations to assigned accounts that both quantify and qualify product/service usage, realized benefits, achievements, opportunities and next steps
Provide training to accounts to ensure that they get the most out of their inContact investment
Capture common questions, techniques and best practices in daily workflow, sharing that information by regularly creating and improving knowledgebase content
Contribute high-value knowledgebase content that enables the success of employees across inContact, partners, and enterprise-level customers operating in complex and large contact center environments
Provide coaching to peers and exemplify consistent and high-value participation in knowledge creation and improvement
Contributes to product strategy and direction by participating with the Product and Practice Specialist team to communicate enhancements and issues to Product Management and Engineering
Ensure that all communication, interactions, assignments, details and actions are clear, effective, timely (within established SLA), and are logged into the CRM system
Appropriately contribute to and take charge of meetings, calls and other discussions to convey ownership, organization, progress and direction. This may be required for accounts other than those assigned to you
Exemplify consistently and regularly updating customer and account information, keeping it current in the CRM system
Tactfully, confidently and professionally communicate with all stakeholders, especially in emotionally-charged and escalated situations, bringing people together with the common goal of resolving issues and accelerating the customer's success
Communicate and work with customers in a way that they do not escalate and are confident that their issues and concerns are being properly represented and handled by inContact
Assist the team by taking ownership of escalations from other accounts in your area of expertise, exemplifying the effective handling of difficult situations
Exemplify escalation prevention, resource engagement and communication when escalation occurs
Provide assistance and leadership in resolving complex issues across teams and throughout the company
Develop and drive business cases that outline problems, impacts, proposed solutions and outcomes that help inContact improve our performance and success
Make and meet all commitments, building trust with customers and help others to do the same
Present a professional image in communication, conduct, attitude and attire
Exemplify professionalism and leadership with customers, and helps peers to develop the same level of expertise
Accountable for all actions, and tactfully reinforce accountability across all employees and teams in the company for delivering against Operating Level Agreements (OLA) and Service Level Agreements (SLA). Professionally and tactfully teaches proper process and methods that ensure customer service excellence
Lead assigned customers in preparation for go-live, and build confidence with them as they begin using our products in a live environment

Employ an assertive yet positive attitude in working with others to create standardized and consistent processes and to improve process issues that cause inefficiency, risk, missed targets, and frustration
Add value to the company by finding, recommending and leading important projects, tasks and initiatives that improve process, methods, tactics and success within the team and across inContact, with little management intervention.
Participation in these activities does not detract from the service, value, and outcomes provided to assigned accounts
Mentor TAMs at all levels and other peers as appropriate toward increased success
Provide high-value technical and process training to others based on skills and expertise, which training improves others' effectiveness and efficiency
Fill advanced technical and process training needs, and provide that training to others without prompting or requirement from leadership. The training improves others' effectiveness and efficiency
Expert at turning failing or struggling accounts into successful accounts, and helping others in the team do the same
Manage and document certain inContact technical projects with each assigned account to ensure that they are successful
Can act as a backup for managers or other Senior TAMs as needed
Occasional travel (up to 25%) required, visiting customer sites and attending company meetings
Perform other tasks and duties as assigned or needed
Follow the company Code of Ethics and inContact policies and procedures at all times.

job_title_2: Senior Director, Portfolio Management Data Science
정리된 job_title: Senior Director, Portfolio Management Data Science
job_description:
Janssen Research & Development LLC, a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Senior Director, Portfolio Management Data Science. You will report to the Chief Operating Office of Data Science, Global Head of JRD Strategy and Operations. The primary location for this position is either New Brunswick, NJ or Spring House, PA. Consideration will be given to Boston, MA, Raritan, NJ and Titusville, NJ.

Who We Are:
Janssen develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and Development areas encompass Oncology, Cardiovascular and Metabolic disorders, Immunology, Neuroscience, and Infectious diseases. Our ultimate goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.com.


You will:

Partner with the COO, Data Science (DS) and the relevant TA/Function to define and prioritize a portfolio of high impact use cases in alignment with TA/Function strategy and JRD Data Science strategy
Champion, build and drive large strategic and complex DS projects to achieve the intended impact in a timely manner
Lead in a highly matrixed environment with cross-functional teams of TA/functional representatives, Data Scientists, Software engineers, external partners (when needed), etc. while also providing executive visibility to the COO of DS and TA/function leads
Collaborate with the DS analytics and Data Platform team to execute on the priorities, pragmatically build a roadmap to deliver the user cases, from test and learn to scale up deployment
Build and cultivate right partnerships and alliances with internal and external partners in collaboration with Business Development, Innovation Centers, etc.
Develop a deep understanding and appreciation of the partners, understand and align the problems and the value of use case with key partners

Qualifications
Required:

MD, Ph.D. degree, Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Mathematics, Computational Chemistry, Chemistry, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Biology or a related discipline.
8+ years of experience in the Data Science and /or Digital Health space in a company ranging from start-ups to consulting firms with established Data Science practices or large Fortune 500 companies.
Experience in product management and leadership experience to design and execute on high impact data science projects / platforms
Proven project leadership in complicated context, able to influence and engage the strategic and technical partners
Proven track record of partnership and leading in a matrix organization
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and written skills.
Preferred:

Familiarity with drug discovery and clinical development processes.
Experience delivering on data science projects using predictive technologies, data mining and/or text mining.
Managing of healthcare relevant datasets, such as EHR, insurance claims or registry data.
Experience with visualization software/tools such as ProgR, Spotfire, Tableau, etc.
Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.

job_description:
Eiden Systems Corporation is looking for a TS/SCI cleared Intelligence Analyst Program Lead in Charlottesville VA. The Program Lead will provide day-to-day management of the processes, requirements and deliverables responses, team performance and hours, and overall product quality control. The Program Lead will bring a strong background in intelligence analysis, interagency efforts and information technology.

Job Responsibilities:
Possess strong experience and skills with intelligence analysis writing, with an understanding of producing products that are ICD 203/206 compliant.
Will work with the AI/ML platform to deliver quality data and analysis necessary for supporting the Army and its counter-proliferation/ tech-protect mission.
Exhibit knowledge of AI/ML platforms and capabilities and a willingness to learn the AI/ML prototype developed at NASIC and NGIC; this may require some travel to Bozeman, Montana, for additional advanced training.
Will serve as the lead for developing the AI/ML platform at NASIC in Wright Patterson, Ohio, and NGIC in Charlottesville, VA.
Will require some travel to NASIC and regular meetings between NASIC and NGIC using secure video teleconferencing and secure communications.
Require periodic presentations and updates to NASIC and NGIC government personnel.
Experiences conducting analysis or investigations of foreign threats to supply chains and knowledge of foreign tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs).
This position will also benefit from a senior expert with a deep professional network and ability to discover new data or potential partners within the USG, industry, and academic sectors.
Requires requirements management and solutions development using regular communications and planning with NASIC and NGIC government customers and with contractor partners and engineers.
Provide oversight of all personnel performance, work schedules, and administrative requirements for the contract.
Experience managing personnel administrative requirements a plus.

Requirements:

10+ years of Senior Intel Analyst experience
5+ years of Supply Chain Risk Management
At least 1 year experience in Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Technology
5+ years of Interagency experience
2+ management experience
Writing experience
TS/SCI clearance

Not required but is a plus to possess CompTIA Security+ or equivalent

job_description:
TransCore (TRN), a subsidiary of Roper Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: ROP) is seeking an Information Security Manager to join our team in our Nashville, TN office.
Summary: The Information Technology / Cyber Solutions Architect performs a leadership role performing solution development in support of all IT/Cyber related business growth activity including cloud migration, data analytics, artificial intelligence, technology insertion, defensive and offensive cyber security activity and other related IT/Cyber Domain centric support. Candidate will envision and sell innovative and compelling strategic-focused solutions for internal and external stakeholders in the IT/Cyber Domains. Candidate may collaborate with technical staff on programs to identify and assess capabilities and performance in support of business growth and operational excellence.
Responsibilities include:
Defining the solution and technical approach as the lead architect for new IT/Cyber related business initiatives.
Solution scope may include engineering, IT, and cyber security applications and programs. The Solution Architect will lead the development of integrated solutions that may span scope areas.
IT/Cyber solutions may include full life cycle activities, encompassing requirements, design and development, T&E and operational support.
Solution architects work with the corporate management team and other internal and external stakeholders to define key requirements/challenges and needs related to IT/Cyber growth initiatives.
Identify solution alternatives, select and market competitive solutions with a view to winning new business and growing IT/Cyber contract portfolio.
Leads all solutioning sessions and creates proposal written and graphical content to incorporate into compelling and winning proposals.
Estimates all costs for labor, material, and other expenses required for proposed solutions.
Leads the development of the overall solution, including solutioning sessions with internal and external teammates, proposal and technical subject matter experts.
Supports identification of partners and teammates to support IT/Cyber efforts. Presents technical solutions both at internal gate reviews and solutioning workshops and in oral presentations to customers, if required.
Organizes and leads the technical work required to create compelling solutions, including identifying, acquiring, leading, motivating the technical team and assigned section writers.
Interface with BD and executive management to develop and grow their portfolio of solutions and offerings and to increase company productivity and profits.
Provides leadership and strategic guidance during the solution development process to ensure bridging the gap between our client challenges and the benefits available from IT/Cyber solutions and services.
Interfaces with Program Managers to ensure that corporate experience, best practices, product and capabilities are leveraged correctly.
Researches existing business and technical environment including technology trends, best practices, partnerships, and capabilities to ensure proposed solutions match business trends.
Interfaces and participates in business development and strategic growth discussions across the Business Units and BD team teams and internal and external executive managements to ensure consistency in solution development and implementation.
Internal IT Cyber Over-site Role:
Directs the design, planning, implementation, and maintenance of the IT infrastructure that supports the company's operations and business applications. Also, maintains oversight of IT projects, ensuring that commitments are properly planned, staffed, monitored and reported.
Establish metrics for managing IT effectiveness and for measuring the impact of IT on the business.
Prepare and monitor IT company’s operational budget.
Establish and enforce IT policies, processes, standards and methodologies and maintain compliance with policies and procedures where applicable.
Review, recommend, and oversee all vendors and managed service agreements for computing, telecommunications, IT services, applications and equipment.
Required Experience:
Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Cyber Security with a minimum of 10-years’ experience in the development of solution delivery for IT/Cyber projects.
A Masters in an IT/CYBER field desired.
Minimum of 4 years capture and proposal development experience in a technical leadership role centered around IT/Cyber bids.
Experience and knowledge of US State and Federal Government environments, regulations, standards, and processes as well as PCI standards.
Strong creative thinking, problem solving, planning, time-management and organization skills to balance and prioritize work. Able to perform tasks within strict timelines with little or no oversight
Strong human relations skills to build teams and develop collaborative solutions with management, business development, and technical staff.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Strong and proven team leader.
Ability to develop detailed cost estimates and models for large-scale and complex solutions, integrating engineering. scientific, and IT/Cyber services and solutions for development and mission operations.
Comfortable working with ambiguity.
Strong skills at identifying, assessing, and managing risks related to business opportunities and solutions.
Ability to create and maintain formal and informal networks with fellow employees, partners, industry, customers, and technical communities.
CompTIA Security+ or CISSP
Desired Skills:
Proposal and Capture knowledge
Technical Leadership
Team building and communication
Relevant IT/Cyber or other technical certifications
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

job_description:
Overview:
Peraton is looking for a part-time academic researcher with innovative thinking on Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) for the modeling of human behavior and reward functions for the purpose of infusing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in human centric design of assistive robots in order to endow them with learning and online behavioral adaptation capabilities. Expertise in creating rational strategies for irrational human behavior to anticipate and respond to irrational human actions. Additional research may include the use of emerging theories of the mind as they apply to the design of AI systems that account for the management of data which overwhelm the humans and to provide guidance to the AI’s learning mechanisms. Research on planning for non-positive eventualities of cyber physical AI systems, such as weapons, which will become a part of the human ecosystem.
Responsibilities:
What you’ll do…
Conduct research on HMI for socially adept robotic systems.
Model human behavior and reward functions for human centric design of AI systems.
Create rational strategies for modeling and anticipation of irrational human behaviors.
Apply emerging theories of the mind to the design of AI systems to account for overwhelming data.
Document and disseminate these research ideas in academic publications and journal articles.
Evangelize research ideas in public fora such as Ted Talks and other discussions.
Qualifications:
You’d be a great fit if…
You have a Master’s degree or higher (with a minimum of 8 years experience) in the fields of education, human machine interfaces or social robotics.
You are an innovative thinking in modeling of human behavior is expected.
Have excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated competence on dissemination of ideas to a wide audience.
You’d be an even better fit if…
You have high academic achievement.
SECURITY CLEARANCE

This position requires the candidate be able to obtain and maintain a secret level security clearance. In order to obtain a clearance you must be a US Citizen.
About Peraton:
At Peraton, we’re at the forefront of delivering the next breakthrough in national security, every day. We’re the partner of choice to help solve some of the world’s most daunting challenges. How? By thinking differently. We’re not mired in the past. We look at all problems with fresh eyes. We look past the obvious to bring the best talent, tech, and ideas together to completely transform how problems are solved. So bring your unique ideas, your entrepreneurial spirit, and your drive to succeed. Get ready to be part of something bigger. Get ready to do the can’t be done.
EEO Statement:
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

job_title_2: Director, Real World Evidence, Analytics & Innovation
job_description:
Overview:
Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an international biopharmaceutical company focused on improving patients’ lives by identifying, developing and commercializing meaningful products that address unmet medical needs. We are continuing to expand our commercial product portfolio and our research and development pipeline in therapeutic areas that can leverage our unique expertise.

Our therapeutic areas of focus include sleep and hematology/oncology – areas in which we have a deep understanding of the patient journey and a suite of products and product candidates to address critical needs.

We are looking for the best and brightest talent to join our team. If you’re looking to be a part of a company with an unwavering commitment to improving patients’ lives and being a great place to work, we hope you’ll explore our career openings and get to know Jazz Pharmaceuticals.
Position Profile:
The Director will collaborate with a diverse set of scientists inside and outside the Global Value – HEOR (GV-HEOR) group to conduct research of Real World Data (RWD) using advanced analytics, including Machine Learning, to facilitate the execution of value demonstration activities. The Director will provide input on selection of fit-for-purpose RWD and analytical platforms for various initiatives, efficiently execute analytics and predictive modeling that meet CARSE standards, and facilitate external research that leverage innovative analytics such as interactive visualization. The Director will help develop internal collaborations on RWD assets, analytics, and technology across the organization. Responsibilities extend to methodological expertise to improve the design, conduct, analysis, interpretation of studies, and may involve external publications and presentations. The Director will report to a Global Value Lead.
Essential Functions
Facilitate initiatives with external partners that leverage innovative technology such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, and interactive visualization.
Provide expert analytical support to GV-HEOR personnel in the design, analysis, reporting, and interpretation of HEOR projects involving RWD to meet CARSE standards and contribute to publications and external presentations.
Partner with GV-HEOR personnel, biostatisticians, clinicians, programmers, market research, and other Jazz personnel to optimize utilization of RWD.
Participate in GV-HEOR regular meetings and engage in proactive communications with project leads to better understand scientific and business needs.
Provide computational and statistical advice on complex analytic issues supporting HEOR projects conducted by external vendors.
Develop, implement, and promote methodologies based on state-of-the-science computing and statistical research and dissemination of the results both internally and externally.
Develop effective collaborations with GV-HEOR personnel.
Stay current with research on HEOR methodology and its applications pertinent to the GV-HEOR needs.
Be up-to-date on training and compliance with all SOPs as required based on the assigned curriculum.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
At least 5 years of post-graduation experience with health economics, health technology assessment, and outcomes research methodology used in RWE. Candidates with less work experience, or experience in other fields, will also be considered if they have exceptional relevant methodology research credentials.
Deep understanding of Machine Learning technology, hands-on experience preferred (e.g., Lupi, Random Forest, Reinforcement Learning, NLP)
Hands on experience performing complex RWD analysis in a cloud environment.
Hands on experience analyzing EMR and Claims Big Data (e.g., MarketScan, Explorys)
Intimate familiarity with Oncology/Hematology commercial and governmental claims and EMR big and small data.
Experience with analytical platforms (e.g. Aetion)
Required/Preferred Education and Licenses
Ph.D. in HEOR related discipline, required.
Description of Physical Demands
Occasional mobility within office environment.
Routinely sitting for extended periods of time.
Constantly operating a computer, printer, telephone and other similar office machinery.
Description of Work Environment
Work indoors in normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, fumes, vibrations and temperature changes.
Frequent computer use at workstation.
May move from one work location to another occasionally.
Responsibilities may require a work schedule that may include working outside of “normal” work hours, in order to meet business demands.
Occasional public contact requiring appropriate business apparel.
Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Mastercard’s Commercial Product team develops and delivers world-class solutions for small, middle and large sized enterprises around the world. As a part of this business, the Global Business to Business (B2B) Product team develops solutions and services to increase the efficiency, safety, security and electronification of business payments. Mastercard has developed the Track Business Payment Service. It is the first global open loop commercial solution built to simplify and automate the exchange of payments-related data between the world’s buyers and suppliers. It leverages common standards, richer data exchanges and multiple payment types to optimize the value, efficiency and control of B2B payments. The B2B payment opportunity is estimated at $125T annually.

The Manager of Commercial Data Strategy & Analytics will lead the group’s efforts to create scalable processes to maximize customer uptake of the Track BPS solution with buyers, supplier and their agents.

Role:

Works in collaboration with the Director of B2B Product Management to advance Commercial Data Strategy and Analytics goals
Partners across all B2B data products to ensure data assets and strategy are coordinated
Supports the Regional Market Managers and Agent Solutions team by equipping them with the tools to target priority agents and corporates pre- and post-implementation
Partners with Data & Services, Operations & Technology and Artificial Intelligence teams as necessary to create algorithms to identify trends with buyer, supplier and their agents

You will:

Create decision-making tools and analytics to drive Track BPS virality and network effects
Create the strategy and execute on a unified vision for Commercial data
Act as the gatekeeper and custodian of internal and client-provided Commercial data
Design, deliver and manage the data ingestion, matching and analytics processes for Track BPS agents across the pre-sales, enrollment and onboarding lifecycle
Optimize corporate match algorithms, interaction rates and success rates across the Track BPS portfolio

All About You:


3-5 years of experience in performing data analysis and developing business centric data strategies
A self-starter with the intellectual curiosity to develop an optimized data strategy and management approach of information assets to maximize business outcomes
The ability to leverage data analytics to maximize data match algorithms across disparate data sets
Experience in leveraging SQL, Hadoop and data analytics Business Intelligence (BI) tools such Tableau, Power BI
Ability to decompose business and technical process flows; develop optimized solutions and articulate business requirements to technical teams for implementation
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with an ability to create and present objective analysis
Undergraduate degree required in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Science, Applied Mathematics or related field
MBA or relevant post graduate degree recommended
Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

job_title_2: Product Manager, Digital & Social Channel Engagement
정리된 job_title: Product Manager - Digital & Social Channel Engagement
job_description:
Looking for an experienced Product Manager with building social messaging solutions! This isn't a marketing type of role. You must have experience with social channels as a product manager - building features for product social channel. If this is you, apply today!

As a Product Manager, you will bring your leadership, business acumen, and technical skills to the Genesys Cloud team. You will play a critical role in the definition, development and delivery of Genesys Cloud solutions. In this role, you will usher features through all phases of product development with primary responsibilities on feature requirements definition, project planning, managing schedules, facilitating conflict resolution, identifying and communicating risk, building and managing a product roadmap and coordinating tasks involving dependencies within cross-functional teams. You will add value by ensuring that the features delivered meet quality standards, solve stated business problems and are completed in a timely manner within scope project deliverables.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate and define components of Genesys Cloud solutions, from both functional and business perspective, with a key focus in Social Media Channels:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) Powered Digital Interactions
Customer Journey with Digital Interactions
Omni-Channel Interactions
Chatbot and human agent orchestration
Seamless Channel switching
Conversation threading
Social Media Channels – public and private channel support
Build and manage a product roadmap
Work with customers, vendors and product management team to define product features
Define and execute on requirements with supporting organizations, including product management, sales, development, support, IT operations, finance and legal
Provide visibility to feature status and escalates issues to senior management
Plan and track release milestones for feature releases
Work closely with Product, Development, and Quality Assurance management to ensure successful feature delivery
Identify needs, create, and deliver sales enablement training material
Create and deliver clear and concise customer facing documentation outlining delivered solutions
Remove obstacles blocking or slowing down the teams
Manage multiple projects at one time
Develop and improve processes, communicate plans and achievements, and facilitate project meetings

Minimum Requirements:

BA/BS required
Experience in Cloud solutions, with strong background in product management and cloud operations
4+ years of experience working in a Product Manager capacity working on enterprise software life cycle development
Experience working with Social Media Channels and Social Media vendors
Strong bonus if you bring validated experience using or product managing a Social Media monitoring, Social Media engagement or Social customer care cloud platform
Fluency reading and understanding API and developer documentation
Experience delivering Customer Experience or Customer Engagement solutions
Ability to prioritize issues effectively and meet tight deadlines when required
Ability to lead a high performing, cross-functional team
Ability to manage the work and quality of other cross-functional team members
Ability to resolve conflict within a project team
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong Project management skills
Ability to actively listen and learn
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and be detail oriented
Ability to work in a team environment
Ability to take initiative and be proactive
Ability to work independently and be resourceful
Ability to manage multiple projects and coordinate with other Product Managers
Critical thinker with excellent communication skills, written and verbal

About Genesys
Every year, Genesys® delivers more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in over 100 countries. Through the power of the cloud and AI, our technology connects every customer moment across marketing, sales and service on any channel, while also improving employee experiences. Genesys pioneered Experience as a Service℠ so organizations of any size can provide true personalization at scale, interact with empathy, and foster customer trust and loyalty. This is enabled by Genesys Cloud™, an all-in-one solution and the world’s leading public cloud contact center platform, designed for rapid innovation, scalability and flexibility. Visit www.genesys.com.
Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. #LI-TL1

job_description:
Peraton is looking for a part-time academic researcher with innovative thinking on Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) for the modeling of human behavior and reward functions for the purpose of infusing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in human centric design of assistive robots in order to endow them with learning and online behavioral adaptation capabilities. Expertise in creating rational strategies for irrational human behavior to anticipate and respond to irrational human actions. Additional research may include the use of emerging theories of the mind as they apply to the design of AI systems that account for the management of data which overwhelm the humans and to provide guidance to the AI’s learning mechanisms. Research on planning for non-positive eventualities of cyber physical AI systems, such as weapons, which will become a part of the human ecosystem.
What you’ll do…

Conduct research on HMI for socially adept robotic systems.

Model human behavior and reward functions for human centric design of AI systems.

Create rational strategies for modeling and anticipation of irrational human behaviors.

Apply emerging theories of the mind to the design of AI systems to account for overwhelming data.

Document and disseminate these research ideas in academic publications and journal articles.

Evangelize research ideas in public fora such as Ted Talks and other discussions.
You’d be a great fit if…

You have a Master’s degree or higher (with a minimum of 8 years experience) in the fields of education, human machine interfaces or social robotics.

You are an innovative thinking in modeling of human behavior is expected.

Have excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated competence on dissemination of ideas to a wide audience.
You’d be an even better fit if…
You have high academic achievement.
SECURITY CLEARANCE
This position requires the candidate be able to obtain and maintain a secret level security clearance. In order to obtain a clearance you must be a US Citizen.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.
job_description_requirements: Expertise in creating rational strategies for irrational human behavior to anticipate and respond to irrational human actions.  Masters degree or higher (with a minimum of 8 years experience) in the fields of education, human machine interfaces or social robotics

job_description:
Job Title: Principal Storage Solutions Architect
About our group:
Seagate has one simple mission: to help the world save more of its precious data. Multiple studies have shown that machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data analytics are all improved with larger data sets. These methods are what is needed for the world to solve its important challenges from developing vaccines to combating climate change to improving autonomy in driving that saves lives. Unfortunately, however, the IDC projects that 158 of the 175 predicted zettabytes of data produced in 2025 will not be saved. By lowering the cost of storage, Seagate aims to rescue as much of this at-risk 158 zettabytes as possible to provide larger data sets and correspondingly improved learning, autonomy, and analytics. To achieve this goal, Seagate is developing reference architectures of low cost, scale out object storage to reduce data center costs and enable the Edge/IT 4.0. Our group is dedicated to this goal.
About the role – you will:
As Principal storage solutions architect, your role will be central to important corporate strategy as you will also be the Design Engineering Lead who will be responsible for defining and executing the product design and technical strategy, and resolving technical and process issues. With a cross functional team representing Engineering, Materials, Software, Quality Assurance and Manufacturing, this impactful role ensures that goals are met for time-to-market, time-to-volume, quality, reliability, development expense and product cost. Your responsibility will include the following:
Define rack scale out storage solution architecture in collaboration with other architects.
Architect best in class networking solution for scale out storage products across the distributed enterprise environment.
Drive the Engineering team's decision-making process around critical priorities. Communicates decisions to site management and the functional organizations.
Make tradeoff recommendations and decisions for the program between technical, customer and business needs based on functional team and core team inputs.
Coordinate delivery of product against customer requirements including risk assessments and go/no go delivery recommendations.
Align product technical targets with customer needs and internal technology development plans.
Provide key factory integration support.
Customer interactions required for new product design reviews, quality issues and yields.
Scrum and/or SAFe certified product owner is a plus.
Sets and achieves performance goals. Sets schedules and ensures adherence. Creates a sense of purpose with clear direction and motivates his team and others to overcome obstacles.
Establishes technical strategies across broad areas and functions.
Facilitates discussion with other functional groups. Presents to senior site management. Fosters cross-functional relationships and initiates efforts to overcome significant barriers.
Understands functional deliverables and dependencies. Identifies barriers and works to resolve them with multiple team participation. Builds consensus on difficult technological issues.
Works with abstract ideas or situations across functional areas of the business. Identifies and evaluates fundamental issues, providing the strategy and direction for major functional areas.
Provides direction, goals, schedules, and coaching to an experienced team of Functional Engineering Leads assigned to the Core Team.
Follow Seagate product development process to deliver product milestones on schedule.
About you
Good written and oral communication skills for coordination with the extended team, including engineering groups, and communicating product issues and status to the executive
Ability to lead cross functionally with a wide variety of disciplines and geographies
Your experience includes:
Design best in class networking for scale out storage solutions.
Systems engineering and the integration of subsystems.
Technical project management
Excellent track record of technical leadership on a fast paced Product Development Core Teams.
Data analysis and statistical methods.
Architecting scale out storage solutions using open source object storage technologies (ceph, openstack, swiftstack etc)
Bachelor's Degree (BSCS) and 15+ years experience, Master’s Degree (BSCS) and 12+ years experience, or PhD and 10+ years of experience or equivalent combined education and experience.
Location: Fremont, CA or Longmont, CO
Fremont:

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

Longmont:

Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play ping-pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.
Travel: 0-20%
Job Family: Engineering Professional
Job Family: Engineering Professional
