job_description:
The School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS), within the College of Engineering at Oregon State University, invites applications for Instructors in the Computer Science (CS) undergraduate program. Available Instructor positions are fixed-term, non-tenure track, 12 month full-time (1.0 FTE) positions, with the possibility of renewal at the discretion of the School Head. The closing date for this posting may be adjusted without prior notification to applicants.

The School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science is a leader in undergraduate educational innovation. With programs including TekBots, the online Post-Baccalaureate degree in CS, and the Center for Applied Software Solutions (CASS), EECS engages students at all levels for real-world experiences and opportunities. With a strong research strength, teaching coursework is continually improved to respond to the most current needs of industry and academia.

The OSU College of Engineering is committed to being recognized as a national model of inclusivity and collaboration. We strive to develop a community of faculty, students, and staff that is inclusive, collaborative, diverse and centered on student success. As such, we seek applicants who will broaden our capacity to advance student success across individual identities, racial/ethnic categories and socioeconomic backgrounds.
Position Duties
90% Instruction
Computer Science instructors prepare and teach course materials in one or more areas of CS including, but not limited to, the following: Introductory Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Databases, Artificial Intelligence, Operating Systems, Networking, Security, Web and Cloud Development, and Mobile Development.
Responsibilities include equipping students with the required skill set, assessing student performance, and/or preparing students to be successful leaders in their chosen profession.
Instructors may assist in driving curriculum design and development.
Responsibilities also include creating an inclusive classroom (e.g., mentoring and supporting students from diverse backgrounds, and fostering affirming classroom interactions across different and challenging structural/cultural barriers that limit movement towards social equity in engineering education and practice).
5% Supervision
Instructors provide leadership, supervision, and direction for graduate and undergraduate teaching assistants, as well as student workers.
5% Professional Development
Instructors engage in training, continuing education, and other professional development activities contributing to effectiveness as an instructor.
Minimum/Required Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
Experience teaching, mentoring and facilitating learners, inside or outside a classroom setting.Deep understanding in one or more areas of need in the CS program (specifically: Introductory Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Databases, Artificial Intelligence, Operating Systems, Networking, Security, Web and Cloud Development, and Mobile Development)
Demonstrable commitment to promoting and enhancing diversity.Excellent written and verbal English skills.
Preferred (Special) Qualifications
Doctorate in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field.Strong interpersonal communication skills.
Working Conditions / Work Schedule This position requires a clear and unambiguous commitment to compliance of all National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) regulations for Division I (FBS) universities. No
Posting Number P03833UF

Number of Vacancies 1

Anticipated Appointment Begin Date 09/16/2020

Anticipated Appointment End Date

Posting Date 06/05/2020

Full Consideration Date 06/18/2020

Closing Date 06/30/2020

Indicate how you intend to recruit for this search Competitive / External - open to ALL qualified applicants

Special Instructions to Applicants
To ensure full consideration, applications must be received by June 18, 2020. Applications will continue to be accepted after the full consideration date, until a sufficient applicant pool has been achieved or the position is filled. The closing date is subject to change without notice to applicants.

When applying you will be required to attach the following electronic documents:

1) A resume/CV; and

2) A cover letter indicating how your qualifications and experience have prepared you for this position.

3) A diversity statement indicating how your teaching philosophy and practices promote diversity, equity, and inclusion in the classroom and broader community.

You will also be required to submit the names of at least three professional references, their e-mail addresses and telephone numbers as part of the application process.

For additional information please contact:

Eduardo Cotilla-Sanchez at cotillaj@oregonstate.edu
Starting salary within the salary range will be commensurate with skills, education, and experience.

OSU commits to inclusive excellence by advancing equity and diversity in all that we do. We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer, and particularly encourage applications from members of historically underrepresented racial/ethnic groups, women, individuals with disabilities, veterans, LGBTQ community members, and others who demonstrate the ability to help us achieve our vision of a diverse and inclusive community.

job_description:
Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
About us……..
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as:-
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities: -
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience: -
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.
Logistics and Location: Thousand Oaks, CA

job_description:
Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.
We're looking for a Product Manager to join Snap Inc! We're looking for someone who has a ML-focused background that can leverage and apply machine learning technology to shape the future of our paid products. Working from our Santa Monica headquarters, you’ll partner closely with Engineering in building out scalable ranking systems and models to improve ads personalization and advertiser performance. You’ll become the internal voice of our revenue-generating products by focusing on synthesizing external research, internal analytics, and cross-functional team feedback into a long-term product vision and near-term execution plan .
What you'll do:
Develop and launch machine learning centric products and services that help our broader business, while being conscientious and cautious of impacts on core user experience
Define the business goals and own the results for your product area
Manage a long-term roadmap for internal tools, data and analytics, and revenue-related products and improvements
Solicit ideas and feedback, gather requirements, write specs, create wireframes and workflows, and coordinate cross-functionally
Drive strategic product decisions via evaluation of market trends and meticulous retrospective and prospective analysis of product and revenue performance
Become the internal voice and representative for revenue-related products
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Exceptional analytical skills
Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS from a leading undergraduate institution in CS/EE/General Engineering or Economics/Physics/Psychology/Math
3+ years of product management or product marketing experience at a consumer or enterprise technology company
Deep knowledge of machine learning/artificial intelligence/computer vision
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building and applying ML technologies to large scale problems
Experience with product design, software development, or interaction design
Experience with brands and agencies in the digital advertising space
Familiarity with SQL, Python, ProgR, Minitab, or SPSS
At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. EOE, including disability/vets. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com .

job_description:
Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company committed to a single mission: to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines focused on helping millions of patients around the world in disease areas such as oncology, cardiovascular, immunoscience and fibrosis.
Join us and make a difference. We hire the best people and provide them with a work environment that places a premium on diversity, integrity, collaboration and personal development. Through a culture of inclusion, we create a better, more productive work environment. We believe that the diverse experiences and perspectives of all our employees help to drive innovation and transformative business results.
The GPS (Global Product and Supply) Analytics and Data Science team within Business Insights and Analytics partners with the BMS GPS organization to support data analytics for all key functions within GPS including Manufacturing Operations. GPS Analytics focuses on answering key business questions that will drive prioritized business decisions using advanced analytics and data science. The Manufacturing Operations organization at BMS supports drug product manufacturing from commercialization through end of lifecycle. Manufacturing Operations scope includes Plant Operations, Science & Technology (MS&T), Internal Manufacturing, External Manufacturing and Network Strategy and Business Operations. The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to answer key business questions within the Internal Manufacturing Operations space with an emphasis on the Biologics Operations. The successful candidate has a background in Manufacturing Operations and has expertise in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, data visualization, statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, artificial intelligence, Python and ProgR, coding, ProgR, Shiny app development, and Tableau/Spotfire dashboard development.
The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to establish core capabilities within the team, namely:
Supporting Business Decisions – Work closely with business stakeholders to proactively identify and address priority business questions within Manufacturing Operations.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities – Answer key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques, assist with establishing core analytical and data science capabilities, standards, processes and methodologies for the team.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence – Play a critical role in managing team productivity, timeliness and quality of deliverables. Ensure consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff. Continuously seek opportunities and approaches for enhancing the team’s overall productivity.
Supporting Business Decisions
Identifies and contextualizes critical business issues, working to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation.
Drives the application of fact based decision making for key questions within the Manufacturing portfolio enabling priority business choices.
Develops and maintains a deep understanding of Manufacturing, and plant operations business priorities, meeting agreed upon analytics deliverables / timing.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities
Designs, develops and implements a broad array of business analytics that solve complex problems in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner.
Identifies new opportunities to further leverage analytics, data and analytical tools.
Ensures best practice adoption within stated areas of responsibility, applying appropriate levels of technical capability, standardization and subject matter expertise.
Proactively manages planned and ad hoc analytics requests, ensuring consistent quality and timeliness in delivery to business stakeholders.
Leverages standards for the provision of analytics to support planning and decision making processes, and utilizes appropriate escalation processes.
Provides input/feedback and works actively to improve and enhance capabilities related to the GPS BIA team
Supports culture of analytics and fact-based decision making through the utilization of standard methodologies and approaches.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence
Supervises and collaborates closely with external analytics contractors and vendors when applicable or assigned.
Conducts detailed team walkthroughs and peer review of team’s work to ensure quality, cross training and knowledge management within the team.
Ensures consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff.
Authors detailed documentation that describes analytics tool development, assumptions and input data and any specialized data treatments. Authors user manual for dissemination within Manufacturing Operations user base.
List of minimum requirements
BA/BS required (quantitative area of study or engineering)
MSci, MEng or other Masters in quantitative area of study, analytics or data science preferred
Experience – Responsibility and minimum number of years
5+ years hands-on working in the area of data science, data analytics, data integration, reporting.
5+ years of hands-on experience with analytics, modeling platforms, data manipulation software and visualization tools (e.g. Advanced SQL, PL/SQL, ProgR, Python, SAP HANA, Spotfire, Tableau, Microsoft Suite, Hadoop, Redshift).
Experience working in the manufacturing space. Experience working in a GMP arena is a plus.
Experience interpreting analytical results and ascertaining implications to the business.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders understanding, anticipating, and fulfilling their insight/analytical information requirements.
Experience managing a team of contracted resources.
Competencies – knowledge, skills, abilities, other
Strong creative problem solving skills to answer key business questions.
Ability to work with diverse teams across organizational lines and structures.
Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and priorities.
Strong analytical skills with substantial knowledge of data analysis & data engineering.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to quickly gain and apply quality specific knowledge.
Ability to learn new tools quickly.
Proven ability to lead small teams/groups and manage a heavy workload.
Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

job_description:
The Office of the CTO for Microsoft is chartered with understanding, shaping and accelerating technologies and their impact on Microsoft, industry and society in order to empower every person and every organization to achieve more. Whether it is providing insights company-wide, giving meaning to an “AI First” company, or helping to drive impact of “Intelligent Cloud/ Intelligent Edge Computing”, the Office of the CTO is down in the trenches, working with our engineering, field and strategy teams across the company. We gather information, synthesize best practices, drive cross-company workstreams, support cross-industry partnerships and engage in activities that inform the CTO and the SLT and move the needle on Microsoft’s strategic and technical direction.

The deputy office is focused on Scale H2 Technologies and includes highly technical, but cross-functional and highly independent leaders who accelerate leading edge technology to scalable, rapidly growing solutions. This team works across the company through connecting people, resources and ideas across organizations and disciplinary boundaries. We are the glue between the customer need + strategy + technical execution. We are the 1+1 >2.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Advanced Technology Advisor is an experienced technologist across hardware, software, networking, possessing scientific acumen, operations, and a passion for product.
Hands-on with cutting-edge technologies, jump-in directly into code, prototype, connect and improve on architectural components of solutions
Can understand and map technical architecture, hold their own with product teams
Has strong product acumen, usability research and user experience background
Can wade through and understand deep technical concepts, rationalize and align them across organizations
Is a strategic thinker, with through understanding of market trends, a passion for deep technical and market analysis and capable writer ready to present to C-Suite leaders
Work with Technical Teams, Business Development, Corporate Development leaders and M12, to align organization and accelerate scalability of growth businesses
Technically proficient in AI/ML, Intelligent Edge, Computer Vision Technology and 5G
Has a proven track record working on innovative technologies, contributing to important strategic technical projects
Strong operational program manager that leaves no stone unturned, but can communicate at the appropriate level of abstraction, a self-starter who can work in ambiguous environments, keeping the shared goals in mind
Qualifications
Qualifications
Required:
10+ years of experience in Technical/Engineering/ Technical Program Manager role with hands-on experience
Experience leading technical projects, shipping software, troubleshooting technical issues

Preferred:
Be respected by product and technical teams
Excellent communicator and EQ
Be able to lead through influence, work across teams at scale and feel confident engaging with executives
Artificial Intelligence, 5G, Intelligent Edge and IoT expertise
Cloud development at scale: Azure or similar
PhD or MS degree in Computer Science

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Has strong product acumen, usability research and user experience background.  Has a proven track record working on innovative technologies, contributing to important strategic technical projects.  Strong operational program manager that leaves no stone unturned, but can communicate at the appropriate level of abstraction, a self-starter who can work in ambiguous environments, keeping the shared goals in mind.  10+ years of experience in Technical/Engineering/ Technical Program Manager role with hands-on experience.  Experience leading technical projects, shipping software, troubleshooting technical issues.  Excellent communicator and EQ.  PhD or MS degree in Computer Science

job_description:
At Marvin, we make windows and doors inspired by how you live so you're inspired to live well. We are driven by the momentum of four generations of innovation and excellence to imagine and create better ways of living. Our business reaches across the nation and our products are represented around the world. With our commitment to our local communities and to providing innovative solutions using new technology, we are always looking for ways to move our people, as well as our business, forward.

Marvin is in the midst of a digital transformation journey and actively pursuing highly optimized digital manufacturing and automation while simultaneously leveraging Human Centered Design to create innovative, disruptive, personalized and delightful new products and experiences for our employees, channel partners and customers. Our executive leadership has recognized the critical need to enhance our data capabilities and the role our overall data and analytics performance will play as a foundational cornerstone for this transformational journey. As a result we are searching for a highly talented executive to lead this critical technology function.

The primary objective for this position is to drive positive and impactful business outcomes through effective data architecture and optimization of the company’s data assets. This role will be responsible for partnering with business leaders to develop a strategic roadmap, inclusive of a data products and services approach, that delivers efficient, agile data operations and key business performance/decision analytics… powering the achievement of the company’s most important strategic priorities short and long term. The role will also ensure that key measures and protocols around data governance, compliance, security, quality, availability and consumability will be consistently and successfully implemented across the enterprise data ecosystem.

The successful candidate will lead Marvin’s data performance function but is also expected to be a strong contributor to the performance of the overall IT Leadership Team – a team anchored around the high-performance tenants of Trust, Healthy Debate, Commitment to Decisions, Performance Accountability and Results. Additionally, the successful candidate will be a purpose and values driven people leader, strategic and positive thinker and capable of concisely articulating a case for change while effectively rallying the organization to that end. They will also lead and develop the organization’s operational data, analytics data and data sciences teams to enable the organization to effectively mold and utilize data assets for the achievement of the desired manufacturing, automation, employee, channel-partner, customer and financial results.

Essential Job Functions

Leadership

Vision & Strategy
Develop and refine the enterprise strategic roadmap for data performance
Connect vision to actionable tactical objectives and project initiatives
Drive a connected and collaborative strategy across all Marvin leadership and business functions
Consolidate disparate business entity strategies to ensure optimal financial performance for the enterprise
Team Leadership & Development
Nurture an environment of vulnerability and trust, foster healthy debate, gain commitment, facilitate accountability and deliver desired results as a team
Support and promote implementation of EOS (Traction) management process within the data performance teams
Evaluate, develop and build the team in support of the strategic vision and roadmap
Coach and mentor team leaders to execute the playbook and drive overall team development and performance

Culture

Values and Culture Flag Bearer
Highly engaged in the business functions to identify and define data solution targets that empower the Marvin strategic business plan
Company purpose and values in action (Purpose: Imagine and Create Better Ways of Living; Values: Do the right thing, Be stronger together, Think differently, Raise the bar, Believe it’s possible)
Take an immersed position in the business and leverage observations to bring thought leadership around data and business performance
Be curious, insightful, good listener, humble, adaptable and results oriented (give away the credit, take the responsibility)
Innovation
Nurture an environment that encourages exploration and embraces fast intelligent failure
Promote the principles and adoption of Human Centered Design
Identify and implement leap-frog opportunities to rapidly enhance data performance capabilities
Identify high impact continuous improvement initiatives

Partnership

Strategic Mindset
Build partner alignment around high impact outcomes (ROI – place the right bets)
Thought leadership and influence (strategic point of view, socialize to gain alignment and buy-in)
Proactive partner (driving vs. reacting)
Decisions in context (present, near future, long term)
Relationships
Take an immersed position in the operational and channel landscapes
Earn respect of key business and technology stakeholders
Develop win-win strategic partnerships
Effectively communicate strategic plans and innovative ideas to IT and Marvin Leadership

Governance

Governance and Alignment
Deliver a highly collaborative and efficient data project work intake and prioritization governance process
Collaborate and ensure alignment on business and technical solution architecture to ensure the achievement of Marvin enterprise data strategies
Implement best practices for data performance, compliance, governance and data security

You are a good fit if you have:

Expertise in a wide range of business functions, processes, leadership, budgeting and overall business operations and financial management
Ability to develop high performing teams and identify and mentor future leaders
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to professionally interact with and influence a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Knowledge of sound project management principles and successful implementation track record
Demonstrated working knowledge of systems supporting manufacturing and supply chain processes .


You are qualified if you have:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or related discipline desired (MBA a plus)
7+ years of experience with directing staff and establishing priorities with company leadership
Proven ability to bring data solutions from concept to high functionality in an environment highly ingrained and dependent on legacy processes, systems and applications
Successful track record of leading operational, integration and warehouse data platform performance, leveraging leading industry tools (Dell Boomi, Informatica, Talend, Denodo)
Strong knowledge of advanced analytics methodologies including artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts aimed towards delivering high impact results for the business.
Working knowledge of big data programming environments and competency in major analytics software packages and programming environments (e.g. Snowflake, Hadoop, Databricks)
Working knowledge of database technologies, including Oracle, SQL / NoSQL platforms, analytics and visualization applications such as Qlik, Power BI, Tableau etc.
Subject matter expertise to assist setting and driving data architecture direction.
10-15% domestic travel may be required


EOE

job_description:
The Company
Founded in 2010, Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog the competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists – INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500TM, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.

The Role
The role of Director, Product Management is responsible for driving and delivering a world-class strategy for a suite of Axtria products. This person employs a unique blend of business & technical savvy, the drive to make vision a reality, and the desire to invest in the commercial success of their product. The Director of Product Management partners cross-functionally to define the vision of the product, product release requirements and execution strategies. Works closely with Engineering and UX teams to develop and drive delivery. This role works with marketing to define go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer. The Director Product Management also supports product marketing as an internal and external evangelist for the product, while also partnering with the direct sales & customer success teams, and key customers.
This is an individual contributor role with the potential to have people management responsibilities in the future as the company grows and the product portfolio expands.
This role reports to the Head of Product Management. Preferred location is Berkeley Heights, NJ. Travel expectation up to 25% as needed.

Key Responsibilities
Define, lead, and communicate product strategy in line with the business goals.
Ensure rapid pace of moving from strategy to execution of product initiatives.
Synthesize ideas on strategy, planning and execution to identify new market opportunities & create the next generation of products, building consensus and driving execution along the way.
Work within a team of Product Managers, Engineers and UX Designers to drive agile execution of new product launches. Develop a strong understanding of stakeholders to drive decisions.
Actively participate in Scrum ceremonies working with team members in the US as well as in India.
Ensure ongoing product growth and expansion by gaining and exploiting market feedback from customers and prospects.
Evaluate market share and drive competitive analysis across a suite of products.

Required Experience/Skills
Bachelor's Degree required / technical undergraduate degree preferred, MBA or equivalent preferred.
Minimum 7+ years experience in product management, with a combined 12+ years industry experience including product development/technical role/product marketing in a software solutions oriented business.
Experience in a B2B SaaS or software company specifically related to Data Ingestion, Data Model and Data Quality.
Ability to conceptualize, negotiate and sell ideas internally and externally.
Strong understanding of user-centered design principles.
Proven track record for developing, managing and launching large-scale cloud-based software products.
Strong technical and data-analysis skills.
Exceptionally strong writing and presentation skills.
Excellent organizational, project and resource management skills.

The Preferred Qualifications
Experience in leading Agile/Scrum adoption in prior roles as a Product Owner.
Experience working in a fast-paced environment.
Experience working on large scale data integration products is beneficial in providing product strategy guidance to R&D teams and architects.
Familiarity or work experience in the Pharmaceutical space is highly desired but not required.
Background in the SaaS, software or technology industry is highly preferred.
Prior experience managing people is beneficial.

The exact nature of duties, level of role as well as the salary and compensation package will be commensurate with experience and salary history.
Axtria is an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We offer attractive performance-based compensation packages including salary and bonus. Comprehensive benefits are available including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 401K with company match. Immigration sponsorship will be considered.

job_description:
Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd, one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms. We’ve never been a typical professional services firm. We put people first, and that is what sets us apart.

Innovative and disruptive technologies pose specific challenges to organizations, and particularly the tax functions within them. At Grant Thornton, we’re investing in people who understand innovation and disruptive technology to help organizations in capitalizing on the advantages presented by these new opportunities.

Why Join Tax Consulting?

At Grant Thornton, Tax consulting manages, automates, analyzes and visualizes data to support tax initiatives. We seek to incorporate both AI (specifically machine learning and neural networks), as well as blockchain, in these endeavors.

We work with complex multinational companies to understand the regulatory landscape and influence business decisions. If you have a desire to think globally in a fast-paced environment and influence important decisions in variety of business functions, then Tax consulting may be an area for you to consider.

Qualifications

Baseline Requirements

1-2 years of programming related courses
Java, C++ or .NET (C# or VB) preferred
Database architecture; creating queries and tables using Oracle or SQL server
Project management/project life-cycle knowledge with experience doing systems/business analysis
Technical/advanced writing skills

Advanced Requirements

Experience with web development techniques
Business related internship
Experience working with back end databases and database management systems
Knowledge of multiple ERP systems and databases (e.g. SAP, MS Access)
Familiarity with system infrastructure and application design
Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation and blockchain and their impact on the regulatory environment

Candidate Characteristics

Intellectually curious
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Innovative thinker who challenges conventional wisdom
Willingness to learn and adopt new technologies
Ability to function within a geographically-distributed team
Good listening skills and the ability to grasp business needs

Applicable Majors:

Software/system engineering
MIS or CS degree with or without Accounting
Data science
Data analytics

Requisition ID: 044300

Atlanta, GA
Atlanta, Georgia

job_title_2: Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager
job_description:
Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager
We are seeking to fill the position of Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager. This is a full-time position, based in Jacksonville, FL and reports to the Chief Operating Officer. The role is responsible for positioning truevue360 to facilitate revenue growth by leveraging our brand products and services, while maintaining the business unit’s sales targets to meet company objectives. The successful candidate will be a creative technologist who excels at relationship building and/or can leverage existing contacts to facilitate direct sales and develop partner channels in diverse markets. The role requires a detail-oriented individual with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. The candidates’ goals will be accomplished through multiple activities including developing strategies and tactics with the partner for quotes, bids and project or program capture. The candidate will be instrumental in developing creative application concepts to present customers with disruptive AI solutions and help partners with their differentiation of truevue360 applications and services, market penetration, and revenue and margin growth to achieve quota.
We specialize in developing, implementing and supporting integrated advanced technology systems to address complex business challenges. Our core proprietary technologies focus on passenger and freight rail, correctional facilities, security, and distribution centers gatehouse automation/logistics. Our proprietary applications include artificial intelligence, deep learning/machine vision video analytics-based security applications, intelligent process controls, and information technologies for a wide range of global customers. For more information, please visit our parent company website at http://www.duostech.com/.
Responsibilities:
Recruit, acquire, develop and manage key strategic clients and channel partners
Develop and maintain relationships with clients and partners through identification of key decision makers and managing and building relationships in diversified markets
Identify and assess potential business opportunities in diverse markets and provide feedback to our engineering and R&D teams
Support partners with project proposals, bidding, and presentations to successfully capture projects
Support partners by answering complex questions pertaining to product features, functions, licensing, integration, and program or project requirements
Utilize a solutions-based sales process. Be prepared to uncover business pains, articulate ROI, and deliver customized product demonstrations to help prospects understand the importance of embracing the digital evolution and artificial intelligence.
Participate in sales forecasting and planning in an effective manner by assisting with researching, developing, and maintaining long- and short-range sales and marketing plans
Monitor, analyze, and communicate monthly sales data and targets
Drive continual training activities which articulate truevue360 strategic direction, product and technology, sales strategies, go-to-market efforts, demand creation, and marketing programs and communications
Develop an in-depth understanding of truevue360 products, programs, projects, and sales methodology
Work closely with Marketing to provide project and content coordination in support of partner-driven marketing events with support from marketing and channel strategy resources
Support key marketing activities necessary for sales growth, road shows, conferences, tradeshows, sales training, and various sales engagement activities
This position requires extensive travel throughout North America
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in sales role (SaaS preferred)
Exposure to selling Artificial Intelligence applications/systems
Experience developing and managing channel partners and programs to meet and exceed sales quotas
Excellent negotiation skills/techniques with channel partners and clients as well as internal delivery teams for successful execution of sales targets
Exceptional English language written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with data analysis, reporting, and CRM systems
Understanding of national and regional technology marketplace requirements and trends
Ability to analyze and understand channel partner organizations
Ability to leverage internal and external resources to achieve sales objectives
Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close
Successful track record of relationship management and sales

Generous compensation package with incentives based on performance. Benefit package includes paid group health, dental, life, and disability insurance plus voluntary vision, critical illness, off the job accident insurance, non-matching 401(k) plan, Employee Assistance Program, and paid vacation and sick days.
To apply please submit a detailed resume, and if qualified, our Human Resources will administer a mandatory questionnaire.
truevue360 is a wholly owned subsidiary of Duos Technologies Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: DUOT) and is an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
truevue360 is a Drug Free Workplace. An offer of employment is contingent upon satisfactory results of a pre-employment drug screening, and a background check.

Familiarity with data analysis, reporting, and CRM systems.  Ability to analyze and understand channel partner organizations. job_title_2: Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science
job_description:
Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company committed to a single mission: to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines focused on helping millions of patients around the world in disease areas such as oncology, cardiovascular, immunoscience and fibrosis.


Join us and make a difference. We hire the best people and provide them with a work environment that places a premium on diversity, integrity, collaboration and personal development. Through a culture of inclusion, we create a better, more productive work environment. We believe that the diverse experiences and perspectives of all our employees help to drive innovation and transformative business results.


Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global biopharmaceutical company whose mission is to discover, develop and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases.


One shared journey is moving us forward at Bristol-Myers Squibb. Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious disease. Empowered to apply our individual talents and ideas so that we can learn and grow together. Driven to make a difference, from innovative research to hands-on community support. Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.


The GPS (Global Product and Supply) Analytics and Data Science team within Business Insights and Analytics partners with the BMS GPS organization to support data analytics for all key functions within GPS including Manufacturing Operations. GPS Analytics focuses on answering key business questions that will drive prioritized business decisions using advanced analytics and data science. The Manufacturing Operations organization at BMS supports drug product manufacturing from commercialization through end of lifecycle. Manufacturing Operations scope includes Manufacturing, Science & Technology (MS&T), Internal Manufacturing, External Manufacturing and Network Strategy and Business Operations. The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to answer key business questions within the Manufacturing Operations space. The successful candidate has a background in Manufacturing Operations and has expertise in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, data visualization, statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, artificial intelligence, Python and ProgR, coding, ProgR, Shiny app development, and Tableau/Spotfire dashboard development.

The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to establish core capabilities within the team, namely:

Supporting Business Decisions - Work closely with business stakeholders to proactively identify and address priority business questions within Manufacturing Operations.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities - Answer key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques, assist with establishing core analytical and data science capabilities, standards, processes and methodologies for the team.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence - Play a critical role in managing team productivity, timeliness and quality of deliverables. Ensure consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff. Continuously seek opportunities and approaches for enhancing the team's overall productivity.

Supporting Business Decisions

Identifies and contextualizes critical business issues, working to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation.
Drives the application of fact based decision making for key questions within the Manufacturing, Finance and Procurement portfolio's enabling priority business choices.
Develops and maintains a deep understanding of Manufacturing, Finance and Procurement business priorities, meeting agreed upon analytics deliverables / timing.

Driving Analytics and Capabilities

Designs, develops and implements a broad array of business analytics that solve complex problems in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner.
Identifies new opportunities to further leverage analytics, data and analytical tools.
Ensures best practice adoption within stated areas of responsibility, applying appropriate levels of technical capability, standardization and subject matter expertise.
Proactively manages planned and ad hoc analytics requests, ensuring consistent quality and timeliness in delivery to business stakeholders.
Leverages standards for the provision of analytics to support planning and decision making processes, and utilizes appropriate escalation processes.
Provides input/feedback and works actively to improve and enhance capabilities related to the GPS BIA team
Supports culture of analytics and fact-based decision making through the utilization of standard methodologies and approaches.

Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence

Supervises and collaborates closely with external analytics contractors and vendors when applicable or assigned.
Conducts detailed team walkthroughs and peer review of team's work to ensure quality, cross training and knowledge management within the team.
Ensures consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff.
Authors detailed documentation that describes analytics tool development, assumptions and input data and any specialized data treatments. Authors user manual for dissemination within Manufacturing Operations user base.

List of minimum requirements

BA/BS required (quantitative area of study or engineering)
MSci, MEng or other Masters in quantitative area of study, analytics or data science preferred

Experience - Responsibility and minimum number of years

5+ years hands-on working in the area of data science, data analytics, data integration, reporting.
5+ years of hands-on experience with analytics, modeling platforms, data manipulation software and visualization tools (e.g. Advanced SQL, PL/SQL, ProgR, Python, SAP HANA, Spotfire, Tableau, Microsoft Suite, Hadoop, Redshift).
Experience working in the manufacturing space.
Experience interpreting analytical results and ascertaining implications to the business.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders understanding, anticipating, and fulfilling their insight/analytical information requirements.
Experience managing a team of contracted resources.
Competencies - knowledge, skills, abilities, other
Strong creative problem solving skills to answer key business questions.
Ability to work with diverse teams across organizational lines and structures.
Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and priorities.
Strong analytical skills with substantial knowledge of data analysis & data engineering.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to quickly gain and apply quality specific knowledge.
Ability to learn new tools quickly.
Proven ability to lead small teams/groups and manage a heavy workload.
Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

job_title_2: Director of Data Architecture - Information Resources
job_description:
Summary
This position is responsible for the planning and development of the data warehouse and business intelligence systems for Enterprise Data Services.

Experience and Education
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, technology, engineering, or related field required. Advanced degree in science, technology, engineering, math, or related field preferred.
Ten (10) years of progressively responsible Data Warehouse management, Business Intelligence, or related IT experience required. Prior experience in the healthcare industry and agile development methodologies is highly preferred.

Job Description
Serve as a technology thought leader for the EDW. Provide leadership on data architecture, data modeling, data governance, and business intelligence tools.

Oversee the expansion of the EDW to support the enterprise data initiatives integrating data from disparate source systems.

Review and approve data model design of facts and conformed dimensions. Define and enforce data modeling standards using appropriate methodology (e.g., Kimball).

Lead the development of automation for data transformation and quality control using Microsoft technology including SQL Server, SSIS, and SSAS

Discover new and improved ways to deliver data to end users ensuring the appropriate business intelligence tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, SSRS, ProgR, etc., are employed to meet customer needs

Oversee the design of the EDW server farm working with on premise data centers as well as cloud hosting such as Azure.

Explore and introduce new analytics technology especially in the areas of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Big Data.

Participate in relevant data governance workgroups and steering committees.

Prioritize and facilitate data requests from operational groups. Manage utilization of various resources to maintain maximum efficiency and meet performance objectives.

Implement changes that lead to continuous improvement in customer service. Maintain breadth and depth of knowledge in cutting edge technology and leverage enterprise and industry best practices.

Ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, privacy & security policies, and procedures.

Oversee budget expenditures and scheduling. Manage supervisors and/or subordinate managers, establishing priorities.

Perform other duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Work requires ability to monitor and maintain budget.
Work requires ability to work with confidential information on a da ily basis.
Work requires ability to effectively interpret and apply organizational policies, procedures, and systems.
Work requires excellent interpersonal, organizational, supervisory/managerial, and analytical skills.
Work requires demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and exercise decision-making and problem solving skills.
Work requires ability to read, write, develop plans, procedures, and coordinate persons and other resources to accomplish goals.
Work requires knowledge of personal computers.
Work may require ability to lead committees as appropriate.
Work may require telephone and personal contact with all levels of internal and external personnel and organizations.

Working Conditions Work is performed primarily in general office environment.

Security
This position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code 51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information

Salary
Salary Negotiable

UT Southwestern Medical Center is committed to an educational and working environment that provides equal opportunity to all members of the University community. In accordance with federal and state law, the University prohibits unlawful discrimination, including harassment, on the basis of: race; color; religion; national origin; sex; including sexual harassment; age; disability; genetic information; citizenship status; and protected veteran status. In addition, it is UT Southwestern policy to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.

Advanced degree in science, technology, engineering, math, or related field preferred.  Ten (10) years of progressively responsible Data Warehouse management, Business Intelligence, or related IT experience required.  Prior experience in the healthcare industry and agile development methodologies is highly preferred.  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Supports culture of analytics and fact-based decision making through the utilization of standard methodologies and approaches.

Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence

Supervises and collaborates closely with external analytics contractors and vendors when applicable or assigned.
Conducts detailed team walkthroughs and peer review of team's work to ensure quality, cross training and knowledge management within the team.
Ensures consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff.
Authors detailed documentation that describes analytics tool development, assumptions and input data and any specialized data treatments. Authors user manual for dissemination within Manufacturing Operations user base.

List of minimum requirements

BA/BS required (quantitative area of study or engineering)
MSci, MEng or other Masters in quantitative area of study, analytics or data science preferred

Experience - Responsibility and minimum number of years

5+ years hands-on working in the area of data science, data analytics, data integration, reporting.
5+ years of hands-on experience with analytics, modeling platforms, data manipulation software and visualization tools (e.g. Advanced SQL, PL/SQL, ProgR, Python, SAP HANA, Spotfire, Tableau, Microsoft Suite, Hadoop, Redshift).
Experience working in the manufacturing space. Experience working in a GMP arena is a plus.
Experience interpreting analytical results and ascertaining implications to the business.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders understanding, anticipating, and fulfilling their insight/analytical information requirements.
Experience managing a team of contracted resources.
Competencies - knowledge, skills, abilities, other
Strong creative problem solving skills to answer key business questions.
Ability to work with diverse teams across organizational lines and structures.
Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and priorities.
Strong analytical skills with substantial knowledge of data analysis & data engineering.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to quickly gain and apply quality specific knowledge.
Ability to learn new tools quickly.
Proven ability to lead small teams/groups and manage a heavy workload.

job_description:
Cortana is a key ingredient of Microsoft's vision to democratize Artificial Intelligence and empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Cortana's natural user experience fundamentally changes the way we use devices, applications, services, and technology in the next wave of computing. We are looking for the right people to envision and help deliver the AI platform and experiences that people can’t do without, that gives them more time for the important things, alleviates the stress of daily lives and bring smiles to faces.

If you are passionate, creative, and want to thrive on the cutting edge of AI, then the Cortana team is where you want to be. It is an exciting time to be a part of the Cortana team, pushing the industry with one of Microsoft’s most unique products. We take our responsibility to build an inclusive user experience seriously and building inclusive teams is fundamental to that.

In this role, you will be at the forefront of this growing industry of intelligent assistants. You will have significant customer/product impact leading and driving innovations to the Cortana platform and architecture. Your efforts will result in a highly capable platform that powers a range of intelligent and assistive experiences across a variety of Microsoft 365 end points targeted at productivity improvements for the users. Specifically, in this role you will be responsible for understanding, defining and delivering the most important facets of a human’s life (e.g., people, information, etc.) and improving the ability to recognize them in the most natural ways that human’s interact (i.e., text, voice, etc.).

To be successful in this role, you must thrive on the challenge of advancing the state-of-the-art. You must also be experienced in collaborating across teams at Microsoft, cutting through ambiguity and getting products shipped with highest quality. If you have the vision and passion to make Cortana the industry leader in this space, then this is the job for you.
Responsibilities
Technology and Product related:
Own the roadmap for infrastructure that power rich entity recognition capabilities
Deliver the end to end quality of various product lines for natural language multi-modal interactions
Represent the above to various stakeholders ranging from exec leadership to partner teams
Lead feature improvements through iterative design and experimentation by leveraging data to build strong understanding of customer
Collaborate closely across multiple disciplines (design, data science, user research, engineering) to execute on our vision for the future
Qualifications
The ideal candidate for this role is a talented and experienced Program Manager with:
Strong technical leadership abilities with demonstrated strategic thinking and vision
5+ years of relevant program management experience in the tech industry
Proven track record of delivering large complex projects (ideally online services and AI/ML related)
Familiarity and/or experience in AI/ML, speech recognition and natural language technologies
Ability to effectively communicate and write functional specifications
Excellent analytical, communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
Ability and experience in managing cross-functional organizations, customers, and executive leadership teams
Motivated to work with and leverage internationally distributed development teams
Entrepreneurial mindset with a bias for action and drive for results
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
High School Diploma or the equivalent is required. In addition, Related Vocational Training plus a minimum of 3 years administrative or business experience, or a minimum 5 years of administrative or business experience is required.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Candidates must be able to obtain a Secret clearance within a reasonable amount of time from date of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
Help make the technologies, products and services that make a difference. That’s the opportunity that’s waiting for you at General Dynamics Mission Systems. We help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe by creating solutions so advanced, they redefine innovation for the world. It’s an amazing challenge. And it’s waiting for you now.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


Utilizing your strict adherence to confidentiality, dedication to a job well done and strong organizational skills, you’ll provide general administrative support to managers and their staff. You’ll manage the calendars, meeting and travel schedules and associated arrangements, expense and time reporting, and other responsibilities to relieve them of administrative details and allow them to concentrate on other business activities. Your poise, initiative, and precision will shape the environment in which we all work. It’s your chance to put your talent to the ultimate test. Are you ready?


What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
A High School Diploma or the equivalent is required. In addition, Related Vocational Training plus a minimum of 3 years administrative or business experience, or a minimum 5 years of administrative or business experience
Ability to manage frequently changing schedules and appointments as well as coordinate multiple projects and tasks
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Self-starter who can apply discretion when dealing with sensitive information/situations
What sets you apart:
Strong writing and editing skills, vocabulary and grammar
Exceptional organization and time management skills, attention to detail, and ability to multi-task high priorities
Outstanding interpersonal skills and a professional demeanor in interacting with a wide variety of people
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

job_description:
Title: Sr. Director, Picture Quality / Algorithm Development

Company: Samsung Research America (SRA)

Lab: Digital Media Solutions (Irvine)

Location: Irvine, CA

Lab Summary:
DMS (Digital Media Solutions) lab has researched and developed TV and display's picture quality algorithm for product excellence. Samsung TV has been leading the industry with top products for 14 years and DMS lab contributes a lot for PQ algorithm. We are leading HDR technologies for TV and researching AI (Artificial Intelligence) based picture quality enhancement also. DMS lab keep focusing on researching new algorithm for TV and display's picture quality improvement and optimization and supporting production.

Position Summary:

This position requires managing picture quality team's projects and people and planning new project for the next year. The position requires frequent collaboration with colleagues and other teams also. For example, Samsung has a lot of organizations such as Korea team, China, India, EU R&D center and this position requires good collaboration with other country's teams and people. This position also will be required to plan to new project with new technologies. For instance, Samsung 8K TV is supporting 8K AI scaler function for customer value and differentiation and this is one of the new projects suggested as a PQ algorithm project. We are trying to develop AI related technologies for display's PQ and Deep Learning background is essential for this position.

Responsibilities Include:

PQ project and people managing
Collaboration with Korea, Mexico or other country's team
Find and research new project for TV's PQ excellence
HDR 10+, Deep Learning based Super Resolution, FRC technologies understanding and leading the industry
Experience Requirements:
More than 10 year's PQ research and development experience
More than 5 years project manager experience
Ph.D. is preferred in AI related major (EE, CS, CE preferred)

Samsung is an EEO/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We welcome and encourage diversity as we strive to create an inclusive workplace.

job_description:
Associate Director, Global Contract Lead



Description
Developing innovative therapies is one of the most challenging, most essential and personally rewarding fields in science. This is the most exciting time to be a part of Astellas, a company with a uniquely collaborative and patient-focused culture.

There's something special about working at Astellas. It's reflected in our focus on the people we serve, the way we treat each other and the results we achieve together as a company.

Astellas is announcing an Associate Director, Global Contract Lead opportunity in Northbrook, IL.


Purpose & Scope:

The role will support the entire Procurement category and sourcing teams in efficient commercial contract management. The role will have the following key goals:

Enhance value of sourcing activities by create a standardized contract management process that is tailored to each geography
Create a process and technology backbone to ensure a seamless and smooth process of creating, negotiating, storing and retrieving contracts
Provide sound contracting practices and ensure compliance with Astellas policies and procedures
Working with other key functions (in particular, Legal and Global Business Services) to develop a global contracting operating model which effectively manages risk whilst delivering optimum agility and efficiency


Essential Job Responsibilities:

The role will enable the Global Category Management and Technology Lead as well as the entire Sourcing and Category teams by establishing a centralized and standardized (yet customized by region) contracting process as well as creating a easy to use repository of contracts. The role will have following key responsibilities:

Create an end to end global operating model and process of contract management that is standardized as much as possible taking into account regional nuances. This will include :
Implement and co-develop procedures for contract management and administration in compliance with company policy
Develop, own and deliver a globally standardized support model which delivers end-to-end ownership of the contracting process including all administration and negotiation
Developing and maintaining standard contracting templates and playbooks (along with legal) which both mitigate risk and drive agility
Develop a technology strategy which builds on and enhances the current myContract platform including the use of Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence
Coaching the category and sourcing managers on the process
Ensure appropriate contract close-out, extension, or renewal protocols
Ensure that the contract management process is being followed. Monitor compliance by company employees with established procedures
Work with Procurement Technology Lead to develop a technology strategy which builds on and enhances the current myContract platform including the use of advanced capabilities such as Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence
Establish an audit process to not only ensure compliance to contracting process but also to ensure compliance to contracts and as such, offer improved risk mitigation and incremental commercial value
Provide all categories and business stakeholders with a 'Contract as a Service' approach in order to both reduce touch points and provide increased speed/cycle time reduction
Own end-to-end Contract Life Cycle Management activities including proactive renewals and effective management of data to support wider business change activities
Primary point of contact with Legal and responsible for incorporating and communicating all legal advice and input
Work closely with Supplier Risk Lead in order to provide required inputs to a seamless Supplier Risk program
Consult key stakeholders and own the contracting continuous improvement plan along with all necessary change management and training requirements


Quantitative Dimensions:

Develop an operating model to negotiate, manage and store in excess of 10,000 commercial contracts per annum, covering a spend of $3.7bn
Ownership of all resources dedicated to the Contract Management process (Administration and Negotiation) - currently consists of 21 resources (BPO, Interim and Permanent). Exact number will be reviewed as part of Operating Model delivery
Ad-Hoc Management: With the support of key stakeholders, will interact and lead multi-functional teams
Travel: Key area of the role will be to support with, align and influence Global/Regional stakeholders and therefore, global/regional travel will be required (~20% of role)


Organizational Context:

Key Relationships:

Legal Department
Global Business Services - in particular, Global and Regional P2P Leads
Category Leads
Category Managers
All Business Stakeholders who may be involved in commercial contracts
Reports to: Global Category Management & Technology Lead


Requirements
Qualifications:

Required

Minimum Qualification

Degree required
3+ years of Experience in procurement contracting activities
Fluency in English conversational and business English (equivalent to TOEFL iBT 105+, or 7.5 IELTS, CAE- Cambridge English advanced exam)


Minimum Experience

Strong organization skills
Experience with information systems
Comfortable working with contracts
General working knowledge and competency in Microsoft packages and Source to Pay systems
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills (multiple complex analyses simultaneously)
Good planning/project management skills
Evidence of developing innovative commercial solutions using a wide range of value levers


Job specific skills (behavioral)

High energy, enthusiastic
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills - important to build relationships, trust and to become respected by the business teams
Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills
Strong problem solving skills
Strong implementation skills. Able to interpret business requirements and effectively align inputs, outputs and results
Makes good and timely decisions that move the organization forward, based upon a mixture of facts, analysis, experience and judgement
Builds strong customer relationships and delivers customer centric solutions
Ability to handle multiple projects at the same time and close advanced projects on time with minimal supervision
Operates well under ambiguity and able to effectively maneuver through complex policy, process and people related issues
Must be a good team player - willing and able to assist peers in Global Procurement and able to work in multi-functional, cross-regional teams


Preferred

Legal experience
MBA

#LI-DC1

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Type Full-time

Location IL, Northbrook

Category Finance
