job_description:
Who we are looking for

Rev.com is looking for a Sales Manager to join our growing sales team. This is an opportunity for a proven leader to build and scale a team to drive incredible results. You will be responsible for building and coaching a team, enabling them to sell, and driving new business.

You will also be responsible for articulating the value proposition relevant to the target audience, generating leads and sales opportunities, and closing deals to generate revenue. The ideal candidate will have experience in a high-growth/start-up technology environment. You will report into Rev's Head of Sales


You Will

Drive the team to exceed revenue targets through new client acquisition and install base expansion
Own pipeline for the entire Sales organization and run forecasts
Build and develop a sales team that is successful in identifying, qualifying, developing and closing new business
Build a culture of continued success and goal achievement through talent management, feedback, mentoring and training
Thoroughly understand the ins and outs of the AE team pipeline and accurately forecast bookings
Lead the AE team with a consistent vision of the future
Understand what the data is telling you to diagnose problems within the pipeline and propose solutions on how to solve those problems.
Collaborate with other teams including business development, customer success, marketing, product, finance, and legal to ensure the long-term success of the AE team
Consistently coach AEs to improve their sales skills over time
Successfully onboard and train new AEs as our sales team grows


Qualifications

7+ years of sales experience
3+ years of Sales leadership experience at high-growth B2B SaaS companies
Strong track record of leading AE teams to consistently exceeding sales targets
Team-oriented - Customer acquisition happens through a focused effort from sales, marketing, product, engineering, finance, and legal. We're a highly collaborative organization
Great understanding of contract negotiation and working with procurement, legal, and finance teams
Experience working with SalesForce, Outreach.io, Linkedin Sales Navigator, Zoominfo, and other sales tools


This might not work if

You struggle with ambiguity and change
Don't thrive in complex environments dealing with multiple stakeholders
Data driven decisions are not in your playbook


About Rev

Rev.com is a successful growth-stage startup, headquartered in San Francisco, with a second office in downtown Austin. Founded in 2010 by MIT engineers, Rev has raised millions of dollars in venture capital from top Silicon Valley VCs.

Recently named to America's Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Companies , Rev is shaping the way people work with AI. Rev is a marketplace for remote work with the mission to create 1 million work-from-home jobs by 2025. We currently have a network of 50,000 freelancers (Revvers) around the globe and have well over 150,000+ customers, including companies like Amazon, Google, Airbnb, and more.

Rev's services include audio transcription, video captions, document translations, and automatic speech recognition. Learn more about Rev on our "about us" page and check out our thousands of 5-star reviews.

Strong track record of leading AE teams to consistently exceeding sales targets.  Experience working with SalesForce, Outreach

job_description:
Bachelor’s degree10+ years of public relations experienceTechnology PR experience

Amazon is seeking a creative, self-motivated, high-judgment and well-connected PR professional to drive communications for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning programs across the company. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of AI/ML topics and trends, possesses extensive media relations experience, excellent writing skills, and be adept at translating complex technology concepts into broadly digestible stories. You will also be proactive in the extreme, collaborate well across teams, and exercise consistently high-judgment while moving quickly.

This role will partner with PR colleagues in Amazon Devices, Alexa, Shopping, Robotics and AWS to develop and execute innovative communications strategies that drive awareness of Amazon’s cross-company AI programs. The ideal candidate enjoys diving deep into technology, and is motivated by a dynamic, highly creative culture where the challenge of breaking new ground and redefining best practices is both welcome and encouraged. In this role, the candidate will have an opportunity to innovate new and interesting communications and influencer relations strategies, and support key Amazon events including re:MARS.

There are hundreds of journalists worldwide who are trying to understand and help their readers understand the new paradigm of Artificial Intelligence. To help achieve this, you will:
Define, develop and oversee a PR strategy supporting Amazon’s reputation as a leader in AICollaborate with colleagues to generate, and support the execution of, storytelling opportunities across Amazon businessesBuild/manage relations with strategically important media outlets and industry analystsBuild and manage a cross-company AI Influencer strategySupport AI focused media strategy at re:MARS, and industry events
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. job_description:
Facebook AI’s mission is to advance the state-of-the-art in artificial intelligence through fundamental and applied research in open collaboration with the community. Our work covers the full spectrum of topics related to AI, including deriving knowledge from data: theory, algorithms, applications, software infrastructure and hardware infrastructure. We actively engage with the community through publications, open source software, participation in technical conferences and workshops, and collaborations with academia. Facebook AI researchers and engineers work from our offices around the globe: Menlo Park, CA, New York City, Seattle, WA, Montreal, Canada and Paris, France. Facebook is seeking an experienced Program Manager to develop content, manage rollout of projects, and help drive effective communications and collateral for the Facebook AI organization. This role will partner closely with a large cross-functional team including engineering leadership, product marketing, program management, researchers, and engineers, as well as external partners across organizations in industry and academia. The ideal candidate has experience creating content and build awareness and engagement for a technical product or audience. To be successful, you will be eliminating barriers to your team's success, clearly communicating your work to all stakeholders and ensuring the big picture stays in focus while delving into the details on specific issues. Ideal team members are adaptable and resilient, eager to attack unfamiliar problems with curiosity and tenacity, self-motivated and demonstrate creative and critical thinking capabilities to help the team be more efficient. The right candidate will be a strong communicator, passionate about fundamental research, comfortable with ambiguous environments, can move fast, bring people together, and focus squarely in advancing the science forward.
Program Manager, Facebook AI Responsibilities
Establish and scale collaboration programs, including being the lead on internal organizational content and information
Collaborate cross-functionally and with researchers on the Facebook AI narrative and on strategic thinking with VP and Leadership team
Drive the development of simple tools and processes to provide ongoing tracking of progress & key milestones
Provide coordination support and improve collaboration among scientists working on similar areas
Increase awareness of research progress internally across FAIR leaders, AI org and the company at large
Help scientists and engineers with planning, prioritization and risk management
Partner on building on-boarding programs and messaging that help new scientists & engineers ramp up quickly on Facebook AI & Facebook tools, systems & processes
Partner with research and engineering leaders to organize key workshops & events
Proactively identify technical, legal, procedural, logistical, and communication issues and drive creative solutions to fix them and manage risk
Drive internal process improvements, remove gaps, coordinate multiple parties and alleviate bottlenecks
Ability to map dependencies and relationships between research and teams
Establish strong working relations with all partners with an emphasis on unblocking team members when they are stuck and managing cross-functional engagements
Minimum Qualifications
Proven track record of building and scaling programs
Experience in communication and messaging to a large organization
Experience working directly with technical scientists, engineers, and management
Communication, coordination, organizational and multitasking experience
Interpersonal experience, including relationship building, and collaboration with a cross-functional, global team
Experience operating autonomously across multiple teams, demonstrated critical thinking, and thought leadership
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in AI/ML programs or teams
Experience working with students and interns, and general understanding of key AI research conferences and forums
Experience delivering tech programs or products from inception to delivery
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Qualifications:
Put your engineering talent to the ultimate test. At our client, we create the technologies, products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. The work we do is so advanced our teams often redefine what’s possible for the world. If you want to be a leader with the company that delivers smart solutions for our nation’s challenges, this is your opportunity.

We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.

As a seasoned leader, you’ll be involved with our client's decision-making process by serving as a front-line interface to users with technical issues and conducting systems analysis and development to keep systems current with changing technologies. Your duties may include installing new software, troubleshooting, granting permissions to applications and training users. You’ll also be responsible for the day-to-day support of server services by performing server administration for physical and virtual server operating systems and configuring, maintaining and troubleshooting of physical and virtual hardware and network related interfaces on servers. We’ll rely on you to perform, maintain, troubleshoot and conduct a complete analysis of alerts; create scripts to automate repetitive processes; and work with customers to identify, isolate, and resolve problems with servers that are affecting other services.

What you’ll experience:

Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered

What you bring to the table:

A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus 6 years of relevant experience
Advanced understanding of server based operating systems
Linux including RHEL/CentOS, specifically secure environments. Virtualized and bare metal.
Microsoft Windows 10 desktop and Microsoft Windows 2008/2012
Infrastructure aspects of Linux related to authentication, policy, scanning, logging, storage.
Networking. Mainly Cisco, Taclanes, WANs,
Subject matter expert (SME) with the ability to mentor others on administrating the server environment
Enhanced troubleshooting skills within the server OS as well as both networking and storage technologies
Hands-on experience developing, deploying and supporting large-scale enterprise server solutions

What sets you apart:

Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Broad understanding of the interrelationships within the IT environment with focus on server and services
Senior level knowledge of physical and virtual server support
Senior level knowledge of access, permissions and security that gives the clients the access to the data they need to perform their daily activities

job_description:
Who Are We?
QinetiQ Inc. is an innovative C5ISR Systems and Technology leader. Our company is built on a foundation of advanced technology, systems engineering, rapid prototyping, and improved operational sensing. We work with the latest technological developments in government, industry, and academia, leveraging that knowledge to rapidly advance the state of the art, combining cutting edge sensor technology with innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).
We are a world-class team of professionals that build Ground Systems, Solider Systems, Airborne Sensing and Processing Technologies and Integrated C2 solutions. Our customers are always our number one priority and our mission is to empower and protect American Warfighters and Security Forces!

Your Contribution to Our Mission:.
Plans, develops, organizes, coordinates, implements and evaluates projects in support of programs for areas engaged in diverse operations and functions and serves as an advisor on all aspects of the assigned program areas.
Compiles new information, considers data from a variety of sources, and follows standard approaches, methods, and procedures to plan and carry out assignments.
Reviews, conducts and evaluates routine sampling, surveys, inventories, data and findings.
Monitors operations to identify and rectify problems.
Evaluates adequacy of controls and corrective measures.
For meetings, proposes agenda topics, tracks resulting action items, assists development of presentations, and ensures complete coordination.
Reviews and prepares portions of plans, forms, procedures, reports and related documents.
Coordinates issues pertaining to project compliance, schedule, and corrective actions. Assists in developing and conducting various training.
Performs data collection and assists in compilation of technical and programmatic data from a variety of sources.
Conducts analysis, integration, categorization, and summarization of technical and funding data on programs and develops briefings, information papers, and reports that explain and support routine programs, initiatives, solutions and investments.
Evaluates, selects, adapts and modifies standard techniques and criteria.
Ensure test plans will meet the evaluation needs and address measures of evaluation and performance.
Ensures adequate incorporation of safety, fire protection, human factors, and design factors affecting occupational health provisions in accordance with existing standards, regulations, laws, and other sound safety engineering principles and practices.


To Land This Job, You Need:
5 years of experience gained within the past 10 years (2010 to present) in evaluation sciences in any of the following: Analytical techniques such as predictive analytics and risk analytics; natural language processing, machine learning, and artificial intelligence; data requirements analysis, data modeling, data cleaning, and database structures; data mining and visualization; conceptual modeling; and statistical analysis techniques
Demonstrated experience in use and application of one or more of the following programming languages common in data science: Python, ProgR, Java, SQL, and/or No-SQL)
Demonstrated experience in use and application of one or more of the following math packages common in data science: MATLAB, JMP, and/or SAS.
Master’s degree in a relevant field and 3 years field experience in human factors engineering or testing of major military systems.
Shall include experience in Manpower Personnel Training (MPT) and/or the use of human development or testing military systems which would include experience in the use of human factors instrumentation.
Clearance Level Must Currently Possess:
DOD Secret

Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces.
Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.
Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement.
We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry.
We have fun! We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments.

job_description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what you make it!
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
Are you ready to help us make the future?
Lead Enterprise Automation strategy and assure effective delivery of sustained technology development for Automation across Honeywell. You will be the primary interface to business and domain leaders to define automation roadmap, requirements and drive development execution enabled through existing and emerging tools. You will be a key member of the IT Application Quote to Cash leadership team, engaging in all aspects of running the IT, with a specialization in the use of technology to fulfill business objectives. You will provide leadership in improving IT process and developing IT team capabilities.
Key Responsibilities:
 Develop IT strategy and vision around technology and development
 Provide Automation Architecture and Development Services
 Deliver Automation and Cognitive Services in areas of Process, BOTs, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
 Drive new ideas beyond traditional automation mindset and work across team to get them executed, like OCR, Integration, EDI, etc.
 Align with overall Architecture and Standards Services
 Educate business on technology around automation
 Manage IT professionals
YOU MUST HAVE:
 Bachelor's degree
WE VALUE:
 Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
 Leadership experience in two or more Information Technology, Engineering or Business functional areas
 Excellent leadership communication and executive presence
 Understanding of key information technology solutions and practices
 Strong business acumen and ability to translate new technology into business value
 Creation of result-oriented Management Operating System
 Effectively demonstrates ability to deliver on complex situations or problems
 Creative and collaborative problem-solving capability
 Conveys specific, observable, and measurable expectations for each assignment
 Driving "fast and right" results in a matrixed environment
 Consistently makes timely decisions even in the face of complexity
Additional Information
JOB ID: HRD96023
Category: Information Technology
Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States
Exempt
Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

job_description:
We are looking for a senior product manager to define and own the product vision and roadmap for our Analyse, Secure and Transport products within the United Kingdom (UK). Products that extract insights, protect and dynamically share our critical customer data. As a senior product manager at Rebellion, you will be responsible for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion design and engineering teams to deliver on the vision you’ve charted. You will work with Rebellion’s customers and prospective customers, senior UK Ministry of Defence (MOD) civilian and military leadership, the UK Intelligence Community and the United States (US) Department of Defence (DoD) to understand the core customer needs and to bring a product to market.

This position is located in London, and involves some travel within the UK and internationally. An ability to hold a UK national security clearance is preferred, but not required.
We are looking for a track record that will include the following:
Delivering software-as-a-service products that scale to large enterprises or consumer bases,
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end userBalancing customer needs with engineering constraints,
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the businessDefining and exceeding success metrics with the products you buildInspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority,
Working with users and shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design),
Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field,
Communicating effectively across diverse technical and non-technical audiences, internally and externally,
Establishing clear product-market fit, understanding the core customer need, and breaking this into priorities for design and engineering teamsExperience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred),
At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design.
You might be a good fit if you:
Have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the UK, the US and its allies from adversaries,
Are self-directed and can prioritise experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer,
Are capable of rapid iteration and comfortable with ambiguity in initial problem definition.
As the senior product manager in the UK, your work will drive our strategic product and technology vision across each of our product areas. You will own the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior product manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. At Rebellion we believe in operating what we own, we deliver all of our products as managed services, this allows our product teams to maintain operational ownership across all deployments. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Compensation includes meaningful equity ownership, competitive salaries, full medical coverage, disability and life insurance, and transit reimbursement.

Experience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred),.  At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design.  Are self-directed and can prioritise experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer,

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in systems engineering, a related specialized area or field is required (or equivalent experience) plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience. Agile experience preferred.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
Developing mission-critical systems that help keep people safe is what we do. At General Dynamics Mission Systems, you’ll be part of the team that helps heroes make a true impact. The work we do is important. The challenges we face are career-defining. The opportunity we can offer is one-of-a-kind.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar space and everything in between.

As a X-Lab Systems Engineer/Analyst Lead, you’ll lead model and simulation activities as you participate in requirements analysis and management, functional analysis, performance analysis, system design, trade studies, systems integration and test (verification). It’s your chance to step up to the challenge and prove you’re ready to lead the world.
The Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications Experimentation Laboratory (C2BMC X-Lab) is a very fast paced and dynamic environment. The X-Lab is responsible for developing and integrating future-capability prototypes for the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS) including Sensor/Weapon Integration, Algorithm Development, User Interface Development and other critical leading-edge missile defense technologies. The X-Lab has a need to augment the team with a senior systems engineer and analysis lead that holds at least a Secret clearance with a TS/SCI being preferable and possesses demonstrable skills in the following areas:

Analysis tool development using MATLAB, Excel, S-Code, Satellite Toolkit (STK), etc.
Perform verification and validation of systems (functional and performance)
Full cycle systems engineering of new capabilities
System and subsystem decomposition
Use case, system requirements, performance specification development, and UML modeling
System interface design & Interface Control Document development
Conducting and participating in peer reviews
Good communication skills (written and oral)
Leadership of a team composed of multiple disciplines
This position will focus on and lead the analysis of R&D systems in C2BMC and will contribute to other ongoing X-Lab projects as needed. Including the assessment on how the C2BMC prototype system performs by identifying high level objectives and refining into an integrated set of metrics, analysis tool development, assessment of experimental data, generating and presenting customer-quality products containing analytical observations. The Lead Analyst will apply these results to identify and work to enhance C2BMC for future operations. The Lead Analyst must possess expertise in a technical discipline related to systems engineering, analysis, or missile defense. The Lead Analyst should be comfortable with rapidly changing requirements, design challenges that require novel solutions, fast-paced activities, and tight deadlines.

The Lead Analyst must have [12+] years of experience leading or contributing to an integrated team environment with other systems, software, and specialty engineers to develop solutions that includes a background in all aspects of the analysis life cycle. The Lead Analyst should have experience with identification of analysis objectives, metric generation, data assessment, and presentation of the results. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to analyze high level customer needs and defined a structured and logical approach to refine the objectives and analysis requirements. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to communicate effectively, developed and scripted analysis tools, clearly present technical approaches and findings, and have experience in writing and implementing analysis plans within a project. Ideally, the Lead Analyst will have experience in working on IRAD-type projects.

Position Responsibilities:
Perform as individual contributor and Analyst Lead for advanced concepts development projects. This includes directing the activities of junior level engineers. Contribute in full lifecycle development of advanced concepts. Position is responsible for performing the evaluation of advanced missile defense command and control capabilities to provide highly innovative and ingenious solutions to complex technical problems. Including defining and
coordinating analysis objectives and metrics for various experimental prototypes, performing the associated analysis, and serve as the X-Lab spokesperson on advanced projects when briefing results to the customer. Actions are critical to achieving X-Lab organizational objectives and directly affect the impact of X-Lab technological capability. Assignments are often self-initiated with consultation and agreement of X-Lab leadership. The Lead Analyst will provide oversight of maintenance and improvements to the analysis tool suite. Support advanced concept demonstrations during live and simulated MDA test events. Non-standard work hours are highly likely during event execution and a small amount of travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications:
The primary work location is the Missile Defense Integration and Operations Center (MDIOC) located on Schriever AFB, CO. The following knowledge base and/or skills are desired for the Senior Systems Engineer:
Integration practices and methodsTest driven development and continuous integration
Ability to extract data to support analysis
Operating systems experience with Windows & Unix/Linux
Algorithm design and implementation
DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)
Physics & mechanics of powered and ballistic missile flightTheory and application of the BMDS
Theory and application of command and control systems
Theory and application of track correlation algorithms
Probability theory and optimal state estimation
Familiarity with Link-16, including content, transmission rules, etcCoding skills a plus (Java, C++, and shell scripts)
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

job_description:
Sr. Program Manager - Sales
Location: Salt Lake City, UT
The Sr. Program Manager - Sales is responsible for project management, systems administration, data analysis and assisting in creating strategic direction in conjunction with Sales Leadership.

As a Sr. Program Manager - Sales, a Typical Day Might Include the Following:

Project Management:

Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management.
Create and manage project plans
Create cost/benefit analyses in support of Business Unit projects, while providing methods for management to assess the financial impact of a decision to the bottom line.
Work with business to define and document project scope, requirements, timelines, expectations
Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
Identify project priority conflicts and report any issues affecting overall project delivery.
Communicate project status to stake holders and executives.
Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path.
Plan, track and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools.
Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations.
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans.
Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle.
Data Analysis:

Analyze Sales Performance including, but not limited to:
Sales rep performance
territory/book/lead assignments
Commission Analysis
Daily metrics & KPIs
Conversion tracking
Close Rate & Pitch Rate
Deal flow / pipeline performance
Attachment rates
Data Hygiene and Integrity
Industry analysis / segmentation modeling
Customer review, modeling, and dissection
Gather reporting requirements, design and deploy reports that fulfill the requirements as needed for Sales, Marketing and other departments as requests
Systems Administration:

Strategically administer and continuously improve our sales CRM system
Continuously evaluate the most efficient lead assignment processes and work with Sales Development Manager to make any changes to the process
Creat e and distribute analytical reports including ad hoc and custom reports for sales
Collaborate with marketing and the training department on the development of automated sales tools (e.g. ROI calculator)

To Land This Gig You'll Need:

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Financial, or Business Fields
5+ years financial analyst / sales operations experience. (eg SPSS)
5+ Years project leadership and cross functional experience
Strong mathmatical skills
In depth familiarity with Excel
Problem solving abilities
Ability to meet deadlines
Quantitative and statistical analysis skills
Strategic Thinker and Consensus Builder
Ability to interact well with technical and non-technical people and serve as a bridge to translate complex requirements and concepts
Experience working with and influencing cross-functional teams without formal authority
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects in a changing and fast paced environment
Excellent facilitation, interviewing, and presentation skills
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Bonus Experience:

Strong technical background with experience in communications, telephony, hosted-solutions, or contact center related fields
Software Development Experience
Salesforce Administration and Development Experience
Database administration experience

NICE inContact provides the world’s #1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

job_description:
Sr. District Sales Manager
Location: Philadelphia, PA; Baltimore, MD; Richmond, VA
The Sr. District Sales Manager is responsible for seeking and maintaining relationships with inContact Sales Partners and identifying sales opportunities and building market share in their regions. This position is required to increase revenue streams in small business, commercial, government, and contact centers.


As a Sr. District Sales Manager, a Typical Day Might Include the following:

Meets and exceeds assigned sales quota.
Build and maintain relationships with potential and current customers and sales partners.
Assist and support Sales partners in sales effort by participating in sales calls and closing efforts.
Maintain product knowledge by attending weekly trainings.
Attends tradeshows.
Travels as needed to maximize growth and revenue, while adhering to all inContact travel policies and requirements.
If remote from inContact headquarters, maintains appropriate home office within inContact allowances.
Makes in person sales calls
Interacts with all levels of organization. Makes presentations as necessary to same.
Build trust and rapport with current and potential customers.
Regularly closes deals and builds future pipeline within or exceeding goals.
Completes all inContact paperwork timely - expense reports, sales call logs, etc.
Regularly keeps direct supervisor apprised of issues and potential sales.
Travel required 50%.

To Land This Gig You'll Need:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Information Systems, Marketing, Communications or similar field or equivalent work experience required.
15 + years sales experience
Previous experience selling multimillion-dollar software deals
Previous experience in telecom, call center, software or hardware industries
Highly professional demeanor - presence, voice
Demonstrated high level competency in written and verbal communications
Demonstrated success working with little to no direct daily supervision in a home office setting

Bonus Experience:

Sales Engineering experience
Telecomm sales experience
SaaS experience

NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

job_description:
It is an exciting time to be building experiences and devices at Microsoft. There is no organization in the world that is better positioned to fundamentally change the way that people live and work. The future of productivity is collaborative, intelligent, and embedded in the world around us. Help shape the rapidly evolving productivity landscape by conducting the research needed to create next-generation intelligent systems and drive the company’s collective bold ambitions for productivity forward.

As a member of the Experiences and Devices Office of Applied Research, your core mission will be to deliver research that fundamentally impacts Microsoft’s products and services. You will also contribute to the scientific community and beyond through presentations, publications, and other outlets (e.g., blogs, press interviews). We are looking for candidates who are smart and creative, as well as self-driven, curious, and comfortable with ambiguity. The successful applicant will collaborate closely with people across Microsoft’s product teams and Microsoft Research, and have the opportunities see their ideas realized in products and services that are used worldwide.

Responsibilities

Leading teams of researchers and developers on cross-org projects that help our products push the boundaries of what is technologically possible.
Working with people in a range of roles, including researchers, engineers, designers, and other key product stakeholders. Serving as a bridge between research and product.
Sharing your research with others via a range of means, including publication, to enable others to build on your work and to contribute to the reputation of our products as cutting-edge and science driven. Communicating complex ideas clearly.
Qualifications
We seek applicants from researchers across all areas of machine learning, artificial intelligence, and related fields and a passion for product impact. Examples of current research directions include:

Machine learning and optimization
Deep learning
Reinforcement learning
Natural language processing
Neuro-symbolic systems and reasoning
AI fairness, transparency and ethics
Program synthesis
Machine teaching

Successful candidates will have a PhD and an established research track record as demonstrated by publications at top international research venues and open source software. Scientific leadership as demonstrated by participation on program committees is desirable. Candidates should also have a deep understanding of software system principles and the ability to lead and partner with others to ship developed technology.

Requirements:
Education: PhD in Computer Science or related engineering or science fields required
At least two years of experience in a research leadership position.
Expertise in developing or applying predictive analytics, statistical modeling, data mining, or machine learning, especially at scale
Excellent problem solving and data analysis skills
Effective communication skills, both verbal and written
Strong software design and development skills/experience
Strong collaboration skills, both within-team and cross-team

You should submit a CV and the names of at least three references as required by the online application. You should also upload the two conference or journal articles, book chapters, or equivalent writing samples which best demonstrate your expertise.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Software has revolutionized every industry it has touched. While online learning has taken a strong root over the last two decades, we are at the cusp of the next wave of innovation in the learning space with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. And where better to influence that than in the company known for innovation at a global scale.

Amazon Learning Products and Services team is looking for a Senior Product Manager to join an exciting opportunity to reinvigorate our learning platform. As a senior product manager, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and driving a new customer outreach program for our learning platform. Through this program, you will be contributing to our business growth by bringing in new business partners across the company and its subsidiaries. You will also be responsible for nurturing and measuring the success of these customers and business through a programmatic approach.

On this team, you’ll get to wear many hats, work fast and smart, and iterate quickly. We are looking for someone who is ready to take ownership of a growing business opportunity and join a tightly-knit team tackling interesting challenges. You are innovative, courageous, positive, and are itching to explore your own full potential in creativity, technology, and experiences.

job_title_2: Director of Artificial Intelligence – AI Digital Transformation and Technical Solutions Lead, Manufacturing and Energy, U.S. AI Country Plan
job_description:
Director of Artificial Intelligence – AI Digital Transformation and Technical Solutions Lead, Manufacturing and Energy, U.S. AI Country Plan
Organizations around the world are going through rapid digital transformation. This is especially true in the US, where we see this phenomenon being accelerated by the scale and agility of the Cloud and fueled by the latest innovation in machine learning and artificial intelligence. As they progress through their transformations and examine impacts on employees, partners, customers, and society, new strategies are emerging with socio-environmental factors and sustainability at the center.
 Changes and challenges like these also mean unprecedented opportunities for Microsoft. To capitalize on the opportunities in MSUS, we need a holistic ecosystem approach to ‘make the AI market’ with Microsoft as the indisputable leader. We will work across cities, and states, from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies and leverage coalitions, private and public partnerships, NGOs, industry associations, our partner ecosystem and academic institutions – all for the goal of leveraging AI to enable every person and every organization to achieve more. Do you want to be part an organization that will be a game changer for how we make the AI Market and build upon our mission of Sustainability and investments to support Carbon Negative Pledge by 2030? Do you like to be in an environment of building something new, creating and incubating new opportunities and connecting across the entire MSUS and WW teams? This organization is looking for strategic, passionate and driven individuals who understand AI, the value of ecosystem and the opportunity for collaboration to make new markets.
Desired Leadership, Aspirations and Values:
Customer Obsession: The AI Country Plan team, the Office of the Chief Digital Officer and Microsoft are committed to have a customer first approach. We expect our leader to have a demonstratable history of making a difference for customers and showing a customer first approach.
Growth Mindset: Experience and passion for learning (technical and soft skills); implementing practices from others; trying, failing and learning from that; sharing practices and knowledge for others’ benefit
Collaboration: This lead inspires other for the dedication and commitment to the team objectives. The right person can lead or be part of the team in favor of the greater good of customers and Microsoft.
Problem Solver: Ability to solve complex challenges for customers and have a high ability to solve internal and external barriers understanding internal and external organizational structures, dynamics and tradeoffs.
Intellectual Aspirations: This role will require the director to be on continuous learning. It is expected that this executive will stay current on industries and technologies and be able to solve hard and complex problems on a matrixed organization.
Passion for technology: Microsoft and the Chief Digital Officer’s office, are committed to Technical excellence and technical intensity. We share the passion for driving innovation with our customers and learning new technologies.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities:
Customer Engagements: As the digital transformation Lead for these industries, you will support a small number of accounts, but will be expected to deliver success and provide meaningful solutions that will serve as key future use cases for the industry across the US. This person is expected to be able to identify key C-level needs from the customers, define a strategy and deliver a proposal that is accepted and agreed by the customer. This leader will lead directly a few accounts, but will be expected to define and consult on AI Digital transformation to other prioritizes accounts across the U.S.
Technical Leadership and Engagements: The director is expected to be well versed on AI and overall cloud solutions and architectures. The lead has to be able to independently work with the customer’s technical teams as well as have technical conversations with the technical leadership teams at the CIO\CTO Level. The executive will partner with the National Cloud Solutions Architects, AI Engineering, Digital Advisors, Partners and ISV’s, and Account teams to ensure that an AI technical solution is properly designed and adopted by customers. This leader will be seen as the technical go to person for the AI country plan in the U.S.
AI Partner Ecosystem: The lead is expected to be well versed on the AI partners ecosystem. This includes key Systems Integrators, Independent Software vendors, Startups. The Director will ensure that the partner ecosystems is part of the solutions and partner with our partners teams (OCP), on partner readiness and ensure the key partners are prioritized for AI programs
Industry Leadership: From an industry perspective this role will focus directly on Manufacturing and Energy and partner with one other industry lead. The two leaders will collaborate with key industry sales teams, associations, customers, influencers and regulators to ensure to remove blockers and drive innovation.
Qualifications
Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications:
Digital Transformation: 5+ Years of experience and an extensive track record of large deal closing and experience selling platform and enterprise solutions to large/global enterprise customers with a focus on Data & Analytics platform technologies presented to the CTO\CIO or equivalent executives.
Consultative Technical Selling: 3+ Years of validated experience in consultative technical selling approach, including bringing innovative ideas to customers problems and being customer focused.
Additional Qualifications:
Executive Presence: Experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the value of the solution to the customer’s overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria. Experience in influencing Senior Leadership teams to drive strategy and investments. required
Collaborative: Strong relationship-building and negotiation skills. required
Excellent Communicator: Able to distill widely variant feedback into root cause issues and provide actionable feedback to other stakeholders, deep technical product demo, presenting, writing, and verbal communication skills required.
Performer: Highly driven passionate person, consistently exceeds goals with a demonstrated track record of exceeding goals. required
Data Platform modernization and migration, and Analytics is preferred.
AI Solutions: High-level expertise in sophisticated cloud solutions that include knowledge mining, Machine Learning, Cognitive services and understanding of identity, authentication, security, privacy, and compliance requirements, and experience integrating them into cloud and hybrid solutions
Technical breadth: Enterprise customer level experience with Cloud technologies, Artificial Intelligence, Data Landscape, Architecture Designs, Open Source Technologies, Industry Standards and demonstrated ability to integrate new technologies on prem as well as on the cloud.
Market insights: Understanding of Artificial Intelligence solutions from competitors (AWS, GCP, others) as well as Architect Artificial Intelligence based applications, startups and partner ecosystem.
Industry Builder: Understand capabilities of, strategically be able to work with, influence cohesively, build and grow, Microsoft (or similar) customers, members of the Microsoft (or similar) sales, services, and marketing organizations, internal and external communities and Microsoft (or similar) partners, thinktanks and associations.
Strategy: Experience developing strategies, execution plans and reporting to achieve business goals through multiple channels and competing to take market share.
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree, MBA and Masters in Technical fields or relevant job experience all accepted
Certifications: Azure Fundamentals, Data Engineer or Azure AI Engineer preferred
Additional trainings, technical or sales certifications and education in Enterprise Architecture valued
Travel: 25 to 50% in U.S. Based Territories
Preferred location: Redmond, WA
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

job_description:
The NC State College of Education leads the way in North Carolina in preparing professionals, conducting research, and engaging communities to improve educational outcomes for all learners across the state and beyond. With two-thirds of its faculty grant active and over 120 funded research projects totaling over $90-plus million, the college ranks No. 1 in education research productivity in North Carolina and among the Top 6 percent of colleges of education in the nation. During the 2018-2019 fiscal year, the faculty had half of their proposals funded and brought in over $30 million in new funded research. They address society’s most pressing educational challenges and convert their research to action and innovative solutions that transform teaching and learning environments across the lifespan, with particular strengths in improving technology-enhanced learning and teaching in STEM education and literacy; increasing diversity, equity and access in education; and innovating leadership development.

The college is composed of three academic departments: Educational Leadership, Policy, and Human Development; Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Education; and Teacher Education and Learning Sciences, with approximately 124 faculty members and 92 support and professional staff. The college’s 1,700 undergraduate and graduate students study across 60-plus degree programs that deliver highly-engaged and personalized academic experiences that prepare them to lead in the field of education. The college is also home to the Friday Institute for Educational Innovation and the proposed Belk Center for Community College Leadership and Research.

The Department of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Education emphasizes exemplary teaching, scholarship, and service in the context of a university education. With a primary emphasis on improving schools and society, the Department prepares quality educators for middle, secondary, and post-secondary school science, technology, engineering, mathematics, graphic communications, and informal settings. In addition, the Department offers a Graphic Communication Concentration (non-teaching) and several minors, including Technology, Engineering, and Education licensure track and a Technical Graphic Communications track for industry. The Department also has programs preparing professionals for leadership at the master’s and doctoral levels.

The Artificial Intelligence Academy (AIA) program will prepare participants for AI careers that are in high demand nationwide. It will include two levels of training and associated certifications: Basic AI (artificial intelligence and data mining focus) and Advanced AI (machine learning and analytics focus). Apprentices can complete the entire program in forty weeks. Industry partners will pay apprentices for at least part-time work during the program and will also cover apprentice tuition and fees for the AI credential program. Companies will benefit from additional workers in their organizations and will have the option to hire the apprentice upon completion of the program.

The project will include partners from a variety of sectors. Industry partners include IBM, CISCO, Citrix, Pentair, Hazardous Software, Diveplane, Randstad Technologies, Battelle Memorial Institute and MCNC. Educational partners include N.C. Community Colleges/Apprenticeship NC, Purdue Global, MACUL and Metriks Amerique. Veterans and other recruitment-related affiliated agencies involved in the project include FASTPORT, VetsinTech, Warrior Maven, Paradigm Shift, Monster Jobs, Dice, Industrial Internet Consortium, Crosby Communications and Clearance Jobs. The NC Chamber will serve as a workforce development partner on the project.

Essential Job Duties
This position is grant funded and therefore contingent upon the availability of funding with a proposed start date of July 1, 2020.

The Director will serve as the operational leader for the A.I. Academy (AIA) apprenticeship program. The Director will assist the Executive Director in providing overall oversight for the entire operation of the AIA, including supervising the Program Coordinator and other central AIA full-time staff (e.g. Instructional Designer, Videographer, Technical Staff/Programmer, Data Coordinator, Assistant Instructors, Teaching Assistants, and others TBD).

The Director will lead project management which will include supporting thousands of fully online adult learners through providing training for Instructors, Assistant Instructors, and Teaching Assistants, and continuously monitoring student success and making adjustments to programming as necessary.

The Director will develop procedures and processes to attain high levels of retention, program operation, and student support, including ensuring alignment of the program with industry partner needs. The Director will lead required quarterly reporting to the DOL on the AIA program in consultation with the Executive Director. The Director will work with the Executive Director on strategic direction for the AIA program and development of a sustainability plan for continuing the program after DOL funding has ended.

This work will include, but is not limited to:
Oversight for AIA Basic and Advanced program operation including project management.Supervision of five-fifteen central AIA full-time staff.Strategic planning work with the Executive Director for the AIA.Development of AIA program operational procedures and processes.
Development of apprentice retention plans and other student support mechanisms.Tracking of and decision-making regarding AIA program financials with the Executive Director.
Oversight for AIA program data tracking.Leadership of required quarterly reporting to the DOL on the AIA program.Communicating with AIA partners and leading periodic small group calls and large group meetings as necessary.
Other duties as assigned.

Other Work/Responsibilities

Minimum Education/Experience
PhD or EdD in Curriculum & Instruction or similar education field.

At least 5 years of experience managing academic programs (academic affairs).

At least 2 years of experience managing or administering online/distance learning programs.

Departmental Required Skills
Experience with managing enrollment and financial aspects of academic programs.

Excellent organizational and communication skills, willingness to take initiative, and ability to work with a team toward a common goal.

Excellent time-management skills and ability to meet deadlines.

Ability to present at state and/or national conferences about industry partners, community colleges, etc.

Must be meticulous, self-directed, conscientious, a good listener, and a quick learner.

Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education
Demonstrated organizational, supervisory, data management, and budget management ability, including demonstrated success in planning and managing budgets

Evidence of sound financial management and responsibility for operating budgets

Understanding of research, assessment, and evaluation strategies

Strong organizational, presentation, and writing skills

Proven ability to effectively communicate with varied audiences, specifically including industry partners, community colleges, etc.

Ability to develop and sustain a work environment that fosters continuous growth and great working relationships

Required License or Certification
N/A

Special Instructions
In addition to your application please submit a curriculum vitae/resume, a cover letter, and contact information for three professional references.

Job Open Date 06/10/2020

Anticipated Closing Date 06/24/2020

Is this position partially or fully funded on ARRA stimulus monies? No

Proposed Hire Date 07/01/2020

AA/EOE

Degree(s) must be obtained prior to start date in order to meet qualifications and receive credit.

Experience, Skills, Training/Education.  Evidence of sound financial management and responsibility for operating budgets.  Strong organizational, presentation, and writing skills.  Proven ability to effectively communicate with varied audiences, specifically including industry partners, community colleges, etc.  Ability to develop and sustain a work environment that fosters continuous growth and great working relationships

job_description:
Our goal at Pittsburgh AI Works is to “Elevate the human experience through the use of innovative artificial intelligence”. To achieve our goal, we are seeking an individual to fill the Role of Chief Data Scientist (CDS). A strong background in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning is a necessity for this position and for that reason, an emphasis in the following is required:

Consultative Business Process experience
Artificial Intelligence successful deployments
Machine Learning adoption in the Enterprise
Cognitive Computing knowledge
The CDS Candidate shall work closely with the AI Innovations delivery team to develop innovative data science related solutions. Candidate shall possess a career spanning corporate and/or consulting environments You will assist team members in developing and delivering AI/ML offerings and their associated delivery processes from ideation through implementation. Candidate shall be experienced in all facets of strategy, solution design, product development and business growth through innovation.

Position Responsibilities

Serve as a subject matter expert on all data science disciplines.
Provide thought leadership on topics and trends of emerging technology.
Create robust innovative capabilities and solutions in this technical domain.
Serve as the data science expert for teams across the organization to help teams make the best data informed decisions.\
Advising on best practices for collecting data, and advising on statistical and machine learning models to use.
Be a data science consultant and lead ideation.
Research and brainstorming activities in bringing forth original thoughts and ideas for big, bold innovations as well as inter-sectional ideas that draw on multiple disciplines and fields to create unique and new innovations.
Speaker and data science evangelist for the business by presenting at industry events, conferences, and talking to clients.
This senior role exercises your technical eminence, management knowledge and experience with complex solution development.
Implementation and consulting in the pursuit of starting a world class AI solutions service.

Job Functions

Work with senior leadership to develop an overall strategic vision and direction for our AI Innovation team
Oversee all data science-related innovation efforts
Work as a senior member of our solution development team in pursuit of the development and delivery of differentiating solutions based on our core expertise.
Define & deliver on building blocks related to data science (AI/ML) capabilities
Assess / deliver on talent needs for data science (AI/ML) success
Play a key role in deciding technologies and related roadmap for development, testing, and deployment of AI/ML models
Think strategically and apply that through to innovative solutions

Job Requirements

Master’s or PhD degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or related discipline with 20+ years of relevant industry experience
5+ years of multiple leadership experiences in leading data science (artificial intelligence and machine learning) teams on a variety of business impacting areas that enabled innovation and business outcomes.
Expert in data analytic/statistical/mathematical methodologies.
Proven business experience (10+ years) with data science (AI/ML) tools, including expert level skills in SPSS Modeler, SAS Enterprise Miner, or similar tools.
Outstanding critical thinking skills and ability to understand and communicate complex technical concepts to mixed and non-technical audiences.
Outstanding communication skills (i.e., verbal, written, messaging and storytelling skillsets).

Additional Skills

Outstanding stakeholder management, negotiation, and influencing skills
Able to exercise good judgment by making timely and effective, well-informed decisions
Ability to work independently and thrive under ambiguous circumstances
Ability to work under deadlines and with multiple competing priorities
Adaptable and flexible: Ability to adapt to changing work environments, work priorities and organizational needs
Demonstrated willingness to aggressively learn new things
Strong collaboration skills, clear team player, enthusiastic, and can-do attitude
Detail oriented

We offer a full compensation and benefits structure. Join the team that is the Preferred Technology Provider for the Pittsburgh Steelers, and winner of numerous Customer Satisfaction and Top Work Place awards.

Please note, this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities, and schedule may change at any time with or without notice.

Pittsburgh AI Works, a division of Dagostino Electronic Services, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify and/or expression, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reasons prohibited by law.

job_description:
Udacity's mission is to power careers through tech education. Our immersive online learning platform offers practitioner-level training in fields such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Autonomous Systems, Cloud Computing and more. Backed by well-known investors such as Andreessen Horowitz, Charles River Ventures, Bertelsmann and Drive Capital, Udacity is transforming the world by providing life-long learners the opportunity to upskill in bleeding edge career fields. We also partner with leading enterprises to support them on their journey of digital transformation for their workforces. If you are inspired to be part of something amazing…read on!

Udacity is looking for an experienced marketing leader to oversee its brand strategy and marketing efforts. This person will lead the brand marketing, content marketing, product marketing, and PR teams - in order to clearly articulate the company's mission and unique standing in the online learning industry. As the company ramps aggressive growth and expands into new markets, the Director of Brand and Product Marketing will focus on defining our overall brand identity and messaging across all of its business units. This position will report to the Chief Marketing Officer.

Responsibilities:

Develop, lead and manage The company's brand marketing strategy across all of the core lines of business.

Demonstrate thought leadership crucial to accelerating growth of our brands and products, delivering clear insights and action plans to improve program performance.
Drive market, product and customer segmentation and industry analysis; define the customer journey and build contact strategies;
Develop, test and refine benefits, product positioning and messaging.
Conduct research and leverage findings to build actionable recommendations with regards to messaging and customer segmentation.
Be the expert on use cases, expectations and the competition across the portfolio. Develop strategies and manage programs that drive demand for all of The company.
Analyze customer data and feedback and external research to help better inform campaigns that meet the company's awareness and revenue goals.
Create the go-to-market plan for product launches.

Develop and lead marketing campaigns

Oversee all earned marketing efforts, including but not limited to PR, content marketing, and events, to establish the company as the thought leader in online education.
Partner with creative and growth marketing teams to drive creative campaigns that work across social, digital, and traditional channels.
Define and regularly measure KPIs that track progress against key brand initiatives.
Manage the campaign calendar - across all of The company's course launches, expansions, promotions, campaigns, events and product launches. As such, the position will serve as a key nerve center and traffic manager for the company - managing execution and message continuity across multiple teams.
Develop a content marketing strategy and program that produces unique case studies, customer success stories, and thought leadership whitepapers across both the B2C and B2B landscape.

Implement collaborative brand strategy initiatives across the company.

Partner with analytics team on research and reporting initiatives to inform and optimize marketing plans, program execution, executive decisions and priorities.
Help the Product and Business Development teams to manage the operational components of strategic partner campaigns, identifying and driving business growth opportunities.
Work closely with consumer growth, enterprise marketing, and enterprise sales team to develop compelling messaging for each customer segment.
What we value:
A brand marketing leader who has a strong understanding of analytics, brand strategy, and research trends, but who can also think outside of the traditional advertising box and shepherd groundbreaking creative campaigns to market.
7+ years' experience in a senior brand marketing role with fast-paced brand. At least five years of that experience should be working in-house (i.e. not in an agency).
Demonstrated ability in ideating, creating and implementing large-scale and unique creative brand campaigns. Experience with collecting market data and other external information to deliver a structured and actionable marketing strategy.
The role requires sound judgment, the ability to multi-task and to work collaboratively with a number of diverse departmental requests and needs – while protecting and leveraging the equity of The company's brand.
The right candidate is a self-starter who is comfortable with a high-level of responsibility across the organization, and who can own a wide-range of issues and projects within a dynamic, rapidly growing company.
The ideal candidate is a collaborative and curious individual, who enjoys working across departments to develop interesting narratives and campaigns for external/internal audiences.
Pluses:
Experience doing so within limited budgets and tight timelines.
Previous strategy or brand strategy experience in management consulting or CPG firms.

Udacity is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We believe that the unique contributions of all Udacians is the driver of our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Udacity's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy

job_description:
Litify is seeking a Head of Customer Success to lead our entire Customer Success group. This is an exciting leadership role at a rapidly growing company. The role allows for creativity and independence in developing customer success programs and building Litify's success brand.

You will:

Monitor and manage a portfolio of client accounts to drive adoption, desired outcomes, and ultimately ensure retention and contract renewal
Guide your team in managing their clients throughout their lifecycle
z
Act as an escalation point to drive resolution in a timely, proactive manner
Identify at-risk renewals and deliver on customer remediation plans
Monitor customer health to track usage and customer satisfaction
Fully understand client requests, documenting and engaging appropriate resources
Identify opportunities for documenting case studies on success stories to pass along to our Marketing team
Maintain high levels of customer engagement and satisfaction with a focus on customer loyalty to foster long-term relationships

You have:

Bachelor's degree
Experience in Customer Success ideally with a SaaS product (or similarly complex product)
Experience with Salesforce and demonstrated technical aptitude with Salesforce
Experience in direct customer-facing positions
Excellent written, verbal, and oral communication with experience making presentations to major stakeholder
Occasional travel to client site


Why Litify?

Litify is led by an experienced executive team, including one of the world's most influential and successful lawyers, well-known VC's, and software visionaries. Litify will transform law firms into high performing businesses and will radically improve how legal services are delivered - connecting the firm and the client with newer more efficient apps. Litify will use artificial intelligence to predict the outcome of legal matters, changing the economy of law. Litify.com will become a household consumer name for getting legal assistance and make legal advice dramatically more accessible to the people.

Litify is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
