Will be expected to have knowledge and experience leading large global teams, provide thought leadership, possess IT and workplace services expertise, customer experience management skills, and a mindset to continuously drive improvements in cost efficiencies and process improvement. job_description:
Who is Dynam.AI?
Dynam.AI provides businesses across the globe with platform-enabled AI solutions built to up-level any organization in any industry. Our suite of end-to-end artificial intelligence solutions, including advanced deep learning and computer vision algorithms and models, are easy to use and are custom-tailored to each client's needs. We speed time to delivery, save costs, and reduce risk, providing customers an immediate competitive advantage and a bigger bottom line. As a portfolio company of the premier AI-centric venture studio group, Analytic Ventures, Dynam.AI works closely with other companies in our ecosystem in a fast-paced, innovative, and collaborative environment. Employees get ownership in Dynam.AI through a generous stock option plan.
Who We Are Looking For:
The CEO who will lead Dynam.AI to its next phase will display strong industry knowledge of data science and machine learning. Also, you will bring hands-on operational experience with data scientists & software engineers; plus commercial product development & release background. You will have experience in a data science consulting environment with the ability to manage client expectations and ensure the timely delivery of work products.
We Are Looking to Hire People Who Are:
Self-starters, driven to learn and excel
Creative with a purpose
Solution minded, positively charged
Team players with high emotional intelligence
Startup minded, able to find opportunities in the face of uncertainty and change
Drawn to challenges, with dogged tenacity to overcome obstacles
Effective communicators, able to clearly explain key concepts to diverse audiences
Additional personal and professional attributes include:
10+ year's experience building complex, commercial technology organizations on both product and service organizations
Proven ability to build, lead and manage software engineering & data science teams
Proven ability take an organization through fundraising activities
Passion for seeking product opportunities in a customer-focused environment
Experience building and leading relationships with key customers
Experience and passion for driving the sales process and creating new opportunities
Experience in developing and implementing strategic partnerships
Knowledge of machine learning and AI, and the ability to speak on it
Experience in startups, rapid prototyping, and innovating in a small, dynamic group, focused on bringing cutting edge technical solutions to solve a diverse set of commercial and business environments
Supervisory Responsibility:
Manages and directs the company toward its primary goals and objectives.
Oversees the ongoing operations of all divisions in the company via its management team.
Oversees employment decisions at the executive level of the company.
Direct supervision of the business development team.
Duties/Responsibilities:
Serves as the company's representative to the board of directors, shareholders, employees, customers, the government, and the public.
Presents regular reports on the status of the company's operations to the board of directors and company staff.
Source and work with potential investors to raise capital via board approved financing events
Work with the Chief Financial Officer to review the financial results of the operation, comparing them with the company's objectives, and taking appropriate actions to meet and exceed
Work with the Director of Human Resources to adequately scale the organization and build an intentional culture focused on inclusion and diversity.
A leading force of acquiring new business for the organization through your network of relationships and event participation.
Nurture and grow the organization's strategic partnerships to create strong bonds with other industry leaders.
Negotiates with other companies regarding actions such as mergers, acquisitions, or joint ventures.
Liaise between marketing and company operations by handling AI/ML thought leadership from a company perspective.
Ensures the company's compliance with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and standards.
Performs other related duties to benefit the mission of the organization.

job_description:
Senior Manager, Business Intelligence (20017321)
Description
THE OPPORTUNITY

The Data and Business Intelligence team is responsible for unlocking the data and insights necessary to support the continued transformation of Chipotle into a modern, digitally enabled company. This role is an integral part of the team s success by owning enterprise reporting and Data Self-Service strategy and delivery to ensure Chipotle has the data and insights needed across the company.
The Business Intelligence Senior Manager is responsible for establishing enterprise BI solutions that deliver diverse reporting and analytic capabilities for all of Chipotle both in our Restaurant Support Centers and in the field operations. He/she brings extreme passion and advocacy to building a culture of data driven decision making through outstanding information delivery solutions. He/she leads business intelligence for Chipotle to ensure enterprise BI solutions are reliable, scalable, flexible, low maintenance and above all provide the key insights to the right people at the right time. We are looking for a leader to drive a team in building out our business intelligence platform, to build and support long term business intelligence strategy. He/she will be responsible for leading a team in all facets of architecture, design and delivery of reporting and data self service solutions. This manager will own the full suite of Business Intelligence reporting solutions within the Microsoft BI stack, including PowerBI Premium, Reporting Services, SSAS (Tabular and MOLAP) with over 10,000 users, while collaborating with the leadership team on the overall architecture and self-service strategy.
WHAT YOU LL DO
Being the advocate of BI and Enterprise Reporting for data driven decision making across Chipotle through strategic leadership and guidance.
Being responsible for the end to end ownership of the business intelligence reporting team, including delivery of high quality data self service and reporting solutions, aligning to the overall BI strategy and Chipotle strategic objectives.
Promoting best development best practices, coaching, mentoring and developing the team members.
Designing and building BI strategies for strong user experience and adoption while providing data and insights to drive key business decisions.
Work closely with the business and Product Manager/Owners to define scope, project plans and schedules across the BI portfolio.
Manage the release process within information delivery across the BI portfolio.
Manage escalations, change controls and risks across all levels and parties.
Drive innovation on development of tools, reporting improvements, automation and creating new insightful ways to present reporting.
Conduct research into current and emerging business intelligence technologies and issues in support of information delivery needs and working cross functionally within the organization to ensure that the right data is collected, processed and enable smarter data driven decisions.
Efficiently managing reporting environments to ensure meeting customer needs and supportability, scalability and stability. Occasional night and weekends may be required.
Contribute as a thought leader in identifying key performance metrics for the company.
Support the team and stakeholders as a Subject Matter Expert in best practices, delivery and the BI Strategy.
Continuous evaluation for opportunity to improve current processes and find efficiencies utilizing industry best practices.
Ensure a high degree of customer satisfaction through implementation, investigation, analysis, training and relationship building efforts.
Clear communication and driving discussions on data, insights, context and implications with the business and technology partners.

WHAT YOU LL BRING TO THE TABLE
Have a Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or related discipline, or an equivalent in education and experience.
Possess extreme passion for using data and visualization to uncover insights and drive business performance.
7+ years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, including data warehousing and BI tools, techniques and technology.
Deep understanding of traditional and cloud based BI infrastructure.
5+ years of experience using BI reporting tools, including creation and automation of enterprise scaled dashboards, reports, scorecards and ad-hoc reporting solutions.
3+ years leading technical business intelligence teams with a strong track record in delivering results in a rapidly changing, fast paced environment.
Experience in managing, designing and delivering large cross functional custom reporting solutions preferably in Power BI Premium.
Experience leading and developing a data driven culture and leading a community of practice.
Deep understanding of reporting and data warehousing concepts, best practices, SDLC and Agile methodologies.
Mentor, coach and conduct weekly 1:1 with direct reports that identify best practices and areas of improvement.
Be a leader in data visualization best practices.
Possess a strong foundation in data analytics, data-mining and SQL, preferably MS SQL/TSQL.
Have experience using an agile methodologies and tracking tools (Rally, Jira etc.)
Demonstrate ownership of outcomes vs. tasks.
Strong commitment to data governance and security.
Attention to detail to ensure the highest level of quality/rigor in solutions.
Strong problem solving skills, logically and systematically.
Have the ability to multi-task in an effective manner and to work successfully in a fast-paced environment
The ability to establish strong relationships and work effectively with BI Leadership, mobile and digital product teams, the enterprise project management office and cross functional teams
Experience in driving organizational change
Restaurant experience a plus.
Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills coupled with solid listening, facilitation, and presentation skill

WHO WE ARE
Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically-cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle had nearly 2,500 restaurants as of December 31, 2018 in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants. With more than 70,000 employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. Steve Ells, founder and executive chairman, first opened Chipotle with a single restaurant in Denver, Colorado in 1993. For more information or to place an order online, visit WWW.CHIPOTLE.COM.

CULTIVATING A BETTER WORLD
Food served fast doesn t have to be a typical fast food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We're changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you'll join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.

Expert in best practices, delivery and the BI Strategy.  Have a Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or related discipline, or an equivalent in education and experience.  7+ years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, including data warehousing and BI tools, techniques and technology.  5+ years of experience using BI reporting tools, including creation and automation of enterprise scaled dashboards, reports, scorecards and ad-hoc reporting solutions. job_description:
Summary
Posted: Jun 19, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200174267
At Apple, we work every day to build products that enrich people’s lives! Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work. Today, our technology and services power advertising in Search Ads in the App Store and Apple News. Our platforms are highly-performant, deployed at scale, and setting new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy!
We are looking for an exceptional hands-on machine learning (ML) senior manager who can thrive in a fast-paced environment. You will develop, implement and deploy to production new advertising algorithms and supporting capabilities. The position also involves developing a keen understanding of the ad network behavior; detecting meaningful data patterns; assuring the integrity and breadth of the data; measuring user, campaign and app performance; and finally analyzing the results of extremely large-scale experiments. In particular, this position focuses on creating recommendations for our advertisers to help them manage their campaigns in order to help them derive the most value from our platform while creating a health and thriving marketplace.
Key Qualifications
You can apply advanced statistical methods and work with large, complex data sets.
You can actively participate in investigations into multiple streams of ads quality data, and draw conclusions from data, recommend actions.
You have experience in some of the following domains: Algorithms, Architecture, Artificial Intelligence, Database Systems, Data Mining, Distributed Systems, Machine Learning, Networking, Statistics, Game Theory, Auction Design, or other experience with rigorous Quantitative Analysis or Systems Software implementation.
You have experience developing in Python or Java.
You are familiar with databases, SQL, and scripting languages.
You have a practical understanding of modern machine learning and its components.
You enjoy working closely with operational teams on deployment, monitoring, and management concerns.
You actively manage performance of the team reporting to you and take responsibility to drive its outcome
Description
You will lead the team that defines, refines, and/or refactors our approaches, designs, and architectures to meet the ad network challenges we must solve. You will lead a team of world-class machine learning engineers hungry to apply leading-edge technologies to deliver extraordinary experiences to our customers. You will play a critical leadership role building products which deliver on Apple's privacy commitments and change the way advertising works with data.
You will have the opportunity to work on a platform with extreme scale requirements. At Ad Platforms, we are constantly developing products to provide amazing user experiences and drive value for publishers and developers. You will have the chance to lead the design and implementations of the engineering solutions that bring cutting edge ad network algorithms into production in heterogeneous environments. You have the chance to apply cutting edge data engineering techniques, platform engineering approaches, and algorithmic solutions.
You will join and contribute to a culture that emphasizes understandability, reliability, resiliency, simplicity, reusability, extensibility, scalability, and productivity. We are one team, nurturing each other’s growth and supporting each other in delivering for our customers and Apple.
Education & Experience
BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Distributed Systems, Software Engineering, or related field; and experience designing, building, maintaining, and extending web-scale production systems.
Experience leading teams that deliver the infrastructure, frameworks, and components that support mission critical ML capabilities.

You have experience developing in Python or Java.  You will lead a team of world-class machine learning engineers hungry to apply leading-edge technologies to deliver extraordinary experiences to our customers.  At Ad Platforms, we are constantly developing products to provide amazing user experiences and drive value for publishers and developers.  Experience. job_title_2: GEF O&M Systems Administrator III - Fort Carson
job_description:
Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. NCI's AI solution, Shai(tm), scales humans with artificial intelligence by empowering the workforce to meet their mission by using best in class AI solutions coupled with our exceptional service offerings. Working with strategic partners, NCI is committed to bringing commercial innovation to missions of national importance. NCI is a mid-tier systems integrator headquartered in Reston, VA, and operates at locations across the globe.

NCI has been designated a 2020 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com
Responsibilities:
NCI: As the GEF O&M Systems Administrator III - Fort Carson you will support the Global Enterprise Fabric (GEF) Operations and Maintenance contract. GEF falls under NETCOM Army Enterprise’s DoDIN operations and services provider, executing full-spectrum cyber operations and attaining information superiority, and achieving an integrated network enterprise across the Joint, Interagency, Intergovernmental, and Multinational (JIIM) domains. NETCOM plans, engineers, installs, integrates, operates, protects, and sustains Army Cyberspace, enabling Mission Command through all phases of unified action operations with all mission partners across the JIIM domains. NETCOM is the single authority assigned to operate, manage, and defend the Army’s “InfoStructure” at the enterprise level and the single authority for any standard, system, architecture, design, or device that impacts the Army Enterprise Infostructure. NCI will support all NETCOM managed Army DoDIN enclaves including NIPR, SIPR, Coalition Network Combined Enterprise Regional Information Exchange System (CENTRIX) –Korea (CX-K), Mobilization and Force Generation Installation (MFGI) Mission Partner Environment (MPE), and tactical network integrations. NCI will provide services defined in the contract, including capability management, project integration, process development, Information Assurance (IA), cybersecurity, configuration management (CM), hardware/software support, as well as support functions such as database policy definition, requirements development and management and technical writing.
GEF O&M Network/Systems Administrator III - Fort Carson

Support the Government’s design, development, implementation, operations and maintenance requirements for GEF, supporting NETCOM-wide business processes, automation requirement, and information technology management requirements in all NETCOM managed Army DoDIN sites.
Design, develop, implement, and maintain automation, workflows, documentation, and processes based on Government requirements.
Provide and reinforce security of all assigned systems to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the information and business processes.
Support migrations of systems and applications from one hosting site to another. Such migration activities include support for GEF and NETCOM-wide planning, execution, and tracking. Migration activities may include emerging technologies and platforms that may require extensive planning and execution on both Army and DISA managed networks.
Maintenance and administration of Microsoft Enterprise products and tools interrelate in order to ensure NetOps capability integration in support of the classified missions on mission networks such as CENTRIXS and SIPRNET networks.
Using privileged level access, test and integrate emerging tools, technologies and capabilities such as Cisco Internet Operating system (IOS), Cisco NXOS, ASA firewalls, authentication, F5 load balancer, Spectrum Network Monitoring data packet routing, switching, proxy services, and engineering for IP data networks, VPNs, IPSEC, FlexPod Data ONTAP Operating in 7-Mode Deployments, Nexus Switches, Fabric Interconnects, Netscout, Wireshark, Linux, Windows 10, Windows Server 2016, SQL 2016, Exchange, System Center Operations Manager (SCOM)System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), Knowledge Management System (KMS), Disaster recovery, Commvault and additional third-party technologies based on Government requirements.
Experience installing, configuring, administering and troubleshooting WAN acceleration technologies such as Riverbed products and hands-on experience with KG-175 and KG-250 series of National Security Agency (NSA) encryptors in classified and coalition networks and working knowledge of management software such as GEM X and ViaSat VINE Manager.
Experience in multivendor firewall Ports, Protocols, and Services Management (PPSM), working knowledge of system provisioning, network connection requirements.
Maintenance and administration of Microsoft Enterprise products and tools interrelate in order to ensure NetOps capability integration in support of the classified missions on mission networks such as CENTRIXS and SIPRNET networks.
Create, maintain and update documentation; back up, retrieve, maintain, and migrate programs and data.
Qualifications:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience: BA 7 - 12

Clearance: Secret

IA Certification: IAT-II (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, CND, SSCP)

CE Certification: CCNA or MCSA or VCP or equivalent

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:
Sitting for long periods
Standing for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings
Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl as required
Travel by land or air transportation 10%
It is the policy of NCI to provide equal opportunity in recruiting, hiring, training, and promoting individuals in all job categories without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected class or category as may be defined by federal, state, or local laws or regulations. In addition, we affirm that all compensation, benefits, company-sponsored training, educational assistance, social, and recreational programs are administered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity. It is our firm intent to support equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in keeping with applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. NCI is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
job_description_requirements: Knowledge Management System (KMS), Disaster recovery, Commvault and additional third-party technologies based on Government requirements.  Experience installing, configuring, administering and troubleshooting WAN acceleration technologies such as Riverbed products and hands-on experience with KG-175 and KG-250 series of National Security Agency (NSA) encryptors in classified and coalition networks and working knowledge of management software such as GEM X and ViaSat VINE Manager.  Experience in multivendor firewall Ports, Protocols, and Services Management (PPSM), working knowledge of system provisioning, network connection requirements.  Experience: BA 7 - 12

NCI will provide services defined in the contract, including capability management, project integration, process development, Information Assurance (IA), cybersecurity, configuration management (CM), hardware/software support, as well as support functions such as database policy definition, requirements development and management and technical writing.

Capability Manager
Assist the NETCOM G-3 in development of enterprise services/capabilities, including registration and maintenance of systems registered in the CIO/G6 Army Portfolio Management System (APMS) system.
Assist the NETCOM G-3 in development of concepts of operations (CONOPS), functional requirements documents (FRD), Enterprise Technical Procedures (ETP), and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).
Assist the NETCOM G-3 in development of Change Configuration Release and Management (CCRM) Deployment Plan, doctrine, policies, processes, standards, After Action Reports (AAR), RMF supporting documents and other supporting documentation.
Support NETCOM G-3 in developing and supporting key solutions for service/capability implementation, fielding, and operations, including concepts, architecture, requirements, and integration (between tactical, operational, and strategic levels of operations) analysis for related solutions throughout the Army Enterprise.
Assist the NETCOM G-3 in development of operations of the Army’s LWN and segments of the DoDIN; and coordinate with other Army Commands, installations, key personnel, and industry partners to develop and implement a plan to transition, migrate, and onboard organizations.
Assist with scheduling and coordination of Authorized Service Interruptions (ASI).
Provide information, analysis, and recommendations on the required force structure requirements (organization, training, and personnel), and changing roles and responsibilities associated with the migration, onboarding, and tiered provisioning of Operations and Maintenance (O&M) support.

Clearance: Secret
IA Certification: IAT-II (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, CND, SSCP)

MCSA or CCNA or VCP or ITIL intermediate or equivalent

It is our firm intent to support equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in keeping with applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. NCI is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

job_description: Marketing Advanced Analytics & Business InsightsDecision Science Consulting Practice Chicago, NJ, AND CA Regions Why Us Private and Growing! Unique opportunity to play a leadership role in the growth of our consulting and advanced analytics business for pharma and biotech. We have a solid foundation of analytics talent and client relationships, to lead the next level of growth for this team. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. job_title_2: Software Development Manager - Product Classification AI
정리된 job_title: Software Development Manager - Product Classification AI
job_description:
Master's/Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or related technical field10+ years of experience developing software5+ years of experience managing diverse and technically deep software development teams (Java, Python)3+ years of experience working with science, Data Warehousing systems, Cloud Computing and AWS technologiesResults oriented person, ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environmentExcellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences, including non-technical

Amazon Selection and Catalog Systems (ASCS) builds the systems that host and run the world’s largest e-Commerce products catalog. Within this organization the Browse Classification AI team is seeking an experienced Software Development Manager for leading initiatives in Product Classification. The problem space consists on developing systems capable of classifying all products into the Amazon Catalog at high precision, scaling across marketplaces and languages.

You will lead a team of Software Engineers and build distributed systems that are partially or entirely powered by AI and ML. Your team will build solutions ranging from automatic product classification, detection of misclassified items, scaling human tasks through active learning, building applications for analyzing product composition, mining product signals such as images, text and unstructured data to drive true understanding of product knowledge. You will be entirely responsible for the charter of scaling to new marketplaces, build Globalized models able to classify products across different languages and new catalogs. Our mission is to ensure that customers browsing or searching always find the right products in the right destinations for navigation and discovery purposes.

This role requires hiring and expanding an engineering team to work with cutting edge machine learning, natural language processing and artificial intelligence. You and your team will be always looking to deploy creative solutions to real world problems, working closely with partner Scientists. Your developments are directly related to Amazon’s Browse and Search experiences and impact millions of customers.

The ideal candidate has managed teams productionizing ML-based systems in one or several of the following fields: Web search, Deep Neural Networks, Classification Systems, Clustering, Natural Language Processing, Personalization, Artificial Intelligence. A successful candidate will have an established background in building innovative systems from inception to production, scaling systems with large data sets, developing customer-facing experiences, and making data-driven decisions.
Responsibilities include:
Hiring, developing, and mentoring software developers, and managing investments that accelerate scaling for new marketplacesOwning the strategic planning and execution for long-term projects, creating value for our customersCollaborating effectively across multiple software engineering, applied science team and retail businesses to distill requirements that impact their customer experiencesReporting on the status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management

PhD preferred in Mathematics, Computer Science, or related disciplineMore than 5 years of industrial/academic experience in building applied ML systems based on Deep Neural Networks, NLP, and Computer Vision, delivered to productionDeep understanding of distributed and service-oriented architectures; delivered large scale commercial enterprise software systems or online servicesProven track record of inventing simple solutions to solve complex challenges, and contributions that have advanced the field.Experience in delivering systems at scale similar to Amazon

job_description:
Position Overview
Beyond Limits is seeking a Senior System Admin. In this role, you will be expected to support our on-premise network infrastructure, as well as our cloud and application-based resources. You will need to understand and support the automation of redundant tasks through automated scripts, as well as support the general needs of our development team, and day to day IT operations. As a system admin at Beyond Limits, you will be working in a fast-paced environment, and have the opportunity to manage projects of different types and lengths. You will be embedded in our strong IT team, but also have the autonomy to work independently and learn new and emerging technologies.
Job Duties/Responsibilities
Assist in streamlining processes through Powershell scripting; particularly for onboarding purposes in Active Directory group management,
Create virtualized environments to assist our development teams
Work on maintaining and administering Office 365 environment; including Office365 Powershell administration
Supporting an AWS and on-premise hybridized networking environment
General network and server maintenance; including but not limited to Cisco switch and Fortinet Firewall monitoring and patching, wireless and VPN maintenance, etc.
Support expanding international systems and infrastructure
 Minimum Qualifications
B.S. in IT, CIS, or related degree
Certification In one or more of these areas; CompTIA Network+/ MS Windows Server Certifications/ CCNA, or other similar certifications, strongly desired
6+ years of experience using Active Directory/LDAP user and group administration in medium sized companies
Strong Powershell/Automation skills a must
Managing server virtualization technologies Partiulary HPe/VMware
A solid understanding of LAN/WAN networking
LAN Routing and Switching design, configuration and troubleshooting (VLANs, IP Subnetting, 802.1Q)
Strong in Linux/UNIX administration
Ability to troubleshoot network issues including backbone infrastructure issues
Preferred Requirements
Previous hands-on experience working with VMware
AWS experience
About Beyond Limits
Beyond Limits is a pioneering Artificial Intelligence engineering company creating advanced software solutions that go beyond conventional AI. Founded in 2014 with a legacy in space exploration, Beyond Limits is transforming proven technologies from Caltech and NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory into advanced AI solutions, hardened to industrial strength, and put to work for forward-looking companies on earth. We leverage this unparalleled innovation portfolio, along with proprietary cognitive technologies, to help companies solve tough, complex, mission-critical problems and transform their business. We apply a unique hybrid approach to AI, combining numeric AI techniques like machine learning with higher-order symbolic AI and expert human knowledge to deliver intuitive cognitive reasoning and information. Our cognitive computing technology mimics human thought processes and provides explainable reasoning to aid human-like decision-making.

Beyond Limits provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Beyond Limits complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Beyond Limits expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Beyond Limit’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

job_description:
Job Description

Come and join us! Intel is seeking highly qualified candidates to join our Intel Federal team within the Data Platforms Group (DPG) as a Technical Program Manager!
Intel Federal LLC is a wholly owned subsidiary of Intel Corporation with responsibility for managing business with the U.S. Federal Government. We collaborate with Intel Business Units and the Federal Sales & Marketing Group to develop programs that align to Intel strategies. Intel Federal utilizes the specialized systems, procedures and controls needed to develop and manage contracts with the U.S. Government.
As a Technical Program Manager, you will manage both programs and projects that are directly tied to the development, implementation or upgrade of technology or products for external customers. This includes managing programs of large (may be global) scope, impact and complexity through all phases of the lifecycle. Additionally, you will manage interdependencies and integration among multiple projects, teams, and stakeholders. You will have decision making authority at the program level and will handle cross organizational programs of broad scope and moderate to high complexity usually managing a core team that manages functionally specific teams.
Additional responsibilities and job scope will include, but are not limited to:Sets direction for programs directly related to corporate policies or important business operations to meet strategic goals of significance.Leads the core team and guides performance of functional teams.Is the key interface with stakeholders and leadership internally and externally.Assigns overall tasks to others managing general areas of responsibility in support of program goals.Exercises judgment and discretion to develop solutions, remove obstacles and redefine approaches.Recommends or sets business strategies or corporate policies and deviates as appropriate.Oversees identification of tasks and research, dependencies, costs; assigns resources, and communicates expectations to core team members.Creates/tracks/adjusts the program schedule.Assesses risks and identifies solutions to timely, efficient achievement of program goals.Ensures that quality standards and budget constraints are met.Ensures appropriate progress against schedule and takes remedial action as appropriate.Prioritizes utilization of resources with other functions.Influences business unit or cross-organizational strategies relevant to program goals.
The ideal candidate will have the following skills in addition to the qualifications listed below.Has advanced understanding of the technical concepts, architecture, systems, development methods, and disciplines associated with the defined program, and utilizes knowledge to accelerate project completion.Must be a team player with demonstrated experience in technically influencing others at all levels of the organization, including senior management within a customer's organization.Excellent written and verbal communication skills necessary to lead at all levels of the organization.Excellent analytical skills.Tolerance for and experience working in ambiguous situations.
In this position you will gain invaluable experience which will allow growth and expanded opportunities within this business group as well as future possible opportunities with other business groups within Intel.
The Data Platforms Group drives new products technologies from high-end co-processors for supercomputers to low-energy systems for enterprise and the cloud, as well as solutions for big data and intelligent devices. The group is a worldwide organization that develops the products and technologies that power 9 of every 10 servers sold worldwide.

Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Minimum Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field plus 9 years of industry work experience, or a Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field plus 6 years of industry work experience, or a PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field plus 4 years of industry work experience.7 plus years of experience leading cross-site product teams (systems, software, ingredients) with a proven track record of meeting project commitments.7 years of experience with Implementation and management of complex processes and tasking teams while working cross-divisionally.5 years of experience managing project costs (planning/tracking/EAC), schedule, risk management, and change control processes.5 years of experience managing effective external customer relationships.Current Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information clearance.
This U.S. position is open to U.S. workers only. A U.S. worker is someone who is either a U.S citizen, U.S. National, U.S. Lawful Permanent Resident, or a person granted Refugee or Asylum status by the U.S. Government. Intel will not sponsor a foreign national for this position.
Additional Preferred Qualifications:Experience with US Government (USG) funded contracts and a working knowledge of USG regulations (FAR, CAS regulations) governing such contracts.Experience working with teams that are writing responses to Requests for Proposals (RFPs) with the USG.General business acumen
Inside this Business Group

The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Other Locations

US, Maryland, Columbia

Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance....

In this position you will gain invaluable experience which will allow growth and expanded opportunities within this business group as well as future possible opportunities with other business groups within Intel. job_description:
Our Fortune 500 client in the New York City Metropolitan Area is seeking an accomplished Consulting Director, Data Strategy with strategic mindset and significant practical hands-on experience, to lead the architecture and drive the design as well as implementation of the state-of-the-art data processing, analytics, and reporting capabilities across multiple technology domains. The Consulting Director, Data Strategy will have the opportunity to influence, differentiate, and guide business and technology strategies by establishing the robust data capabilities that will enable the client to deploy solutions in a rapidly changing ecosystem. This position will collaborate with Enterprise and other lines of business technology stakeholders and may have the opportunity to influence global enterprise data initiatives.

Job Responsibilities include:
Build and lead a Data practice to help drive legacy modernization, cloud enablement, client & partner data exchange capabilities, and operational efficiency solutions to evolve our systems of interaction, systems of integration and systems of records
Develop Data Architecture framework including blueprints, solutions, principles, design patterns and standards as well as coach, train, and develop other technical staff on data best practices and solutions
Lead and influence Data initiative discussions and decisions with key stakeholders including Technology Teams, Enterprise Architecture groups, Cloud Enablement Partners, and service providers
Leverage experience and perform appropriate due diligence to make well informed build or buy decisions for Data management platform capabilities in our rapidly growing and evolving environment considering speed to market and customer needs in mind to deliver business outcomes
Assist in the development and maintain a metadata management and repository strategy to manage all enterprise information architecture project artifacts
Collaborate, co-create and develop relationships with business, technology and enterprise teams across the organization by partnering, sharing and leveraging best practices and solutions
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline OR equivalent relevant experience
10+ years of demonstrated technology leadership experience implementing large scale data management and exchange projects with at least 7 years of experience as a Data Architect or deep involvement in Applications and Integrations Architecture
Must possess an engineering mind-set and have experience with Operational Data Stores, Enterprise Data Warehousing, Data Marts and iPaaS products
Strong design and implementation background enabling data exchange with customer facing Web and Mobile applications
5+ years proven experience architecting solutions related to distributed applications, monolithic solutions, legacy databases (DB2, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.)
2-3 years of implementing unstructured data solutions (Hadoop or equivalent products) data streaming capabilities (Kafka or similar) and unstructured data cloud-based solutions (i.e. AWS - RDS)
Deep knowledge of on-premise and cloud data security patterns and standards
Proven experience driving legacy modernization including decomposition and modularization of monolithic platforms
Experience delivering Data evolution roadmaps and technology blueprints for large programs and transformations
Experience in leveraging data for machine learning, artificial intelligence and cognitive computing use cases

job_title_2: VP Senior BSA Systems Intelligence Manager
정리된 job_title: VP Senior BSA Systems Intelligence Manager
job_description:
Overview:
Drive the maturity of the BSA/AML/Sanctions Program strategy and roadmap which includes identifying and managing innovation initiatives including performing proof-of-concepts, conducting industry research, analyzing vendors and tools. Use knowledge of latest AML innovative risk mitigation methodologies and approaches and industry best practices to recommend future state of the Program and develop a prioritized list of execution plans to transform current systems/processes to target-state.
Responsibilities:
Leads research and analysis of latest industry tools and methods related to the FinTech and RegTech space leveraging concepts including but not limited to artificial intelligence, machine learning, distributed ledger technologies, robotics process automation, big data, graph databases, etc.
Prioritizes initiatives in a logical value-stream with executable plans using an Agile framework to demonstrate value.
Performs vendor/tool proof-of-concepts, vendor/tool analysis, and clearly articulate assessment summaries to leadership.
Leads as the Process Champion and Change Agent to assist the Bank in maturing and transforming the AML program. Effectively articulate the value-driven initiatives and purpose of change across the organization and gain buy-in from all levels of management and workforce.
Leads technology and other stakeholder discussions to decide on the target-state ensuring the platform and architecture is scalable and sustainable to mitigate the Bank’s current AML risks as well as future risks from the anticipated business growth.
Leads discussions to determine the target-state AML processes including by not limited to automating the risk assessment and required monitoring from new program onboarding, implementing rule tuning techniques, deploying segmentation, and enabling dynamic workflows.
Manages the strategic program execution towards achieving the roadmap target-state.
Monitors of the program to identify process improvements and updating the roadmap where applicable. Summarize findings in a clear, concise manner, and communicate results and project progress to senior management.
Presents analysis and summaries to executive and senior management, auditors and examiners. Creates effective presentations and recommendations with supporting evidence to drive program objectives.
Maintains documentation to support regular audits and exams. Assists management in preparing materials required for audits and exams.
Maintains awareness of BSA, OFAC, USA PATRIOT Act and current related regulations, directives, and guidance as it impacts FCRM processes, systems and technology. Participate in external opportunities to gain knowledge of software/platform applications and functionalities aligned with FCRM initiatives.
Develops close working relationships with various departments including operations, advisory, business, and technology.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience Requirements
An undergraduate degree in a related field or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
Seven years BSA/AML/OFAC and compliance experience, including seven years testing and validating BSA/AML/OFAC models, seven years tuning and optimizing BSA/AML monitoring and detection systems and seven years in a leadership or management role.
Preferred Requirements
Seven years management consultant experience (preferably from a Big-4).
Seven years defining key risk metrics, dashboards, and analytics for senior management and executive reporting
One year of FinTech tools experience including cross-border AML technology, RPA/Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence toolsets
Knowledge of FinTech/RegTech concepts and trends.
Knowledge of financial math, financial economics and/or statistics, including clustering and factor analysis.
In depth understanding of BSA/AML and OFAC regulatory requirements, technology, and data analysis best practices to guide decision making and execution of AML technology and enterprise wide AML initiatives.
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Strong problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills with the ability to apply defined methodology to monitoring processes.
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently.
Team player able to work effectively in a team fostered, multi-tasking environment (preferably with experience related to Agile-based projects).
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Visio, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook).
Demonstrate ability to appropriately work with confidential information.
Employment with The Bancorp includes successfully passing a background check including credit, criminal, OFAC, education and past employment.

The Bancorp is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

job_description:
Skydio is the world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial transportation. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, and operational excellence to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users - from action sports enthusiasts to first responders to insurance claims adjusters.

We are looking for a driven Program Manager with a deep sense of ownership to lead and drive all aspects of implementation and delivery for our federal customers. You will be Skydio’s federal customer liaison and broadly responsible for the success of our contracts to include: cost, performance, scheduling, project planning, technical execution, risk management and problem solving. Internally, you work hand in hand with Engineering and Sales to develop plans, solve problems and communicate risk and progress to executives. A successful candidate will become an indispensable bridge between federal customers and Skydio’s extremely agile and world class technical teams. This role reports to the Sr. Director of Customer success and will work closely with our Product, Engineering, and Sales functions to deliver industry leading autonomous solutions on schedule.
How you'll make an impact:
Be a highly collaborative, requirements driven planner with a deep sense of ownership and accountability and willing to roll up sleeves and dive into the details.
Understand customer requirements and translate them to Skydio’s agile technical team to drive development and delivery execution.
Establish relationships with Government customers and be technical enough to build & drive plans with Skydio’s engineering team’s to meet milestones.
Inform Skydio and customer business and program leaders regarding contract management risks and opportunities, ensuring a coordinated and comprehensive approach to service delivery across the program.
Be a SME in Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), FAR supplements and other Government contracting regulations to ensure Skydio compliance.
General support of go-to-market & business activities as required.
Desired Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and a strong focus on project management tools and concepts.
Proven track record of implementing new technology, agile development and interfacing with technical teams to deliver on customer schedules.
Successful management of services contracts and/or projects within the Department of Defense or other Federal Customers.
Experience with firm fixed price, indefinite demand indefinite delivery contracts and Other Transaction Authority Agreements
Experience with DOD and commercial Unmanned Aircraft Systems and related software development.
Government Program Management experience, to include: Technology Assessments, Systems Design, Systems Analysis, Programmatic Support, Acquisition Planning, and Budget Planning.
Understanding of the DoD acquisition process, the FAR, and DFAR
Ability to address complex procurement related matters and recommend solutions to acquisition challenges
Ability to obtain Secret or Top-Secret Security Clearance
Ability to travel 40% of the time
Ability to obtain Part 107 certificate.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_title_2: Director Biostatistical Programming - Statistical Programming Technology & Support
job_description:
Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical need and leverages its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential.
The Director Biostatistical Programming Statistical Programming Technology & Support Head will provide strategy and leadership for Statistical Programming technology, platforms, innovation investments and capabilities. Aligns priorities with IS, GDO functions, CfDA, and other data sciences functions. Develop the strategies to realization utilizing the modern technologies and data sciences approaches enabling modern programming capabilities and automation.
Responsibilities:
Leader responsible for the development, architecture, technology & operations, and innovations on the platforms, tools, and automations to drive statistical programming deliverables & capabilities
Provide strategy in platforms, and ensure future capabilities including automation, RPA, and machine learning opportunities to drive efficiencies and services
Designated team leader responsible for project prioritization and deliver at portfolio level
Provide technical leadership and guidance for application programming & support team
Accountable for quality and system compliance for GSP systems, platforms, and services
Promote standard and consistent strategy and approaches to statistical programming
Provide input in the development and review of GSP SOPs and other controlled documents
Provide consistent and ongoing leadership in staff career development
Manage staff performance and oversee staff assignments and utilization for the TA
Work cross-functionally to establish and maintain priorities on projects impacting GSP
Recruit and develop departmental staff
Basic Qualifications:
Doctorate degree and 4 years of relevant statistical programming/systems engineering/application programming experience in a clinical development or life sciences setting
OR
Master’s degree and 8 years of relevant statistical programming/systems engineering/application programming experience in a clinical development or life sciences setting
OR
Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of relevant statistical programming/systems engineering/application programming experience in a clinical development or life sciences setting
AND
4 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources
Preferred Qualifications:
MSc or higher degree in quantitative or scientific subjects
10+ years of relevant statistical programming or Software Development experience in a clinical development environment supporting statistical programming
Clinical programming technologies knowledge for data collection, curation, and analysis (SAS, ProgR, Python, RAVE, other technologies)
Experienced leader with systems architecture, platform technologies including ASP, Cloud, and other technologies
Experience working effectively in a globally dispersed team environment with cross-cultural partners
Excellent oral and written English communication skills
Strong negotiation skills
Prior staff development leadership and project management experience
In-Depth experience in project management to enable deliverables done on time and to a high quality
Working experience with clinical trial data
Working experience in submissions, ad-hoc tasks, and complex data mappings
Working experience with external Functional Service Providers (FSP) or CRO
Experience of data sciences, automation, and artificial intelligence in support of stat programming activities
Thorough understanding of TA (e.g. oncology, general medicine, etc) standards
Expertise with other programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, ProgR, or S-Plus)
Working experience with external staffing providers
Ability to train others
Amgen is committed to unlocking the potential of biology for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics. This approach begins by using tools like advanced human genetics to unravel the complexities of disease and understand the fundamentals of human biology.
Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical need and leverages its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential.

Join Us

If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.

Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.

As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job_description:
10+ years of highly technical and analytical IT experience.5+ years of design & implementation experience with distributed applications.5+ years of technical knowledge of Manufacturing industry applications, platforms, and data ecosystem.Experience in the Manufacturing industry or in consulting with customers in the Manufacturing the industry.Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies.Working knowledge of cloud technologies.

Are you experienced in manufacturing supply chain, product design, automation, or production operations? Are you passionate about helping manufacturers and suppliers modernize their technology, leverage IoT and Machine Learning technologies?

The Manufacturing industry is under pressure to reinvent itself leveraging digital, cloud, mobile, and IoT technologies. AWS is looking for a technologist who understands business and technology trends impacting the Manufacturing industry, to build solutions with leading technology and consulting companies. You will be leveraging the richness of the AWS cloud computing platform to position and drive the right technology solutions for our partners, shape the future industry solutions ecosystem, and address changing industry business needs.

As a solutions architect focused on Manufacturing partners, you will have the exciting opportunity to support our partners disrupt traditional approaches to manufacturing supply chain, product design, automation, or production operations. You will be able to establish customer and partner trust, and nurture adoption of the AWS cloud computing platform across AWS’s most strategic Manufacturing technology partners.

As the right candidate, you will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of global businesses, and be deeply familiar with complex, legacy IT environments including applications, middleware, storage, networks, information security, and operations. Furthermore, having an understanding of the broad Manufacturing sub-segments (e.g. process manufacturing, discrete manufacturing, traditional auto, aerospace, OEMs, and hi-tech) will be helpful. Experience with the cloud isn't a requirement but familiarity with it impact on the manufacturing industry is valuable.

This position may be based out of any location with a local Amazon office, including but not limited to: Seattle, WA; Portland, OR; San Francisco, CA; San Jose, CA; Irvine, CA; Dallas, TX; Houston, TX; Austin, TX; Chicago, IL; Atlanta, GA; Herndon, VA; New York, NY; Boston, MA; Detroit, MI.

Up to 30% travel is required.

job_title_2: Business Development Manager - Industrial Automation/Electronics Industry
정리된 job_title: Business Development Manager - Industrial Automation/Electronics Industry
job_description:
From digitalization to electrification and automation, Siemens is changing the world you live in and the places you work. Being part of our company lets you solve complex challenges, every day. Our people help to move the world forward. We are 351,000 innovators creating a new vision for the next generation! Come Create with us!

Our Digital Industries Business is looking for a dynamic Business Development Manager in California!
Position Overview

The Siemens Industry – Factory Automation business unit is looking for a someone in the Electronics Industry to lead and purposefully expand our footprint within strategic key accounts. You will be able to craft account business plans based on the global strategy and develop the agreed measures and opportunities. This role will directly contact customers and lead them to the next decade of success with our rapidly growing Digital Enterprise portfolio.

This is an outstanding opportunity to join a strong team providing the best end to end industrial automation solutions in the market. Siemens is leading the charge in providing innovative solutions to bolster the manufacturing renaissance in the US.

Responsibilities

Develop and maximize the strategic account penetration
Coordinate global business of the accounts with Siemens
Prepare and present commercial proposals and global support
Expand long term partnership with accounts
Prepare account business plan for assigned accounts and follow up with sales

job_title_2: Senior Software Development Engineer, DNAC Assurance and Analytics
job_description:
Who We Are
Cisco is transforming the networking industry. To make this happen, we are heavily investing in a team responsible for The Network Intuitive. We are disrupting the industry by building a new networking platform that can learn, adapt, and secure itself at the speed of today’s businesses. This Digital Network Architecture platform automates network management and provides our customers with state-of-the-art analytics and insights. This team's innovations span artificial intelligence, machine learning, analytics, IoT, security, automation, and more.

Who we are looking for?
We are looking for a Senior development engineer with the strong knowlege and experience in building analytics application.As a Senior development engineer, you will be involved in the design and development of various features for DNAC assurance application that provides state-of-the-art analytics and insights.

Candidate should have the following skills and experience: 10+ years of experience in building various applications using Java in a Micro-service architecture Experience in building scalable stream processing applications using Kafka, Flink, Cassandra, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch. Experience with cloud computing services like AWS, Azure, etc. Ablity to work across cross-functional teams to discuss and close on the technical solutions Experience with log management tools such as Kibana, Grafana Strong understanding of operating systems, file systems Experience working with wired and wireless network technolgies is an added advantage. Very strong analytical and problem solving skills Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to work with large, geographically and culturally diverse teams
Why Cisco
At Cisco, each person brings their unrivaled talents to work as a team and make a difference.

Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better. We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart-Cities to your everyday devices. We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.

Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

job_description:
Senior Software Engineer
Location: San Diego, CA

This position reports to: Senior Manager, Development
ServiceNow is the leading enterprise cloud. Our SaaS solutions generate revenue of ~$2B annually, and we are still growing over 30% YOY. We are looking for strong developers to help us build out an early stage, fast growing product.
With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.
We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.
What you get to do in this role:
Work as a key technical engineer on Servicenow’s critical Configuration Management Database product.
Working in a Scrum-based Agile development process that is light on documentation and meetings and heavy on coding
Designing and implement software that is simple, intuitive and easy to use that will allow customers to extend and customize the functionality to meet their specific business needs
Playing a key role in the design and implementation of new products and features while also enhancing the existing product suite
Translating requirements and mock-ups into fully functional features by working closely with business and product owners, and creative designers
Collaborating with product managers and user experience designers to deliver delightful experiences
Building rich, modern web and mobile web experiences that are accessible, progressive and responsive
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
Over 5 years of experience designing and building scalable reusable products/components
Passion for software development, debugging and problem-solving. We are seeking engineers who want to work across technologies and development environments/languages
Strong knowledge of Java, REST, HTML and JavaScript
Strong problem-solving, debugging skills and an aptitude for learning new technologies
Solid understanding of data modeling and databases (MySQL preferred)
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented design, and design patterns
A strong understanding of how applications perform at scale and how to diagnose and improve the performance of applications
Strong written and verbal communication
Must be comfortable with juggling multiple priorities with the ability to manage time effectively
The ability to lead and mentor developers with less experience
Bachelor’s/master’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline
It would be even better if you have:
Experience with creating enterprise software in the one of the application domains in which ServiceNow competes
Experience developing on the ServiceNow platform and API’s
Ability to create high performance, scalable systems
Experience in machine learning or applied artificial intelligence techniques.
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

job_description: Aerial Applications is a software company that uses drone based images and artificial intelligence to create maps. Our maps have been used to manage construction, help first responders, and save endangered species. Our long term goal is to create the software backbone for fully autonomous mobile systems. We’re venture-backed, with customers like the US Air Force, Comcast, Belfor, etc.If you love the idea of working in an emerging field with cutting edge technology and solving massive problems, this is a great company for you.This is the perfect role for an engineer looking to take ownership of their own domain, while working within a passionate team. And there’s never been a better time to explore drone technology: As they become more widespread, we’re finding more ways to leverage simple drone imagery into industry-changing data. With offices in Washington, California, New York and New Mexico, we are looking to hire team members capable of working in dynamic environments, who have a positive attitude and enjoy collaboration. job_description:
As a Software Validation Engineer, you will be part of a team working towards NIO’s autonomous vehicle vision. You will be responsible for the validation of the Autonomous Driving System. Your responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
Responsibilities
Developing and maintaining code to validate firmware functionality
Developing and maintaining documents, including test plans and reports
Developing and maintaining test automation stations
Emulating hardware and software to validate system functionality
Executing and supporting software subsystem testing
Executing and supporting system validation testing
Executing and supporting in-car firmware testing
Coordinating with other sites and teams regarding various levels of testing
Qualifications
BS/MS Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, related technical discipline, or equivalent experience
3+ years of Software Engineering experience (Development or Validation)
Proficiency with Python, Shell, and Git
Experience with Testing and Debugging methodologies
Familiarity with Validation and QA methodologies
Ability to write readable, structured code, that can be easily debugged and scaled
Preferred Qualifications
MS/PhD Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, related technical discipline, or equivalent experience
Experience with System languages (C, etc.)
Experience with OO languages (C++, C#, Java, etc.)
Proficiency with development tools (Jenkins, JIRA, Confluence)
Experience in system-level testing of a complex hardware-software product
Experience in Automotive industry
Familiarity with Communications protocols (CAN, UDS, MQTT, REST, etc.)
Familiarity with ISO 26262 or other safety standards
About NIO

NIO Inc. is a pioneer in China’s premium electric vehicle market. Founded in November 2014, NIO’s mission is to shape a joyful lifestyle by offering premium smart electric vehicles and being the best user enterprise. NIO designs, jointly manufactures, and sells smart and connected premium electric vehicles, driving innovations in next generation technologies in connectivity, autonomous driving and artificial intelligence. Redefining the user experience, NIO provides users with comprehensive, convenient and innovative charging solutions and other user-centric services. NIO began deliveries of the ES8, a 7-seater high-performance premium electric SUV in China in June 2018, and its variant, the six-seater ES8, in March 2019. NIO officially launched the ES6, a 5-seater high-performance premium electric SUV, in December 2018 and began deliveries in June 2019. NIO officially launched the EC6, a 5-seater smart premium electric Coupe SUV, in December 2019 and plans to commence deliveries in 2020.

Equal Employment Opportunity
NIO is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

NIO US is an E-Verify employer.

job_description:
Sr. Site Reliability Engineer
Location: Salt Lake City, UT
The Sr. Site Reliability Engineer works as an operational resource for a specific software application or suite of applications and accompanying infrastructure. This includes providing mid-level and escalation support for other groups and working to resolve production issues in conjunction with development, operational, and architectural resources.



As a Site Reliability Engineer, a Typical Day Might Include the Following:

Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement.
Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning, and launch reviews.
Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
Practice sustainable incident response and blameless post mortems.
Participate in ownership of entire stack for specialized product, including software and infrastructure elements.
Provide material support for production issues which cannot be resolved by lower level support resources.
Communicate solutions effectively to technical and non-technical peers and customers to improve capabilities of lower level support resources.
Coordinates and works on multiple cross-functional base work initiatives and projects.
Participates in planning long and short term project efforts.
Supports multiple systems or applications of medium to high complexity.
Works with project managers to assign resources to project tasks.
Leads or provides technical direction for the planning, execution, and validation of testing work.
Provides technical guidance and coaching/mentoring to team members.
Writes and maintains technical documentation for supported application(s).
Follow established processes when performing work or help document and create processes as necessary.
Document troubleshooting steps and results in appropriate locations for historical access.
Ensures compliance with policies, procedures, and standards.
Implements or coordinates remediation required by audits/assessments, and documents as necessary
Handle new turn up requests and assist implementation in bringing new customers on board.
Identify potential application defects and work with developers to document and resolve such issues.
Provide on call support for high priority incidents

To Land This Gig You'll Need:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Information Systems, or related field (or equivalent work experience) is required.
7+ years of production IT experience
5+ years of experience working within public or private cloud environments.
4+ years of experience working in a Windows and Linux based environment including both production and test systems.
6+ years communicating in English in a technical field.
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Experience working with management, engineers, architects, developers, etc.
Can work on complex issues which may span multiple applications or environments.
Proactively engages with peers to discuss issues and keep stakeholders updated.
Coordinates work with peers
Shares discoveries and best practices
Learns from others within the team and on other teams
Self-Driven. Proactively looks for ways to improve
Able to work with little supervision and complete tasks and projects as directed.
Great written, verbal and presentation skills
Strong customer focus
Experience thoroughly testing solutions before making them available to others
Preferred Experience:

Experience working with international team members
Experience with one or more of the following: C#, C++, Java, Python, Perl, Ruby, PowerShell, Shell
Container Experience with Amazon ECS, EKS, Kubernetes, and/or Docker
Database experience
Automation Platforms – Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Salt, TrueSight Automation, VMware vRealize


ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s #1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.
