job_description:
Our Opportunity:
Chewy is hiring a Senior Software Engineer for our Marketing Engineering Team. Our engineering team is responsible for building and managing the tech stack supporting our PetMD & PetCentral sites. The team is also responsible for building high performing API's to identify audience in real time and serve the right marketing content to them.

Chewy's mission is to empower pet parents to make smarter decisions about products for their pets. We do that by making the industry transparent through artificial intelligence and data. As a part of that mission, the Marketing Engineering team builds platforms to serve content to the website, maintains ever growing digital assets, maintains SEO compatibility and powers several content sites.

Expectation of the prospective candidate is to provide hands on contribution to SDLC process from design, development, testing, implementation, and support of applications. In this role, the ideal candidate will engage in iterative development, testing, contributing to the overall growth and development of one of Chewy's fastest growing areas. This energetic individual will partner with both technical and business teams on multiple initiatives and collaborate to deliver new features and enhancements. The role will have tremendous visibility in the technology & business organization of Chewy.

What You'll Do:
Design and build new features and services that powers the site and customer experience

Drive and advice on technical decisions and collaborate with talented peers

Review code, implementations and give meaningful feedback that helps others build better solutions

Establish strong working relationships at all organizational levels and across functional teams

What You'll Need:
5+ years of experience in Software Development as a software engineer

Fluency in 1 or more programming languages such as PHP, Javascript and database technologies

Working experience of Open Source Content Management Systems, like Drupal and WordPress

Working knowledge of modern frontend technologies and framework like React, Vue, jQuery, Html & CSS

Knowledge on developing and integrating API's with modern Web Content Management Platform is a plus

Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development lifecycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

Strong Computer Science fundamentals – object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

Sharp analytical abilities and proven design skills

Work in an agile development environment, collaborating with Application Development and Architecture teams

Experience with designing, building and deploying scalable, highly available systems

Strong communication skills as well as experience in mentoring and educating your peers

Bonus:
Drupal 8 experience

AWS development experience

Web Content Management experience

Accessibility & SEO experience

Service Oriented Architecture

Asynchronous programming patterns

Large scale public facing websites

If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at our company, please contact HR@Chewy.com .

To access Chewy's Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here: Chewy Privacy Policy ( https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy ).

job_description:
Compass is building the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers, and sellers through technology. Before Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the Artificial Intelligence that cloud, mobile, and AI technologies enable.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry larger than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform the real estate industry. In 2019 we tripled the size of our Product & Engineering team, and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the engineering organization to join us as we continue to expand in 2020.

You are a senior full stack engineer who is passionate about creating a fantastic user experience and you feel it is critical that your voice is heard in product and business decisions. You love to learn, and equally love to share your knowledge with others. You are a great communicator and you take care to understand before making yourself understood. You will participate in all aspects our our development and provide expertise on both front and back end.

You are comfortable working on any part of the stack, from making a great interface to debugging our distributed infrastructure. Your code is architected for modularity and re-use. You have strong opinions on code structure and style. You also possess strong algorithmic and data structure knowledge.

What We're Looking For:
BS in CS or EE or equivalent

6+ years experience in Java, Go, Python, or other server-side language

3+ years of experience in Javascript and CSS

3+ years experience with a Javascript framework (React preferred)

6+ years of experience in writing complete, well-tested, database-driven web applications

RESTful API design

In-depth understanding and hands on experience with a relational database (Postgres preferred)

ln-depth understanding and familiarity with a document-oriented database like Mongo

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Check out our Engineering blog !

BS in CS or EE or equivalent.  6+ years experience in Java, Go, Python, or other server-side language.  3+ years of experience in Javascript and CSS.  3+ years experience with a Javascript framework (React preferred).  6+ years of experience in writing complete, well-tested, database-driven web applications. job_description:
Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado Springs, CO?


Then join our Raytheon Technologies team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.


Raytheon is seeking Software Engineers for the Defensive Cyber Operations for Space (DCO-S) program to provide Software Development support to SMC/ECXCO and the U.S. Space Force (USSF) to protect the U.S. Space Enterprise. The new Software Engineer would assist the SMC/ECXCO in the execution of an agile-based program to rapidly perform system development, acquisition, fielding, and product support across multiple DCO-S product lines, and utilize the Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) Pipeline and SAFe principles to enable rapid software development practices.

Qualified candidates should be able to provide engineering support and expertise to identify and resolve complex problems across the Detect Product Line. Research, evaluate, recommend, document, and implement technical solutions based on the Detect Product Line requirements. Provide support to develop and document development processes.


Qualified candidates will be expected to:

Apply software subject matter expertise to execute the software development lifecycle and achieve DCO-S program development priorities
Provide expert level issue resolution and recommendation support to achieve desired program outcomes
Apply DevSecOps principles following software quality assurance, software test automation, and software hardening and cybersecurity testing practices to deliver secure code and applications
Develop unit test plans for developed software and conduct automated software unit testing
Provide support to developmental and operational testing for the DCO-S ‘Detect’ Product Line
Analyze, interpret, and document test data and prepare technical reports (to include recommendations) for use by engineering and management personnel
Provide Engineering support with relevant Enterprise level data and processing center expertise, collaborate with software engineers and other scientists in design and testing of computer hardware, circuits, and related components in support of the Detect Product Line
Identify and resolve complex problems across the Detect Product Line. Research, evaluate, recommend, document, and implement systems, equipment, technologies and solutions based on the Detect Product Line requirements
Provide Software Engineering support to plan, develop, and design software solutions for the Detect Product Line in accordance with applicable government standards
Conduct Software Development as part of the agile-based DCO-S Program
Apply knowledge of Data Science Methods, Intelligent Agents, Pattern Recognition, Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Apply knowledge of modern UI/UX design, soft software architecture, website development, object oriented design, distributed systems, cloud-native design, and web services
Provide support to Configuration Management (CM) and administer Software Configuration Management (SW/CM) activities and processes for establishing and managing rapid changes that occur in the DCO ‘Detect’ Product Line
Apply relevant knowledge of Space and Cybersecurity missions and programs
Prepare/update briefings and reports as required
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) required
Demonstrated ability to work effectively and has an ability to work independently with minimal supervision, and ability to proactively engage with and advise government and contractor support
Demonstrated ability to work multiple project efforts and interface with multiple contractors, Government, and US military personnel at various levels

Required Skills:

Minimum of 4 years of experience in computer science, software engineering, or related discipline.
Experience with developing software on an agile-based program.
Experience developing software using CI/CD Pipelines and DevSecOps
Some level of experience with Scripting and Programming Languages: Java, C++ and/or Python
Some level of experience with Applications/Frameworks: Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana (ELK Stack), React.js, and/or React Native
Experience with Unix, Linux, Ubuntu Server, Arch Linux, and/or Fedora Core Linux
Some knowledge and experience with Software Quality Assurance, Software Test Automation, and Software Hardening and Cybersecurity Testing practices

Desired Skills:

Some level of experience with Scripting and Programming Languages: Bash, JavaScript, JSON, Perl, R, HTML, CSS, PHP, C#
Experience developing solutions using Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Experience developing software for Web and Cloud-based systems
Experience with relational data sets using MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite, and/or Oracle
Experience with Data Science Methods, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Experience maintaining Software Factory CI/CD Pipelines: Git, GitHub, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Helm
Experience with unstructured data sets using NoSQL and MongoDB
Experience with Robot Framework, Selenium, and Fortify
Agile SAFe Training and Certification

Required Education (including Major):
Requires a bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 4 years of prior relevant experience

Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon Technologies. View it here: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEds
162233

job_title_2: Senior Full Stack Engineer - US CIS R-SYNC (0520F)
job_description:
Senior Full Stack Engineer
About the Organization
Now is a great time to join Redhorse Corporation. Redhorse specializes in developing and implementing creative strategies and solutions with private, state, and federal customers in the areas of cultural and environmental resources services, climate and energy change, information technology, and intelligence services. We are hiring creative, motivated, and talented people with a passion for doing what's right, what's smart, and what works.

Position Description
Redhorse is seeking a highly experienced Senior Full Stack Engineer for an Agile software development project in support of a U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) initiative to advance services and technologies using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to integrate records and systems. The Senior Engineer will be a key member of a cross-disciplinary team to deliver a minimum viable product that integrates Machine Learning approaches to enable adaptive/intelligent software in a comprehensive software development, security and operations (DevSecOps) environment.
Responsibilities for this position include:
Identify, articulate, and discuss relevant questions with stake holders and accurately document requirements and groom stories, and review it with the stakeholders
Guide junior team members in defining acceptance criteria, help them commit to realistic delivery dates, be able to assess the progress of work, and support them to resolve impediments
Spot knowledge and skill gaps and be able step up to fill them; coach team members in the process of developing the required new skills
Minimum Basic Requirements for Skills, Experience, Education, and Credentials:
A minimum of 7 years of relevant work experience in Agile/Scrum practices
Ability to obtain and maintain a DHS Suitability clearance
Minimum of a bachelor's degree in computer science or similar engineering discipline
Full-stack development experience in the context of ETL, feature-engineering in the cloud.
Building RestfulAPI using Python Flask, and Java SpringBoot. Profiling and performance tuning JVMs and compute instances
Unit, Integration, and Performance Testing using Cucumber, PyTest, Selenium for test-driven development
Front-end: One or more of VueJS, React, or Angular; ECMAScript
Data Visualization: D3.js or similar libraries
Working knowledge of Node.js, NPM, and Maven
Storage: Experience in programming and tuning at least two of NoSQL, Relational DB, GraphDB (Cypher QL), or Multimodal databases
Environment: Strong understanding of Linux and ability to script common tasks using BASH/ZSH, SSH and other Linux utilities
Automation: Working knowledge of setting up, coding, and maintaining CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and common plugins
Source code management: Working knowledge of GitHub, and GIT command line, and best practices
Additional Preferred Skills, Experience, Education, and Credentials:
Active DHS Public Trust clearance
AWS Certification(s)
Redhorse Corporation shall, in its discretion, modify or adjust the position to meet Redhorse’s changing needs.
This job description is not a contract and may be adjusted as deemed appropriate in Redhorse’s sole discretion.
EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

Senior Cloud Engineer with Streamsets mandatory
API management platforms & providing / consuming RESTful APIs
Relational Database Architecture (SQL Server/Oracle/MySQL/PostgreSQL) experience
Experience with one or more NoSQL technology (MongoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J, Couchbase, CouchDB, Hadoop HDFS, HBase, Hive, etc.)
Experience with implementation of Event driven architecture using Streamsets, Kafka, Spark or similar technologies
Experience with one or more of the following programming languages (.Net, .Net Core, Java, JavaScript, Python, C#, C/C++)
Knowledge of, and experience in Agile Scrum methodology as well as software development lifecycles in general
Experience authoring reference architectures and other engineering documentation
Prior project architect and/or Lead Software Engineer experience
Experience delivering and deploying cloud native data solutions on one of the public cloud providers such GCP, Azure or AWS.
Azure certification
IBM Watson or such AI platform or technology experience would be a great plus
Requirements
Streamsets is mandatory
ABOUT TA DIGITAL
TA Digital is the only global boutique agency that delivers the “best of both worlds” to clients seeking to achieve organizational success through digital transformation. Unlike smaller, regional agencies that lack the ability to scale or large organizations that succumb to a quantity-over-quality approach, we offer resource diversity while also providing meticulous attention to the details that enable strategic success.
Over the past 20 years, TA Digital has positioned clients to achieve digital maturity by focusing on data, customer-centricity and exponential return on investment; by melding exceptional user experience and data-driven methodologies with artificial intelligence and machine learning, we enable digital transformations that intelligently build upon the strategies we set into motion. We are known as a global leader that assists marketing and technology executives in understanding the digital ecosystem while identifying cultural and operational gaps within their business - ultimately ushering organizations toward a more mature model and profitable digital landscape.
Recognized in 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2019 Inc. 5000 list as one of the most successful technology companies in the United States, TA Digital is pleased also to share high-level strategic partnerships with world class digital experience platform companies like Adobe, SAP and Salesforce and possess global partnerships with industry leaders such as Sitecore, Episerver, Elastic Path, BigCommerce, AWS, Azure and Coveo.
TA Digital has offices in US, Canada, UK and India. For more information, visit: www.tadigital.com
EOE & OFCCP Compliant regardless of: Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / National Origin

job_description:
Description
 Responsibilities

The Senior Business Systems Analyst leads and executes the development and deployment of advanced technologies including Robotic Process Automation, Intelligent Workflow, API Integration, Cognitive learning, and Artificial Intelligence. This is an advanced position requiring broad technical expertise in a wide variety of technology areas. Responsible for the recommended approach, execution, and deployment of advanced technologies to best support business challenges

Responsible for the analysis of business challenges and the recommended approach to mitigate these challenges using advanced technologies.
Responsible for maintaining functional and non-functional specifications designed to meet business requirements
Formulates and defines scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements
In conjunction with team members, solicits and documents specifications to assist in the design of solutions based on the existing standards and processes to meet business requirements
Provides strategic support to the organization in alignment with overall Change Framework and Operating model
Guides, follows, and influences best practices to ensure scalability and resilience of solutions
Provides integrated systems analysis and identifies how application/systems could better interact to support business processes
Liaise with the other Application Developers and Business Users to recommend and deploy technology-enabled solutions that best support their needs with a risk centric mindset
Configures system settings and has oversight responsibilities for deployed solutions
Manages projects end-to-end within scope, quality and timeframe allocated
Identifies and record risks, issues, and dependencies as applicable
Participates in the support of existing technologies as required
Helps to drive organizational transformation through influence and passion
Lead and deliver TED type talks that demonstrate the ‘art of the possible’ both internally and externally
Qualifications

The ideal candidate:

Is motivated by, and enjoys complex problem-solving scenarios.
Has broad technical knowledge in addition to significant experience with any programming language including (but not limited to) Visual Basic, C/C++, C#, Java, Python, and R
Has broad understanding of project management techniques/methodologies
Possesses an ability to look at a problem holistically
Has advanced understanding of business and business systems analysis including elicitation, problem analysis, requirements specification, modeling and business process analysis
Is an expert user of Microsoft Office applications to include Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Word (including the development and deployment of VB Macros)
Is a Self-thinker and problem solver; always able to work through issues and escalate only when appropriate
Has some experience in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) using BluePrism or UI Path preferred
Has some experience with Intelligent Business Process Management tools such as Bizagi or Appian preferred
Has some experience with the development, deployment, or testing of API’s is preferred
Possesses some knowledge of Commercial banking applications, processes and business operation
Experience in an Agile environment preferred

Success Factors

Knowledge, skills & abilities that typically lead to success in the job include:
Strategic thinking
Communication
Problem Solving
Change management
Process Analysis
Technical/Functional expertise
Solution architecture
Business systems maintenance
Relationship management

Education/Certifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or 4+ years of applicable experience in Technology or Mathematics
Advanced Degree and/or Software Certification preferred

Hours & Work Schedule
Hours per Week: 40
Work Schedule: M-F (8AM – 4:30PM)
Why Work for Us
At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.
Equal Employment Opportunity
It is the policy of Citizens Bank to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.
Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran
Citizens Bank is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective subsidiaries.

job_description:
Who We Are:

We are a group of self-starters who’ve developed one of the most powerful analytics platforms for tracking sponsorship ROI, media-value exposure, and audience behavioral shifts. We are a rapidly growing SaaS company with a client roster that includes over 200 esports and sports teams, brands, and agencies.

Who Are We Looking For (We Hope It's You):


We are looking for a Senior .NET Engineer with a passion for solving coding, machine learning / AI and automation challenges.

You’re a great fit if…


You have a passion for designing, building and maintaining high-quality software that answers the demands of a growing business
You enjoy solving challenging problems and good knowledge of DevOps tools.
You want to work in a fast-paced but fun startup environment with a tight-knit and talented team


What You'll Do @Zoomph (Code Away):


4+ years of experience working with .NET Framework / Core (C# and .NET)
Experience using JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as Node.js, AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, and ReactJS
Experience building APIs and background services leveraging cloud providers i.e. Amazon Web Services or Azure
Experience working with SQL and relational databases
Experience working with Agile methodologies
Experience with unit, integration, and end-to-end testing


We Really Love You If (Bonus Points):


Experience with ElasticSearch and RabbitMQ
Experience with .Net Core
Experience with DevOps and Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Experience with Automation, ML, Artificial Intelligence Services (AWS, GCP, and Azure)


Zoomph Provides:


Competitive salary, and equity incentive plan
Excellent health, dental and vision insurance
Fun, competitive, and passionate team in the heart of Reston, Virginia

job_description:
At Pony.ai, excellence is at the core of our company. Every detail counts as we work to deliver a safe, reliable, and cost-effective autonomous driving platform to the public. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in developing and deploying state-of-the-art vehicle technology. You will have every opportunity to grow and develop as our company grows. Join us on this exciting journey as we bring the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence to the future of transportation.
As a senior electrical hardware engineer, you are responsible for:
Designing effective and reliable hardware architecture solutions for computing, sensing and control embedded systems;
Define and execution of hardware validation test plan;
Evaluating emerging new hardware technologies.
Requirements
Design experience of reliable electrical system from concept through launch
Knowledge of computation processor (CPU, GPU, FPGA, ISP or SoC) and computer architecture
Schematic design experience on embedded systems and IO interfaces
Strong EE knowledge about digital and analog circuits
Knowledge of power distribution network
Hands-on experience with an oscilloscope, signal generator, and other debug tools
Familiarity with automotive electro-mechanical system is a plus
Experience with Linux kernel, embedded software development, C/C++, python or other scripting languages is a plus
Minimum of a Masters Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent with 3+ years experience

job_description:
At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Software Security and Quality business is all about building secure software—faster. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain. All while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. To find out more about SIG, Synopsys check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html.

Software Engineer, Sr I

The Static Analysis team is looking for an exceptional C/C++ developer to join the Coverity team. The job involves the creation of new code checkers, evolving Coverity's state-of-the-art analysis infrastructure, optimizing multi-process and system code, and generally pushing the envelope of static analysis.

This position is ideal if you

Enjoy reasoning abstractly and scientifically about programming languages and software systems.
Want to enable customers to find critical security vulnerabilities before they go live.
Have a desire to quickly familiarize yourself with a broad variety of languages and technologies.

The perfect candidate will have a strong passion for improving software quality and security and preferably have a background in programming languages and static analysis, and foremost a strong desire to learn. If you have experience with any other static analysis and developer testing tools like Fortify, Parasoft, Klocwork, or Checkmarx, we'd love to talk to you!

General Responsibilities

Design, experiment with, and implement new checkers
Make improvements to general analysis infrastructure
Investigate, debug, and reproduce failures and imprecision

Key Qualifications

Experience in C/C++ development (5+ years)
Experience with Object Oriented programming and design
Experience with development on Linux

Preferred Experience

Experience or Interest with WebApp Security or Mobile Security
Experience with one or more of Java, C#, JavaScript, Go, or Python
Experience with compiler technology
Research, degree or background in programming languages and static analysis
Experience with development on Windows

Education & Certifications

BA, BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Category

Engineering

Hire Type

Employee

Country

United States

job_description:
Our mission is to protect life.
We’re out to make the world a safer place by solving big problems and taking on the public safety challenges of our time. From our company's inception building the TASER device to a full suite of hardware and software solutions, we are focused on providing police agencies with the state-of-the-art devices and services they need to successfully serve and protect us. In the next few years, we're going to eliminate the burden of paperwork in policing, so officers can increase the time they spend building relationships and serving in their communities. We’ll put video at the heart of the police record so our justice system can get to the truth faster. And we won't stop innovating until the bullet is rendered obsolete.

It’s a big mission, but it’s one we’ll pursue relentlessly every single day.

Your Impact
Today, public safety officers spend up to 2/3 of their time on the job filling out paperwork. Not only is this tedious for officers, but the never-ending pile of paperwork reduces the amount of time they can spend out in the field, protecting their communities. That’s why we’re building Axon Records, a brand-new cloud-based web platform that cuts down on paperwork so that officers can spend more time prioritizing the safety of our communities.

As a Senior Software Engineer on the Axon Records Search team, you will build a high-performance, scalable search platform to equip law enforcement officers with the information they need to document critical incidents, report their interactions, and protect their communities. And that’s just the beginning. By building a data analytics platform to gather real-time insights from criminal data to help agencies solve crimes and keep patrol officers safe in the field, you will help transform the future of public safety.

Imagine the year 2030. Advanced technology has automated more and more routine tasks to put officers back in the community, dramatically improving the quality and safety of our lives. Artificial Intelligence connects the dots and surfaces insights to help prevent crime and keep officers and citizens informed and protected.

Sound exciting? We think so too. Check out this short video to learn more about where we're heading, and apply now to join a team that's turning this vision into a reality.
Your Day-to-Day
Design and implement new features for the next generation Records Management System
Build scalable backend services
Work closely with customers and design top-priority features
Mentor junior developers on the team
Basic Qualifications
A customer-obsessed developer with 5+ years of experience in launching and operating complex web applications
Proficient in HTML5, CSS, Javascript, and component-based frameworks like React.js
Backend service experience in languages, such as Go, Python, Java, or Scala
Experience with search engine technologies, such as Elasticsearch or Solr
Strong experience with databases, such as MySQL or Cassandra
Enjoys mentoring and growing junior engineers
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
Experience designing and delivering high-availability, scalable cloud-based systems
Experience with realtime streaming event log or messaging technologies, such as Kafka or ActiveMQ
Experience using metrics (e.g. DataDog, Splunk) to triage and investigate failure scenarios
Facilitates cross-team collaboration among engineers and contributes to the broader community of senior engineers
Influences peers, advises senior leaders, coaches and mentors junior team members]
Compensation and Benefits
Competitive salary and 401K with employer match
Discretionary paid time off
Robust parental leave policy
An award-winning office/working environment
Ride along with real police officers in real life situations, see them use technology, get inspired
And more...

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_description:
At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Software Security and Quality business is all about building secure software—faster. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain. All while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. To find out more about SIG, Synopsys check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html.

The Static Analysis team is looking for an exceptional C/C++ developer to join the team. The job involves the creation of new code checkers, evolving state-of-the-art analysis infrastructure, optimizing multi-process, system code, and generally pushing the envelope of static analysis.

The perfect candidate will have a strong passion for improving software quality and security. Preferably have a background in programming languages, static analysis, and foremost a strong desire to learn. If you have experience with any other static analysis and developer testing tools like Fortify, Parasoft, Klocwork, or Checkmarx, we'd love to talk to you!

Responsibilities

Design, experiment with, and implement new checkers
Make improvements to general analysis infrastructure
Enable customers to find critical security vulnerabilities before they go live.

What we can offer you

Competitive base salary.
Annual bonuses based on personal, business unit and company performance.
Health benefits (medical, dental, vision).
Matching 401K contribution program.
ESPP program.
Monthly commute allowance.
Employee referral bonuses.
Insurance (travel, life, short/long-term disability).
Synopsys is a meritocracy (get rewarded based on merit—produce more, earn more).
You will work on top of the line equipment.

Key Qualifications

BA, BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent
Strong problem-solving skills
Experience in C/C++ development (5+ years)
Experience with Object Oriented programming and design
Experience with development on UNIX

Preferred Experience

Experience or Interest with WebApp Security or Mobile Security
Experience with one or more of Java, C#, Swift, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Ruby, Scala, and Groovy
Experience with compiler technology
Research, degree or background in programming languages and static analysis
Experience with C++ templates
Experience with development on Windows

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Category

Engineering

Hire Type

Employee

Country

United States

job_title_2: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer - Remote
job_description:
ABOUT US
Resilience360 (Wholly Owned by Rising Tide Digital) by enables companies to visualize, track, and mitigate risks in their supply chain. The Resilience360 suite of solutions enables intuitive visualization of supplier networks, tracks shipments across different modes and lanes, and permits near real-time monitoring of incidents capable of disrupting supply chains. Resilience360 provides companies a first mover advantage in detecting and verifying risks using both Artificial Intelligence and a human network of DHL employees in 220 countries and territories. Customers trust Resilience360 to ensure business continuity, identify critical hotspots to mitigate risks, and turn potential disruptions into a competitive advantage.
Born at the world's largest logistics company Deutsche Post DHL and now backed by Rising Tide Digital (RTD) and Columbia Capital, a Washington, DC-based venture capital group with a long history of investing in and scaling high growth and disruptive technology companies, Resilience360 offers a fast-paced, exciting opportunity for growth in the space of supply chain data and analytics.
POSITION OVERVIEW
RTD delivers operational supply chain insights based on data and predictive analytics. As a Full-Stack Engineer you will work within an agile team to develop and deploy applications and features that are used in customer-facing SaaS solutions for supply chain risk management. You will be using the latest in cloud-native technologies to deliver secure, highly-available solutions enabling RTD clients to reduce the volatility in their supply chain operations and increase the value of their businesses.
100% Remote Position
Responsibilities
Design and develop software to meet business requirements, perform unit tests, and fix bugs.
Scope of work will span front-end (UI/UX), back-end (APIs) and data stores.
Work closely with your team to define requirements and come up with technical solutions
Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve production issues
Create useful documentation for any tooling and services developed
Required Skills and Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
Ability to work collaboratively with on-site and remote teams
Experience meeting business needs with deliverables under tight deadlines.
3+ years of modern Python web development experience
Django
Celery
Postgresql
Redis
3+ years of front-end web development experience, including
HTML5, CSS / SASS
React
1+ years experience working delivering client-facing applications with AWS
3+ years experience with Linux / Ubuntu
Familiarity with OWASP
Bonus Skills
Experience with microservices and evented architectures.
Geospatial / GIS experience
Domain experience in Supply-Chain and/or the Transportation industry
Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity
We are committed to equal-employment principles, and we recognize the value of committed worksite employees who feel they are being treated in an equitable and professional manner. We strive to find ways to attract, develop and retain the talent needed to meet business objectives, and to recruit and employ highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities in which we live.

Summary
Posted: May 27, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200168853
Would you like to play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction? Come join the Siri team at Apple. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Build groundbreaking technology for artificial intelligence. Transform the way people keep up with the world and work with the people who crafted the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking. This team is looking to deliver the next generation of voice assistant technology to hundreds of millions of customers worldwide.
Key Qualifications
Strong Computer Science fundamentals including familiarity with algorithms, object-oriented programming, and design skills.
Strong object-oriented programming and design skills
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
Full stack development experience
3-6 years of professional/industry software engineering experience.
Description
The Siri team is looking for someone with a combination of strong programming skills and a creative, user-focused mindset. Additionally, someone who can analyze metrics and make data-driven decisions. You will be an outstanding teammate who can collaborate with engineers in several technical areas that have crafted the entire range of Siri's capabilities. You should be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment with rapidly changing priorities.

• Creating and implementing natural language interactions and work flow that provide intelligent user assistance
• Writing software across multiple domain areas, using client code and full stack systems
• Collaborating with cross functional teams to capture requirements, understand dependencies, define architecture, and implement solutions to well-defined projects
• Working with design and client-side teams to ensure a phenomenal user experience

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.

Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. job_description:
EnsoData, a fast growing, venture-backed startup based in Madison, WI, is seeking an experienced candidate for the position of Senior Frontend Engineer. Reporting to the CTO, this role is a fundamental part of the EnsoData technology team that will take leadership of critical customer-facing application interfaces.
Our goal at EnsoData is to provide artificial intelligence powered software services that create massive cost and time savings for frontline clinicians, allowing them to spend more time with patients and less time with data; improving both patient and provider satisfaction, and patient outcomes. Our first product, EnsoSleep, uses our machine learning engine with big data to save clinicians hundreds of hours per month by automating one of the most arduous and repetitive data annotation tasks in all of healthcare; sleep study scoring.
Requirements
The mission for the Senior Frontend Engineer is to deliver outstanding user experiences and interfaces that delight end-users. This is accomplished by designing and building modern web applications that allow users to intuitively visualize and interact with the wealth of data generated within core EnsoData products.

Outcomes
Build out and maintain EnsoSleep Customer Dashboard
Develop HIPAA-compliant support ticket interface
Design and build customizable report generation templates
Include support for a variety of major browsers
Incorporate a user-friendly mobile viewing experience
Implement a system for gathering and analyzing user interaction data
Build out and maintain internal system monitoring dashboards
Interface for managing customer client application configuration
Dashboard for monitoring services vital to the customer
Competencies
Job
5+ years experience as a frontend or full-stack engineer
Expert in Python, Flask, React, Redux
Experience with designing, building and testing high-quality web applications
Experience with implementing user analytics measures
Bonus: experience working within a HIPAA complaint environment
Culture
Gets things done
Goes above and beyond
Doesn’t cut corners
Shares knowledge
Spreads good vibes
Delights customers
Benefits
In addition to a competitive salary, significant equity in a high-growth startup, and other benefits as added, the Senior Frontend Engineer will have a transformative impact on company culture and success. In this position, you will have the opportunity to grow personally and professionally to help build a world-class engineering team, own critical EnsoData product initiatives, and serve as a key member of the EnsoData technical leadership team.

job_title_2: Senior Python Developer - Cloud Computing, GPU
job_description:
We are now looking for Software Engineers who see the big picture of Cloud Computing and AI. This essential role will give you a rare opportunity to craft and deliver a new class of GPU services for Cloud Computing in the fields of Deep Learning and AI. Your work will create tools to drive Deep Learning, AI and Visual Computing.
What you'll be doing:
Design, build and implement Python SDKs and CLIs to interact with Cloud GPU Services.
Help drive the underlying technology stack and the implementation methodology.
Work closely with other teams on new products or features/improvements of existing products.
Drive performance tuning and automation.
Support, maintain and document software functionality.
What we need to see:
BA in CS or equivalent practical experience.
5-8 years of hands-on experience in Python.
Experience writing Integration and Unit tests in Python.
Experience developing Python client code that works across Windows, Linux, and Mac
Experience with RESTful web services.
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills required.
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Show previous experience with developing Python CLI and SDKs.
A track record of solving complex problems with elegant solutions.
Demonstrate delivery of complex projects in previous roles.
NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern Artificial Intelligence — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company”. We are looking to grow our teams with the smartest people in the world. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and talented individuals in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Company Description

Atollogy's mission is to make operational excellence easy and accessible for companies of all shapes and sizes. Atollogy’s proprietary algorithms and capabilities are revolutionizing how companies manage operations by integrating the physical world with artificial intelligence. Our team of Atollogists has more than 100 years of combined manufacturing industry experience with diverse and unique backgrounds.
If you are passionate about building IoT-based big data solutions for enterprises and are looking to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing startup, then look no further than Atollogy!

Job Description

We’re looking for a Senior Engineer "Full Stack" engineer who will primarily be responsible for developing features and services that put the power of Atollogy's end-to-end integrated machine-vision platform into the hands of our customers. Not only are you excited about developing new features, maintaining existing code, and fixing bugs, you are driven to use all of your experience and more to create real, useful technology solutions and customer value.
Key responsibilities:
Build useful stuff people want.
Develop data intensive customer facing web applications, report interfaces and data feeds.
Design clean end-to-end user experiences by implementing web and/or mobile interfaces using XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Work closely with our product & CSM teams to define feature specifications, core functionality, and help build the next generation of products leveraging frameworks such as Angular, React, D3, or other applicable components.
Apply your knowledge of software architecture, backend app-servers, databases, front-end frameworks, and API design expertise to create coherent, flexible application infrastructure.
Optimize and troubleshoot your applications end-to-end to ensure responsiveness and correctness of the user-experience.
Work closely with devops to build and scale back-end services.
Take operational responsibility for the components that you write.
Have an opinion and an open mind.

Qualifications

5+ years of programming experience using Javascript and Python-3.x
5+ years of experience with a mix of relational, document, and NoSQL databases.
5+ years of experience with foundation level web technologies: JavaScript, XHTML, CSS
3+ years using recent Javascript UI & backend frameworks, like react.js, AngularJS, Node.JS, etc.
Have proficiency and comfort wielding a variety of new technologies along with existing assets to deliver high-value solutions addressing immediate customer needs.
Excellent verbal and written skills.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job_description:
Senior Quality Analyst - (SO00069369-1-1-1)


UST Global is a private high growth organization headquartered in Orange County California and is a leading provider of Advanced Computing and Digital Services for Global 1000 companies worldwide. Our next-generation digital consultancy is the ideal place for you to grow your career. Are you up for the challenge? Read on!

Description

Sr QA Automation Engineer

UST Global is a leading provider of platforms, digital innovation, artificial Intelligence and end to end IT Business services and solutions for Global 1000 companies. We are transforming corporations through deep domain expertise, knowledge based ML platforms, as well as profound anthropological efforts to understand the end customer and design products and interactions that create delight. We are deeply committed to developing a comprehensive understanding of our clients problems and to develop platforms to address them.


We are looking for experienced SR QA Automation Engineers with 8 years of experience in testing large scale J2EE implementations. The primary objective of the QA Lead is to lead the QA efforts of one or more products as well as manage technical risks throughout the project. The QA Lead is responsible to establish the QA processes within the team, also to set up automation suite. Senior QA should mentor and supervise the QA analysts in the team. job_description:
Senior Full Stack Engineer
Onsite | Full Time

Syllable is a Series A funded startup company in Sunnyvale, California. We develop intelligent assistance through text and voice using natural language for high-value interactions. The initial product focus is in the healthcare sector. We’re in production and working with large hospital systems. Syllable uses artificial intelligence to improve the patient experience and help healthcare systems deliver better care. Our artificial intelligence has been trained to understand the interactions between patients and the healthcare system, as well as the interactions between staff within the healthcare system.

Our mission is to provide intelligent assistance with machine learning technology for interactions between an organization and an individual that involves multiple human participants.

Syllable currently develops technology in the following areas:


Decision tree understanding
Information extraction and semantic parsing
Language understanding and dialog building
Machine learning and theory formation
Question answering
Visual knowledge extraction and automated visual understanding
Task understanding and automated workflows

Position Summary
As a Senior Full Stack Engineer, you'll be responsible for architecting, building, and maintaining the web applications and backend services that will power our customer experience. This includes:


Designing and building backend web services and APIs to power web applications
Designing and building modern and responsive web applications using state of the art web application frameworks
Building out our technical infrastructure to meet the demands of a growing user base
Taking ownership over projects end to end, bringing them from vision to reality
Working with product owners from creation of vision to QA of final product
Establish best practices for our codebase, building reusable, testable, scalable and well documented code.

Additionally, as a lead engineer you will have the opportunity to:


participate in our research projects
working to develop the long-term technical vision
taking a leading role in implementing a customer pilot through supporting the software development process
helping to develop collaborative and strategic relationships with relevant academic and industry organizations

Applicant
Applicants should have experience designing, building, and maintaining web services and web applications from scratch, and should have participated in several iterations of a product launch. This is a technical leadership role that will give the opportunity to establish a core part of our company's technology.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

BS degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience
3+ years of prior full stack experience in modern web services / web application development
Development experience in Python, JavaScript, Java, or C++
Experience with markup languages such as HTML
Experience with structured data development using data representations in XML or JSON
Web application development experience

Preferred qualifications:

Significant experience developing customer-facing software
Experience engineering software systems of medium-to-large scope and complexity
Knowledge of web libraries and frameworks such as React, AngularJS, Polymer or Closure.
Familiarity with the whole web stack, including protocols and web server applications
Experience developing applications for Amazon AWS or Google Cloud Platform

Work Environment
Our work environment focuses on the following core values


We value diversity of thought and believe diverse backgrounds and different approaches to problem-solving can contribute to our mission
We are a learning organization and we strive, with empathy, to customers we serve as we build better human-computer interfaces
We are collaborative and transparent and respect our customers. We believe transparency is critical to serving our industries
We work diligently to create a workplace that supports work/life balance. As a team we want our work ethic to include serving the needs of our families at home

Thank you for your consideration.

job_description:
Company Description

The Kinetica Active Analytics Platform combines streaming and historical data with location intelligence and machine learning-powered analytics. Organizations across automotive, energy, telecommunications, retail, healthcare, financial services, and beyond leverage the platform’s GPU-accelerated computing power to build custom analytical applications that deliver immediate, dynamic insight. Kinetica has a rich partner ecosystem, including NVIDIA, Dell, HP, and IBM, and is privately held, backed by leading global venture capital firms Canvas Ventures, Citi Ventures, GreatPoint Ventures, and Meritech Capital Partners.
For more information and trial downloads, visit kinetica.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

Job Description

Kinetica Active Analytics brings together all key elements of active analytics in a unified platform: historical data analytics, streaming data analytics, location intelligence, and artificial intelligence. The Kinetica Active Analytics Platform is cloud-ready and dramatically simplifies the typical architecture for smart applications, with unmatched performance.
At Kinetica, we are looking for a hands-on Solutions Architect to join our growing consulting team. We are more than doubling annual revenue year-over-year, and our enterprise customers are growing proportionally. As a member of our Professional Services team, you will help our customers achieve their goals and solve their most complex problems using Kinetica.
You will:
Partner with our customers in developing a solution for a new proof-of-concept for the logistics industry
Translate business requirements and problems into solutions
Design, build and deploy modern, mobile, and web applications
Collaborate with Engineering, Sales (Pre and Post), Support and other Professional Services team members
Have fun!

Qualifications

Top Secret Clearance
BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent
Strong Java development skills (Spring Framework, MVC, JDBC, REST)
Experience with SQL (Oracle)
Strong understanding of Data structures and Algorithms
Solid development of modern UI design concepts
JavaScript (JQuery, Angular, D3)
React Native
Android or iOS development (bonus)
Data Science (using Python)
Soft Skills:
Great communication skills (verbal and written)
High-energy self-starter with a passion for data, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment with limited direction
Additional requirement
Willing to travel
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job_description:
Jacobs is currently seeking a senior software developer or autonomy engineer for our Dayton office. Successful candidates will have a background in Software Development/Engineering (C++ or Python).

-Conducts research in design, development, testing and utilization of electronic data processing software.

-Designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions.

-Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software.

-Determines computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. Ensures software standards are met.

-Analyzes user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.

-Confers with systems analysts, engineers, programmers and others to design system and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces.

-Designs, develops and modifies software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and consequences of design.

-Coordinates software system installations and monitors equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met.

#rapidsolutions
Qualifications
 Required :

-Shall have at least 8 years of experience as a Software Engineer in software development/engineering, including requirements analysis, software development, installation, integration, evaluation, enhancement, maintenance, testing, and problem diagnosis/resolution.

-The individual must be able to communicate directions and provide guidance to junior programmer/analysts, as required.

-At least 5 years of experience developing software using either C, C++, or Python.

-Shall have experience on the design and development of at least one Object Oriented system.

-Shall have extensive experience in planning and accomplishing goals and complicated tasks and providing consultation on complex projects as top-level contributor or specialist.

-Shall have experience “wrapping” legacy systems or components as Web Services within a SOA framework or container framework (i.e. Docker).

-Shall have experience developing solutions integrating and extending FOSS/COTS products.

-Shall have demonstrated technical writing skills and have generated technical documents in support of a software development project.

-Understanding of Cognitive Architectures.

-Understanding of Convolutional Neural Networks.

-Understanding of generative techniques, both neural and other.

-Theoretical bases for artificial intelligence, machine learning, and autonomy.

-Mathematical programming experience, especially optimization and simulation.

-Experience with particular machine learning software packages, such as Café, Torch, TensorFlow, or Theano.

-Experience with AI software packages.

Preferred :

-Experience using ProbLog, Prolog, or similar software package(s).

-Demonstrated advanced mathematical expertise, especially derivations of algorithms or synthesis of controllers.

-Filter design and implementation.

-Robotics experience, especially robots within uncontrolled or adversarial environments.

-Basic understanding of computer networking and of neutral messaging tools, such as JSON and Google Protobuf.

-Experience with Sensor processing or exploitation, especially SAR, EO, and IR.

-Create new software to facilitate automatically manipulating and exploit sensor data.

-Shall have experience developing software using Matlab.

Clearance :

This position may require the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. Clearance processing will be completed by the U.S. Government. Factors considered for a U.S. Government Security Clearance include but are not limited:

-U.S. Citizenship (Required)
-Favorable Criminal History Check
-Education Verification
-Abuse/Illegal Drug Use
-Credit Check
-Subject Interview

job_title_2: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Marketing Automation
job_description:
Compass is building the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers and sellers through technology. Until Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the "Artificial Intelligence" that cloud, mobile and AI technologies enable. We are building AI to empower AI - Artificial Intelligence to empower Agent Intelligence.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry larger than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform real estate. In 2019 we tripled the size of our Product & Engineering team, and are searching for creative and inspiring colleagues at all levels of the engineering organization to join us as we continue to expand in 2020.

About the role:

You will join a talented startup team in building our Marketing Automation products and features to help agents with creating, managing, and delivering digital marketing solutions with ads across several mediums and social media. You will have the opportunity to create new features and workflows that help agents more effectively create and manage their marketing campaigns, budgets, and advertising mediums that will integrate into our Agent Marketing Center platform. You will participate in developing a number of frontend displays and backend services to render, organize, present agents with creative design capabilities to generate marketing ads and materials that are professional quality, fast producing, and align to their marketing needs.

At Compass You Will:

Build, develop and scale the frontend and backend of our Marketing Automation and Advertising Solutions that powers marketing experience for buyers, sellers and real estate agents.
Write JavaScript code that is architected for scalability and re-use. Have strong opinions on code structure and modularization.
Collaborate with product and design to move fast on creating solutions to business problems.
Inspire, recruit and mentor your engineering colleagues
Operate in a scalable engineering culture that leverages modern principles of decoupled systems and automated CI/CD/testing/monitoring to drive efficiencies

What We Look For:

BS in CS or EE or equivalent
5+ years experience in Node.JS, Java, Go, Python, or other server-side language
5+ years of experience in Javascript and CSS (Typescript a plus)
5+ years experience with NPM & JavaScript including modern frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue (Experience with Redux, ES6, Webpack is a plus)
5+ years of experience in writing complete, well-tested, database-driven web applications
RESTful API design
In-depth understanding and hands on experience with relational databases and SQL (e.g., Postgres)
Extensive experience with a major cloud provider, for instance, AWS
Experience collaborating closely with UX and Product Managers
High attention to detail and quality
Familiarity with containerization, microservices architecture, continuous integration and delivery is a plus

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Check out our Engineering blog!

job_description:
NVIDIA is seeking a Robotics Engineer focused on robot localization algorithms to help contribute to the Isaac robotics platform. As a senior engineer you are responsible for the development and implementation of algorithms and deep neural networks for example around robot localization with LiDARs, place recognition using cameras, and creation and updating a map.
For two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU we also set the stage for advances in the field of medical research, computer vision and artificial intelligence. Today NVIDIA is at the groundbreaking level to innovate robotics and intelligent autonomous machines. There has never been a more exciting time to join our company and team.
The team around Project Isaac is building a robotics toolbox to create the next generation of intelligent and autonomous robots. Isaac is combining accelerated perception and planning algorithms, deep learning, and high-fidelity simulation. All with a keen eye on deployment into real world use cases based on the Jetson AGX platform or cloud-based compute. Our team is diversified and spreading all over the world and over dozens of technological fields, and together we want to change the way robots are programmed.
What you’ll be doing:
Develop new localization algorithms or neural network architectures
High-performance implementations using C++ and/or CUDA
Evaluate your methods in simulation and on real robots
Stay up-to-date with the latest research publications
What we need to see:
MS or PhD and 3+ years of relevant experience
Outstanding programming skills in C++ and/or Python
You have excellent interpersonal skills
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Scientific publications around robotics localization
Proficiency in modern deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Proficiency in writing accelerated CUDA kernels
Exposure to robotics or similar autonomous machine development
You have a thirst and ability to learn and adapt to new technologies
Flexibility/adaptability for working in a dynamic environment with different frameworks and requirements
Check us out here:
Isaac SDK Homepage: https://developer.nvidia.com/isaac-sdk
Isaac @ GTC 2020: https://youtu.be/phP_c3zi82g?t=568
If you're creative, driven, and passionate about autonomous machines - we would love to hear from you!
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Proficiency in modern deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.  Proficiency in writing accelerated CUDA kernels.  Exposure to robotics or similar autonomous machine development

job_title_2: Senior Java Software Engineer - ArcGIS Notebook Server
job_description:
Overview
Build the next generation of ArcGIS Notebooks in ArcGIS Enterprise, a product delivering state-of-the-art web-based notebook capability for geospatial data analysis, modeling, and automation in a microservices architecture.
Our team builds cutting-edge, highly scalable, and reliable distributed software for on-premises and the cloud to make maps, geographic information, and robust analytics available on any device, anywhere, at any time. Our software engineers provide a strong technical voice in the product development process and use the best tools available to design, develop, and deliver a high-quality distributed analytical platform.
You will work with our cross functional global team of software engineers, product engineers, designers, product managers, and release engineers. You will be actively involved in enhancing the capability of the ArcGIS Enterprise platform from feature inception to delivery, using bleeding edge technology, while also acting as a leader for the ArcGIS Enterprise development team.
If you are passionate about building great distributed systems that support advanced analytical tools and workflows with notebooks in microservice architectures, join us!
Responsibilities
Build server-side Java components and web services to power user experience and geospatial workflows using ArcGIS Notebooks
Prototype, design, develop, and deliver complete software features and products that can scale, are fault tolerant, and handle concurrent workloads
Design, architect, and lead a team to build complete software features/products to meet customer requirements
Find, analyze, and fix bugs/performance problems whenever and wherever they occur
Work collaboratively with other teams around the globe to understand requirements and incorporate them into the software
Mentor and groom junior engineers through design and code reviews, technology presentations, and insights
Requirements
5+ years of experience developing middleware software components using core Java, Servlets (JavaEE), JSP, JAX-RS, web services including REST and SOAP
2+ years of experience Python development in the Jupyter ecosystem (notebooks)
Good understanding of cloud computing platforms (AWS and Azure) and services such as Amazon S3, SQS, EC2 and Azure services such as Blob Service, Table Service
Experience working with Docker, containers, and building images using best practices
Knowledge of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and deep learning capabilities in Python or R, preferably in the Jupyter ecosystem
Knowledge of relational databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL, or DB2
Experience working with large code bases using Git and proficient in debugging and profiling tools (Eclipse/IntelliJ Debugger, JProfiler, etc.)
Proficient in designing and writing tests
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with global teams
Bachelor's, master’s, or Ph.D. in math, computer science, physics, or related field, depending on position level

Knowledge of container orchestrators such as Kubernetes, AKS, EKS, or OpenShift
Knowledge of automation tools such as Jenkins or CRON
Familiarity with JSON and XML
Knowledge of and familiarity with Java build systems, i.e. Maven and ANT

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

Sr Application Analytics Analyst is responsible for the advanced analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning environments and works with HSC Business Users and project teams to understand advanced analytics requirements, develop project scope, generate creative ideas to achieve optimum reporting, designing, developing and maintaining AI solutions. They are responsible for generating complex data queries, presenting information through reports, models and visualization for all levels of the HSC organization.
Essential Functions:
Exploit current data science and reporting environment to generate insights and drive business value
Develop key metrics and data visualizations that will enable operations, optimize processes, and add transparency through increased data visibility - code, test, debug, document, implement and maintain visualizations
Understand complex data harmonization, model design, build and deploy AA|AI|ML solutions (e.g. reporting tools, modeling, data quality)
Apply data science techniques and algorithms to create predictive models and step change improvements
Work with DBA to design, create and maintain Tables, Views, Stored Procedures, Triggers and other databased objects using Transactional SQL and/or other ETL environments.
Additional Duties:
Provide SAP S/4 Integration solutions using TIBCO Business Works
Leverage TIBCO Sporfire/DataScience environment as well as data prep using MS SQL SSIS data transformation & TIBCO Data Virtualization
Mobile Reporting Application development
Work with project teams to prepare project task and development estimates

job_description:
NVIDIA is looking for a hardworking Systems Software Engineer to work on open-source container runtimes and container orchestration.
NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern Artificial Intelligence — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company”. We are looking to grow our teams with the smartest people in the world. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!
What you will be doing:
You'll be part of a small and dynamic team that explores innovative ways to make GPU-accelerated applications easier to develop, deploy, and monitor. One example is the open-source NVIDIA-docker plugin, that it is now extensively being used to deploy containers that need to access the high performance of NVIDIA GPUs.
Improve existing container runtimes, and advance the state of virtualization for high-performance applications.
Work on enabling GPUs as a first-class resource in container orchestrators such as Kubernetes, or Docker Swarm.
You will have the opportunity to research new use cases for GPUs with emerging container technologies.
What we need to see:
We would like you to have a Bachelor’s of Science in Computer Science, or related field with 10+ or more years of relevant work experience.
You possess strong programming skills in C or C++.
Strong knowledge and experience working with System internals of any Unix/Unix-like kernel such as Linux, BSD or Solaris.
Strong background in Cloud Computing and Distributed Software design and development
Exposure and understanding of container technology internals such as Docker, Rkt, FreeBSD Jails, Solaris Zones.
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Experience with the Go programming language.
Real world experience with distributed systems, especially containers, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Mesos or Nomad.
Knowledge of GPU programming such as OpenCL or CUDA is a plus.
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Strong knowledge and experience working with System internals of any Unix/Unix-like kernel such as Linux, BSD or Solaris.  Strong background in Cloud Computing and Distributed Software design and development.  Exposure and understanding of container technology internals such as Docker, Rkt, FreeBSD Jails, Solaris Zones.  Experience with the Go programming language.  Real world experience with distributed systems, especially containers, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Mesos or Nomad.  Knowledge of GPU programming such as OpenCL or CUDA is a plus

job_title_2: Senior Java Software Engineer - ArcGIS Notebook Server
job_description:
Overview:
Build the next generation of ArcGIS Notebooks in ArcGIS Enterprise, a product delivering state-of-the-art web-based notebook capability for geospatial data analysis, modeling, and automation in a microservices architecture.
Our team builds cutting-edge, highly scalable, and reliable distributed software for on-premises and the cloud to make maps, geographic information, and robust analytics available on any device, anywhere, at any time. Our software engineers provide a strong technical voice in the product development process and use the best tools available to design, develop, and deliver a high-quality distributed analytical platform.
You will work with our cross functional global team of software engineers, product engineers, designers, product managers, and release engineers. You will be actively involved in enhancing the capability of the ArcGIS Enterprise platform from feature inception to delivery, using bleeding edge technology, while also acting as a leader for the ArcGIS Enterprise development team.
If you are passionate about building great distributed systems that support advanced analytical tools and workflows with notebooks in microservice architectures, join us!
